Reviews.Title: “Needs some updating.”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie H
Reviews.Content: I need to start my review by stating that I stay at Starwood properties all the time. I think they have the best loyalty program and am always treated well at the hotels. That said, I have now stayed at the Bonaventure two times. It is a huge property constructed in the 1970's and utilizes a lot of concrete (or what appears to be concrete). The location is great right in downtown L.A. If you have business downtown you may be able to walk. You can walk to L.A. Live and the arenas in the area. However, the distance is almost a mile so I suggest the hotel offer some sort of shuttle for people who may not want to walk that distance. With the hotel competition in the L.A. Live area - this could be a strong selling point. The rooms are somewhat small. The double rooms have double beds and not the usual queen beds. The beds are also a bit soft. Overall, I think the property is nice but needs some updating. Notwithstanding, I would probably stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: RetroStewardess
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bonaventure in April for a trade show. As such, my expectations were somewhat different than they might have been if I had been paying for my stay and had I been in Los Angeles for a vacation, rather than for a trade show. I stayed on the 27th floor in the Red Tower. It was very quiet and I have to say, the room was extremely clean. I also found the staff to be courteous and responsive. Overall, I would say that the Bonaventure is a good choice when in town for business. My trade show was held at the convention center and the hotel is conveniently located, with an easy walk to shops and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “A BIT OF A LET DOWN.”
Reviews.Author: sammeydog
Reviews.Content: For us this was a good down town location, Public areas though were a let down, lots of the shops in the Hotel were empty,and generally the whole public areas needed to be brought up to date. Our room though was nicely decorated and furnished. We had a problem with a water leak in the Bathroom which was sorted out quickly for us. Breakfast was very good with a good selection of hot and cold foods available.

Reviews.Title: “Not Worth the Money”
Reviews.Author: skyman5311
Reviews.Content: I guess first of all, the fact that I do NOT like LA being from NY, may have not helped in my initial expectations of this Westin Hotel. The reviews on this hotel I have read thus far, in my opinion have been accurate and a fair description of the hotel, it's location and lack of service skills. Location: for downtown, it is fine, if downtown is what you need, I was on a business conference that was out of the Convention Center, and it required a shuttle. Everything is so far away in LA, whereas in NYC it is right down the street. It took me 45 minutes round trip to by walking to buy a bottle of water and some snacks outside the hotel about 3 blocks away. The area- Downtown LA simply is a riddled with questionable people and they are all very aggressive. Being from NYC I don't mind this as much, but others do and it is getting worse from what I have been told. Sorry, but a single waling female has no business walking anywhere in the downtown area at this point. The Hotel- definetly aged, and worn, and lacking in any type of real 4-5 star level service skills. Check in was smooth, but that was last time I spoke to anyone at the hotel who didn't have an attitude, or was too busy to be even friendly. The morning coffee service at the bar, they didn't even look at me as I ordered, so the next morning I went across the street to a local starbucks to avoid these 2. I even had questions on the hotel's services- food services, business center and could never get a straight answer or worse conflicting answers. The exception to this was the concierge whom I consulted once and he was great. The Room- aged for sure, older and useless and beat up furnishings, very thin walls but otherwise wasn't too bad. Our room did not have an honor bar, nor a TV with any hotel services/movies/etc, you would expect A Westin to have. The INTERNET: Simply stated was horrible.. They still charge 12.95 per day for this, which is why luxury hotels or luxury want to be hotels such as this, are losing share to the limited service hotels. The internet NEVER worked and when it did was so slow I could not even work on emails. We made numerous calls to the front desk, and of course they knew there were problems, but continued to tell me it would be fixed, it never was, or to come down to lobby and use free wireless signal, which of course is what I really want to do at 2:00 am when I finally have time to answer my emails. To their credit, they did not charge my room after I complained daily and took off all internet charges. LASTLY- Food and Beverage- Simply the rudest bar tenders I have ever seen in my life, made me not want to go back to lobby bar, in fact I didn't after my second night. The very over priced breakfast at I believe $24.00 for a buffett was ok, but did it only once because of the timing and the cost. Room Service took over an hour, was cold etc, but it was my last night and I expected nothing less from them as I would now of any department in that hotel at that point. This property have generally low TA scores for its level and brand and it is now easy for me to tell why.. Will not return ever and may have to go to SPG, due to the fact I paid nearly $300 per night and don't feel I had the service level returned.

Reviews.Title: “Bad location”
Reviews.Author: Traveljunkie511
Reviews.Content: Unless you having business meetings in downtown LA this is not the best hotel. I was in LA for vacation and even walking downtown on almost every street corner is a homeless person approaching you asking for money. The hotel was nice but there surrounding area was less than desirable.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Gigem31
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week for a conference and was very disappointed in my stay for the amount of money it cost to stay here. Other reviewers are right, you can hear your neighbors loud and clear through the walls/vents! I also could hear the elevators go up and down all night and I was not even staying in a room right next to them. The rooms are sort of pie shaped so they are probably a tad smaller than a regular hotel room. Other than that the rooms were clean and the beds were very comfortable...in fact it was one of the best beds I have slept on in a hotel. As an fyi, the rooms come with an in-room safe big enough for a laptop if you should need it. Dining and shopping choices in the Hotel are mediocre. I thought this would be a plus in staying here, but there are much better options down the street. Be sure to venture from the hotel out to other nearby eateries as there are some really good places to eat within several blocks.

Reviews.Title: “Great Views, Clean Room, Convenient Walk To L.A. Live”
Reviews.Author: Rock-Subculture
Reviews.Content: As a preface, I travel to a limited degree to review rock concerts, and have begun to include hotel and resort reviews as well, which I am republishing here is modified form. This review is for The Westin Bonaventure Hotel & Suites in Los Angeles, during my recent Los Angeles Trip (February 2012). Room Type/Class: Traditional Room Date: February 7-10, 2012 Overall Rating: 4/5 This trip was explicitly to attend two concert events - one at Club Nokia and the other one in Hollywood. I lived and worked in Los Angeles for many years while I was in graduate school, so I'm really familiar with it. Since Club Nokia is part of L.A. Live, I thought it made sense to find a hotel that is within walking distance of L.A. Live, which put me downtown. I considered the Marriott and the Ritz-Carlton that are part of L.A. Live, but they were much more expensive compared with The Westin Bonaventure's Hotwire price. I ended up deciphering a "hidden" discounted offering on one website to purchase on another, and found that The Westin Bonaventure was the hotel being offered within that class range for a highly discounted cost off the base rate, and booked it. So the hotel has valet parking, but it is an additional $35 per night. If you don't mind walking a block or two, I noticed that there appeared to be some other public parking alternatives that would be cheaper; I ended up using the valet, which is underground and you walk down a hallway adorned with movie poster one sheets of films shot at and around the hotel (see photos below), and up an escalator toward the main entry level where the front desk is located. Check-in was quick and otherwise unremarkable. I had originally booked two nights, but one of my events was canceled and rescheduled... I asked if I could add a night at the discounted price, and was told they couldn't sell rooms at that price, but the guy at the front desk looked in his computer to see their occupancy for the desired night, and more or less indicated that if I went on that reseller website again, I would likely be able to add the third night at the same reduced rate (when I went up to my room, I was able to do this and add it on). I was actually really excited to check out the elevators, as there is a scene with Arnold Schwarzenegger in True Lies where he goes up one of the elevators on horseback; the gentleman at the front desk was able to direct me to the exact elevator I was seeking. As for the room itself, I had the basic/base room, and was pleased that it was on one of the higher floors (better views). While on the small side, it was very clean and nicely appointed, as I've learned to expect from Westin properties. Maybe because it is an older property, the shower and bed are maybe not as "Heavenly" as some other Westin properties, but overall the room suited my needs perfectly (traveling alone) with king-sized bed and computer desk. Internet connectivity via WiFi was good but not spectacular. For me, the best bonus of the room was the view. Most of the outward facing wall is glass floor to ceiling, as the view was spectacular, particularly at night. There are some amenities in the hotel that I just didn't have the time to use - restaurant, bar, etc. As noted, I had come to L.A. for a concert at L.A. Live, and found that it was definitely a reasonable walking distance from the Westin Bonaventure - maybe too far for some people's taste, but I walked back and forth several times and I don't think it took more 15 minutes. Overall, I don't have any complaints at all, though it would be nice if valet parking was included, but I knew from my research ahead of time that was a cost to factor into the overall value proposition of the stay. When I attend a future event at L.A. Live, I would likely return to the Bonaventure, unless there is a special deal at one of the competing properties.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Gem”
Reviews.Author: Eltee_loves2travel
Reviews.Content: The Westin Bonaventure is a gem in Downtown LA. Since the recent remodel, the accomdations are above and beyond. The classic glass elevator adds to the experience. The room is your typical superb Starwood quality. This is a perfect place for an LA Staycation. It's centrally located to all the Downtown action.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: Mohikaner
Reviews.Content: On checking in we asked for a room on a higher floor, we got it (26th floor). We requested in our booking a king sized bed, we got it. The bed was huge, lying in the middle you couldn't touch the sides. The bed was very good plenty of pillows - it was part of our honeymoon trip. We loved the view and in our jet-lagged state enjoyed watching the sun rise every morning from the bed. The curtains were left open for most of our 4 day stay. It's the second time I have stayed here - the first time was for a large conference in 2010 - this time I got to see a little more of the hotel. Everything is contained within the building including several fast food outlets on the floors above the lobby. At one stage we tried to get to the rooftop for a better view but ended up in the steak restaurant. Perhaps we got lost. I can't remember the cost of wifi in the room but it was for free in the lobby. In fact if you go down to level 5 in the elevators and then walk down one level you get a very quiet booth seating area which still receives the free wifi signal from the lobby. It's a good airy bright quiet place to check your emails. There's also a small indoor circular track one floor below that level for running. The guest elevatots go from lobby level to level 5 - for the shops do it the old fashioned way and take the stairs. Transport around this hotel is good - we went as far as taking a bus from Beverly Hills and it stops a block away from the hotel. Cool. I think the metro was 3 blocks away - but close to a Ralph's. We had a door to an adjoining room which was kept locked. I guess the people in that room were on their honeymoon too. There was one little attention to detail that I appreciated. I often leave my reading glasses next to the bed when I fall asleep. Housekeeping folded my glasses and put them back into my case for safe keping when refreshing the room. Thanks for that!

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful 4 night stay...”
Reviews.Author: JForster150793
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a wonderful stay at the Westin Bonaventure on Figueroa St in downtown L.A. We were looking for a nice hotel, quick walk to the Staples Centre. We lucked out getting this hotel on our Priceline bid under 4 stars...as it is indeed closer than the Marriott, the O, and the Standard, the other 4 stars of similar quality. Being SPG who stay at Westins regularly we were given an upgrade. We read from some, that the Westin was getting dated, but did not find that, as the rooms were very updated, bathrooms large, bed "heavenly" as always advertised, front desk modern, staff helpful and professional. The dining in both the "Brew House"- 4th floor, yellow tower- was in-expensive and portions were large, they have a super Happy Hours with drinks and brew house beers plus appies for $3-$4. The "Prime" high end steak/prime rib house on the 23rd floor-red- is excellent, with superb views and a wonderful wine list, prices are reflective of a downtown steak restaurant $25- $30 entrees. Many things to do and see, close to the 7th street L.A. subway, L.A. Public Library and Macy's Centre. Great trip- we will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Just a few quirks short of great”
Reviews.Author: MrFoster
Reviews.Content: Cool and unique looking hotel; 4 glass cylinders joined by a central cylider. The lobby is a maze of water pools and fountains with the lobby bar in the center. There is a bit of chlorine smell in the lobby, but not obnoxious. The rooms are arranged around the outside of the cyliders, so the floor plan of the room are spacious, but anything but rectangular. Not that the room plans are bad, but they are definitely "different". The bathrooms are also spacious with lots of shelf space, though trapzoidial. The biggest problem is the toilet seats an lids will not remain "up" because the shelf above the toilet obstructs the path of the lids and seats. The staff are all very polite and friendly. The hotel is kept spotless and clean. There is an adjoining mall that has several eateries and a few shops, including a great brewpub.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we needed- Perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Lamplighter-InnMgr
Reviews.Content: Having never stayed in downtown LA, wasn't sure what to expect with this area. The hotel room was clean, bed super comfortable, and linens were superior quality. Every staff member I encountered was friendly & helpful. Yes as some reviewers have mentioned the parking is a bit pricey. But having to stay here for a nearby conference the convenience factor was well worth it. Knowing I had a full day of meetings, I was well prepared after their breakfast buffet, truly a standout for me. lox, eggs benedict, and even Kimchi.!! I would stay here again if working in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Cool location and building!”
Reviews.Author: Chica-linda
Reviews.Content: The hotel lobby is cool as are the glass elevators. The LA public library and their gardens are kitty corner from the hotel and are amazing. We just spent one night here with our son. A regular room with 2 beds is tight! Also while the rooms have all been re-done and are pretty fresh, the walls between the rooms are THIN. Our neighbors were having a rousing party, lots of laughs, loud phone calls and some pretty intense use of pot and tobacco (smoke was coming into our room via the internal door - you know the one that can connect two rooms). At first I thought things would die down, but I finally called the front desk, who said security would be up. I heard them call the room next door, but I don't think anyone came in person to check up. The noise/smoke did diminish for a while but it was back in a few hours. Also the mattresses were saggy! Nice sheets though. So over all it was night of bad sleep :(

Reviews.Title: “I spent hours looking out over L.A.!”
Reviews.Author: R C
Reviews.Content: I would rate my stay in the Westin Bonaventure Hotel as very-good to excellent. I am writing this review as somebody who has never experienced a large city such as Los Angelese before. My room was clean, and had a fantastic view out over LA below and out toward the Hollywood hills. I could see the famous Hollywood sign from my bed. At night the surrounding sky-scrapers were amazing, and a carpet of lights stretched out as far as the horizon. During the day I swam in the pool on the rooftop of the hotel, 35 stories up, and had to alternate between each end as the sun passed behind the even larger surrounding skyscrapers - an unforgettable, brilliant, experience! It was a short stay at the Bonaventure, and I only managed to try one of the main restaurants, and one of the take-away eateries inside. Finding a suitable place to eat for me was not so easy, but perhape that was due to the sheer size of the place. The staff were helpful, and gave directions and advice for me to travel to around the city on public transport - I took a bus and travelled to Venice Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view and beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: yungiftblk
Reviews.Content: My 16-year old neice and I visited in April 2012. When asking about location and hotel choices based on what we wanted to do, many people encouraged us either to stay downtown or to rent a car. Well we didn't have a choice, so we not only didn't rent a car, but we stayed downtown. I have to disagree with many posters. I really enjoyed the Bonaventure. We stayed on the 20th floor and a great view of the city and could see the Hollywood sign on a clear day. The hotel is so beautiful with the fountains and amazing elevator towers. Our room was very, very clean with wonderful linen and the complimentary coffee, tea and water. The in room fridge was nice as well. There was a robe in the bathroom, but it was far from plush anymore. Although, the hotel was away from your tourist hot spots we had no problems using the bus and sub transportation. It actually was centrally located to each. The concierge was great in helping us get around town and we were able to visit everything from Hollywood, UCLA, Santa Monica and more. I always felt safe and enjoyed the walk down to the Staples Center. My niece grab a bit to eat at two different places upstairs in the hotel and enjoyed both. They stowed our bags for us because we arrived early and departed late. My only complaint was that the pool was under construction, BUT I was able to work out in their fitness room and it they offerred water, towels, and earphones. It was really nice and spacious. I would definetly stay here and recommend it again!

Reviews.Title: “One bedroom suite was perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Bjfahs
Reviews.Content: I had to stay here for a work trip. We upgraded to a one bedroom suite to accommodate my 2yr old and 2 small dogs. It was great. The room was very clean. It was perfect to be able to put her to bed so my husband and I could relax in the next room. We had room service one night which was really good. There was a roof top restaurant and grass area. The food there was great there! It was so convenient to have a variety of places to eat right in the hotel. The only negative thing I can say is that the lobby needs a little updating.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel Downtown”
Reviews.Author: coopmke
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Bonaventure in October 2011 with my boyfriend and a friend (whom we were out in California visiting). We are all 25-years-old and stayed downtown to get a dose of the touristy Hollywood things. We got this hotel at a great corporate rate, making it a good deal for our needs... however the valet parking was VERY expensive here! And it is pretty much essential to have a car if you are staying in this area and wanting to see the sights. The hotel itself is beautiful, the lobby area had bars and restaurants to choose from as well as convenience stores, shops, etc. The room was great! Gorgeous, great linens, comfy beds and a wonderful view. Everything was very, very clean and the bathroom was large. There were nice added in-room amenities such as gourmet coffee and tea and high-end toiletries. Great downtown location puts you central to many things in LA... overall a great pick, especially if you can get it at a good rate!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in Downtown”
Reviews.Author: adishelly
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for 3 nights-4.4.12-7.4.12. Big hotel, checking in was easy. Lots of amenities such as gift shop, pharmacy, food places, and bars within the hotel. Like others have mentioned, it has a huge circular entrance lobby, with different coloured elevators to take you to the different towers. The hotel spans from Figueroa street to Flower street with entrances on both.The concierge was very helpful. The room: Spacious enough, with a lovely comfortable bed, and good coffee making facilities. the walls are somewhat thin, especially if you have noisy neighbours as we had on the last night there.They woke us up at 3am with their singing and music The bathroom: on the small side. The shower was dissappointing as the shower pressure was weak, and we could only get lukewarm water.All amenities were available, and replenished daily. Location: The hotel is a quiet part of downtown. Macy's department store is a 3 block walk away, but very dissappointing, and tiny, and looked quite rundown.The metro station is also a 3 block walk away. The location is great for using the bus to get to the Farmers market,Citadel outlets, and you needed to change once to get to Hollywood boulevard by bus. otherwise the metro can get you there in a few stops. There is an adequate selection of restaurants near by, like the Borders grill opposite, Engine co a 3 block walk away. We were expecting more of a variety of restaurants within the surrounding area, maybe we just couldn't find them. No breakfast included in the room rate, and minimal breakfast options in th hotel,pricey too. Overall: Decent location, quiet part of town,commutable by bus and metro to get to Hollywood boulevard , and the Farmers Market

Reviews.Title: “Fun, fun fun”
Reviews.Author: CraneMountain
Reviews.Content: What a fun place to stay. The staff are very polite, helpful and very nice. They made us feel as though we were the most important guests in the hotel. The elevators are also fun as they give you a wonderful view of Los Angeles. All four elevator blocks give you a different view of LA. The lobby offers free internet, which is fairly fast. The rooms are comfortable and the beds are wonderfully comfortable. We stayed for 3 nights and enjoyed the downtown location. But get real, how could a Westin hotel actually be anything else but good. It lived up to its reputation. The breakfast buffet was delicious with plenty of choice and all the food was hot when it should be and on ice when it should be cold. We had a dog with us and the hotel was extremely accomodating. The only negative is that I would not recommend the high-speed internet of 60 to 120 kB.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: BOOMBOOM50
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for one night. Fantastic service and decor. The view of LA at night is amazing. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, huge hotel but minimal amenities and $38/nt to park!!!”
Reviews.Author: gsl10408
Reviews.Content: This place was very nice but very pricy for what you get. For the price and the $38/nt for guest to park, you would think it would come with more amenities-at least a continental breakfast but everything had a fee. Even if you get a go deal on this place plan on spending your money on the rest of the stuff. Everything is overpriced. On the plus side, it's nice and our hotel had a nice view from our window. Sheets smelt though and had stains on them, almost called to have them changed but since my husband and I were only staying for one night we figured it wasn't that big of a deal. If your okay paying for all the extra's than with that all set aside, it's overall fairly nice, just couldn't get over the amount for parking and food.

Reviews.Title: “Huge hotel where you get lost...”
Reviews.Author: JDCNECSCV
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Bonaventure Hotel twice. Once in 1994 and last week. The hotel is massive, has many shops, restaurants and things to do such as a running track, pool, and meeting rooms. The color coded elevators are very confusing if you are going to the ballrooms for meetings or finding your room. The elevators did not go to the 2nd level for the meeting rooms. I ended up taking a service elevator where I found myself somewhere in the bowels of the hotel. My room was big, but my bathroom was so small I thought I was in an airplane. The counter tops have not changed. I understand the shape of the hotel, but they have to make the bathrooms bigger. There is a pungent, musty and moldy smell which is a shame as I love the Westin candles/aroma stick oils. The service however is outstanding from the valet who retrieved my blackberry cable and had the bellhop bring it up to my room without hesitation, the check in employee who made me feel welcome, and the gentleman I ran into in the basement, who redirected me without making me feel as if I was intruding on private territory. Service is outstanding but the hotel is outdated.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel in Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: Rabs-M
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin early March. The hotel itself is really nice, there is a bar/club downstairs and you get free wifi in the lobby. The rooms are a little small. however the beds are very comfortable. Our room was on the 22nd floor so we had really nice views. Overall I enjoyed my stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location in Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: Durak
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Bonaventure for two weeks on business. Overall, the hotel was fine. It's definitely a structure designed in the 1970s. Very modern then; very outdated now. The rooms are smaller that you'd expect in a hotel with the Westin name. The walls were a bit thin as well; I could hear the neighbor's tv. The most interesting aspect were the elevators -- an amazing view of LA in the glass elevators. Just don't be agoraphobic. The hotel bragged of having six floors of shops in the bottom, but most were closed, and the food was pretty terrible (except for The Brewery: great restaurant). The wait staff in the hotel restaurant ranged from outstanding and friendly to surly and unattentive. The hotel staff were outgoing and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great 2 Night Experience”
Reviews.Author: SouvenirGal
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a huge conference center and I was there to attend a meeting. The registration staff were friendly and helped me understand how to navigate with the 4 different glass elevators (they are marked with different colors and shapes). The elevators provide great views of the city. Friendly warning: My room was near one of the elevator tracks in such a way I could see who was in the elevator and what they were doing when it was dark outside (the elevators are lit). Also knew to keep my blinds closed for privacy. Did I mention the staff is top-notch? One evening my key card didn't work and a Westin employee happened by. I explained the situation and he got someone from security to come up and let me in. After she verified my identity, she let me in and apologized for the inconvenience. She offered me complimentary breakfast the next day. She later returned with a new key and slipped it under my door. When the WiFi wouldn't connect, the staff gave me a courtesy code so I could get on-line. The doormen gave great directions and were quite friendly. The room was very clean and looked recently renovated. The bed, linens, and pillows were very comfortable. All-in-all, it was a great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Like Having Neighboring Room In Mine”
Reviews.Author: Jnjtiger
Reviews.Content: Downtown LA location - if there is a Downtown LA. There for business meeting at bank, basically attached to this hotel, so convenient location. Hotel is large, rambling, hard to navigate, multiple elevator banks. Room was very pleasant until neighbors began talking and listening to TV - both done basically ALL NIGHT. Might as well have been in my room. Heard every word! Many other hotels in the area, so make another choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Robert009
Reviews.Content: Overall great experience. Staff was very accomodating. Room had a great view, but a little narrow near the door (since rooms a pie shaped). Lots of shops and restaurants. We especially felt the the brewery on the 4th floor was a real "find"--great food, low prices and super service. Outside seating too. The buffet was wonderful and asked for the same waiter every day. He really enhanced our stay. The consierges were very helpful and not overly busy so were available. The roating bar on top was a great place to eat and see the city. We would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Attention to details, Trained Staff”
Reviews.Author: chuck f
Reviews.Content: Hotel remodeled since last visit. Rooms and furnishings are first class. Amenities are great. Beds perfect. Restrooms are spacious and provide high quality amenities. Lobby is well done, great feel, and frankly with the age of the hotel it seems like they really did a nice job with the remodel Housekeeping and Front Desk were very friendly and sharp

Reviews.Title: “Large hotel with great staff and heavenly beds!”
Reviews.Author: AZGUY99
Reviews.Content: Loved my 2 night stay at the Westin Bonaventure hotel. I truly enjoyed cocktails and dinner in the rooftop restaurant. The hotel wasn't a far drive for me to visit Hollywood Blvd either. Overall, I had a restful stay at the Bonaventure and can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located - Good value”
Reviews.Author: Travel_Bea_2010
Reviews.Content: This was definitely one of the more interesting hotels I've stayed at for business. Four towers with different colour names go to different "wings" of the hotel. First the lobby - very big and basically goes around in a large circle which made it a little challenging to meet with business associates but I managed. Plenty of seating which was good. Room - It was fine, clean, bed was comfortable however the room itself was quite small which doesn't tend to bother me except that there was a door to an adjoining room hence it felt a little intimate being able to hear someone russling about on the other side. I was however annoyed about the card swipe into the room (which is amusing seeing someone else comment on this.) After checking in, I had to return to the reception as my cards didn't work to get into the room and to get them re-magnetized..... lo and behold, they still didn't work when I returned and after trying them again and again, finally managed to get the door open. Every time I returned I would have to swipe 15-20 times to get the card to register (and I stay at hotels regularly hence am not unfamiliar with how these work!) They need to look at fixing this as it's frustrating. One very positive note, after finally going to get some dinner at around 9pm I decided to eat in the lobby bar and had an amazing prawn fajita....great value too.

Reviews.Title: “good business trip hotel”
Reviews.Author: mrscatalano
Reviews.Content: stayed here on a business trip and although it does not have much 'atmosphere" going on, the hotel itself is impeccable

Reviews.Title: “Decent business hotel in downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: lovewine
Reviews.Content: A "good enough" business hotel in downtown LA. I'm not impressed by the movies that were filmed here, I don't care much about "signature scents" or "heavenly beds"...my ratings are solely based on a pass/fail system involving the following criteria. Comfortable, clean, bed - pass. Good sized, spotless bathroom - pass Free wifi with good connectivity - epic fail Relatively quiet - pass Being able to get into my room with my keycard - epic fail. I was in two rooms here and had issues with the keycard in both. Lack of glass elevators which scare the crap out of me - fail Relatively helpful staffers if I have an issue - pass Decent eating choices - big pass! (just skip all the other restaurants and eat all your meals at the Health Winner & thank me later) I had big problems with wifi (not free btw - WTF?). My original room had a bad signal and the response was "well, you can connect in the lobby". After I pointed out that I really didn't went to be spending all night in the lobby reviewing my presentation + the sight of me in my PJ's would drive customers away, they moved me to a different room. If you have a fear of heights or glass elevators this hotel will give you palpitations. Otherwise, there are lots of small take out places here to get a cheap, healthy to go meal which I like. And there's a liquor store - woohoo! It's a good place to stay if you're in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient & good value”
Reviews.Author: BandBtraveller
Reviews.Content: The Westin Bonaventure was located in the heart of the LA Downtown - good for business travellers and for corporate meetings. It's situated in a business district so don't expect to have a lot of exciting nightlife in the neighborhood. The hotel was pretty big with 4 towers assigned to different color codes but were inter-connected on all floors. The directional signage could be better placed with clearer indications. A bridge connected the hotel with the adjacent World Trade Center on the 6th floor. My room was spacious enough and clean; bed was comfortable. Since I only stayed for one night I didn't have a chance to use its fitness facilities or the restaurant so cannot comment of those.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: FrancesIII
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin for a convention, it was a very nice place, we stayed on the 20th floor to keep the traffic noise down and away from the elevators so that we were assured privacy because we didn't want to close our curtains. We found nice places to eat and shop although I wish that there were more places open, with the economy that just isn't happening. I am looking forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel for business trip”
Reviews.Author: Cougar729
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel on a recent trip to LA. I was attending a conference that was at the hotel. We took a shuttle from the airport right to the hotel. Check in was easy and the front desk person was very helpful in showing us where to go to get to the elevator. We were on the 20th floor of the yellow tower with a good view of parts of the city, we could see the Hollywood sign from our room which was cool. We were told there were several places to eat and shop inside the hotel, but we didnt find much open (Sunday evening) except for a Subway. We ended up eating at the lobby resturant which was actually pretty good. We also checked out the rotating lounge at the top of the hotel. We have a couple of drinks there on our second night, good view of the city and downtown, with a quiet atmosphere. I'd say the Westin rotating lounge in Atlanta is better just because its taller and the floor moves quicker, but all in all, pretty cool experience. Our room as OK, I thought I had booked a single king bed, but there were only 2 full beds, the room was a little tight, but was ok for just 2 people, any more and it would be overcrowded. The AC/Heat vent was right above one of the beds, so if you get hot or cold easy sleep in the other. The beds were comfortable and the room had everything else you would expect, HD tv, fridge, safe, etc. The bathroom was nice size with a good shower head. We had good maid service that cleaned and replaced everything as expected as well. The location of the hotel is pretty good for downtown LA. We were a little skeptical about walking around after dark, but usually there are enough people around to be ok. We walked to LA live (about a mile) two night in a row, once after a Clippers game. All in all I would stay here again, nothing too extraordinary, but its a good place in a downtown location.

Reviews.Title: “Much better the 2nd time!”
Reviews.Author: kfitzy7
Reviews.Content: This is my second time to the westin bonaventure, and last time I enjoyed the hotel but I had major wifi issues on my iPad that left me less than pleased with my stay. On my first stay they admitted that wifi on iPads was a consistent problem, I asked about it upon check in and they assured me it was fixed, I am pleased to say this is true they have fixed their wifi issues!

Reviews.Title: “Remarkable service”
Reviews.Author: Cypan
Reviews.Content: The room was nice with incredble views. The lounge was nice on a revolving platform. The concierge service was outstanding! Location downtown is great. The price is pretty high but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!”
Reviews.Author: DisgustedGuest_54903
Reviews.Content: It's in Downtown LA and; therefore, pricey, I get that, but for the prices I expect much better. First off, I couldn't even purchase a drink from a vending machine. I had to order room service. Not cool. It took between 15-20 minutes for the shower water to warm up to a tolerable level (cold, fast showers were the norm). There was a coffee machine provided, but no creamer or sweetener of any kind. I travel a lot and I have NEVER seen that. Worst of all, there were blood stains on the linens and the edges of the comforter was held together by safety pins. For the price, I expect much better. I will never again stay at a Westin hotel especially this one. Thank God I was not the one who was paying the bill or I would have demanded my money back and found other accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced for what you get.”
Reviews.Author: JamisonS
Reviews.Content: We were excited to stay here at first. The price of the room was good until we saw the room. Small but with a good view. 30th floor is we're we stayed. Paid 38 dollars a night for parking. Are you serious? And the room walls are very thin. You can hear everything. The best thing about this hotel is the bed and pillows. Very comfortable. Location was good too, but not worth the price of admission. I've paid less for better value.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: BlancheNoir
Reviews.Content: The thing that impressed me the most about this hotel was the service. It is a beautiful hotel, as one would expect, but there was something extra professional about the service that I really enjoyed. I could tell that the employees were trained to speak to us in a certain manner, i.e., use our name, etc. but I have to say that every single staff member was not only professional in conduct, but sincere and genuine in providing service. I have stayed in a number of equally beautiful hotels, and been treated with impersonal and even contemptuous service. They go the extra mile to provide impressive professionalism, and genuine congeniality to the guests. I highly recommend the Westin Bonaventure.

Reviews.Title: “get away to LA”
Reviews.Author: AndreyK3
Reviews.Content: Nice property with great service staff. Spend there 3 days. Great for downtown destinations but not very convenient for an airport and etc.

Reviews.Title: “Huge but enjoyable hotel”
Reviews.Author: thetraveldoc
Reviews.Content: If you need a luxurious (heavenly) bed in a full service hotel in LA, this is a good choice. The rooms are clean and well designed for work. Food (late night room service and breakfast buffet) are good quality but pricey. It's a huge hotel, but the staff was approachable and pleasant. I would return.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and clean”
Reviews.Author: Oleander805
Reviews.Content: Luckily our arrival was not a reflection of our stay. Driving a vehicle over 6 feet requires oversized parking and we were sent around the buildiding by 3 dofferent attendants not wanting to be the one to deal with us. Once that was taken care of, the rest of the staff was very accommodating especially at check in. Good room service and very clean rooms. Wonderful comfortable beds, would defiantly stay again, just not drive the truck.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: RickStone70
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights here as part of a short trip to LA. Pretty much what you would expect from a 4 star downtown hotel. Expansive lobby, large hotel with lots of rooms, expensive parking, plenty of dining choices in hotel and surrounding area. The rooms themselves were a little on the small side but just fine for our purposes. The location was quite good as we were able to walk to/from the Staples Center for a basketball game and a hockey game. Very good food/beer at their onsite brewery and decent prices. Especially during happy hour.

Reviews.Title: “average hotel; you get lost in the building”
Reviews.Author: das_ubersoldat
Reviews.Content: room was ok with a nice view over downtown. the windows are thin so even on the 20th floor you have quite some street noise. there is supposed to be a huge area with restaurants in the hotel but unfortunately most of the shops are empty and there are only some fast food places and a brewery place. but it's hard to find something as it feels like a labyrinth. parking is super expensive and this applies also to the parking lot across the street. we drove in but there was no sign outside showing the prices. inside we saw a sign and we wanted to leave the building literally within 3 mins and they wanted us to pay like 30usd. we argued with them until they opened the barrier without charge. they must be nuts. put a sign outside and you avoid this.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: DeBaryTigerFan
Reviews.Content: Kudos to the staff of the Westin Bonaventure. I'm a seasoned traveler and appreciate good service. The staff was extremely attentive during my recent visit when I had an issue with some lost items. I misplaced them--they were not stolen. It took some help from the housekeeping and engineering staff to recover my items because of where they had fallen. It's a lovely hotel, but service makes all the difference!

Reviews.Title: “Have nothing but compliments for this hotel”
Reviews.Author: hctravelers
Reviews.Content: Check is was easy and they asked if I wanted a high or low floor. I wanted to be up high away from lobby noise and street noise. I was put on the 20th floor. I had an awesome view of the pool and other surrounding downtown LA buildings. The room was on the smaller side, as far as hotel rooms go and was definitely great for just me. One other person would have been ok in this double, but 3 or 4 would be out of the question. Each of the 4 towers are round with the round atrium/lobby in the middle. Each tower is color coded. You can ride any elevator, but going to your color coded tower elevator from the lobby makes it easier to get to your room quicker. The rooms are pie shaped. So as you enter the room, that is the smallest part and it expands out to the floor to ceiling, wall to wall windows. The drapes were room darkening and came together well, leaving no gaps for light to enter. There was a nice size closet, the bathroom had a marble counter top, shelves and nice plush towels. There were green bars of soap in the shape of leaves. Shampoo, conditioner and lotion was also provided. Nice large shower head with great pressure. I had 2 double beds with tons of pillows, both firm and soft and I found one perfect for me. Slept like a baby. Mattress was not too firm, not too soft, but was just right. There was a desk and chair provided with plenty of work space. There was also a coffee maker and a refrigerator. I was here for 3 nights, and mainly work late into the night and sleep later in the day. Asked front desk to make sure housekeeping would not disturb me with my do not disturb sign posted on the door. True to her word, I was not disturbed by anything. No noise from elevators, housekeeping or outside traffic. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “"Pillars of the Earth" for the Business Warrior”
Reviews.Author: LLFauntleroy
Reviews.Content: Business warriors need inspiration and juice, and this place provides it in its grand lobby cathedral, like the great churches of medieval Europe gave the folk in Ken Follett's epic novel "Pillars of the Earth". The rooms are standard 4 star fare of medium size, and you won't draw inspiration there. But the lobby, with towering pillars, fountains, glass rocket elevators, and tiered platform architecture-- that's what will make you feel good about yourself. I travel 4 stars only for business, and it helps me to be psyched up and juiced with winner drive. Plus, there is a full self service 24 hour Fed Ex Office (Kinko's) off the lobby that trumps any hotel's "business center". The circular lobby cafe doubles as workspace, we were all with our laptops, meeting clients (the fountain white noise gives confidentiality), no pressure to order any food, more like a concierge asking if you want anything to eat or drink. Plus, those glass elevators were filmed in "True Lies", with Arnold chasing the terrorist to the roof, who escaped by a motorcycle leap to the poor below. I looked at that pool from the elevator and thought of the movie with every ride. So, if you are after a large luxury room at any price, this isn't the place. But if you are ok with a medium sized room and a good rate down the cavernous corridor in the Taj Mahal, this is it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean room, good business hotel...”
Reviews.Author: JamesE339
Reviews.Content: Well, its big! The architecture is a bit strange with 'cavernous' lobby 'levels. The first through 5 floors are mixed with strange dining options, retail stores, offices and the like in what appears to have been an attempt at a Mall of shops when the property was conceived. It appears to struggle to be leased, and is filled with an odd mix. It is also a bit confusing to navigate. Very strange. Health club is large. Lobby bar is nice. Room was average size, very clean...and comfortable. Pretty much standard business hotel room. The room appears to have been completely renovated of recent. Actually, the complete hotel was renovated. Lobby areas, hallways and all public areas are fresh and new. Service was good. The place is HUGE.

Reviews.Title: “Central downtown location, massive hotel”
Reviews.Author: yankeetravels27
Reviews.Content: There are 4 towers in the hotel all are connected, but it is a massive hotel. I was on a SPG preferred floor. I believe I was in a newly remodeled room. It was a decent size, large bed. I was only there for a night, but it had it been more the bathroom and closet size would have been in a factor as they were quite small. They have a nice outdoor pool. The gym is large with several treadmills, elliptical, and machine weights as well as free weights. There are many dining options in the hotel. The bona vista lounge actually rotates which is cool and weird all at once. I didn't dine at the steak house.

Reviews.Title: “Swanky!”
Reviews.Author: trifocal3
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel while in LA. When you pull up to the front, you are directed to pull up and drive into the garage under the hotel. Make sure you factor in an additional $40 for valet (they gladly add it to the room). You are pointed toward some escalators and then you arrive at the lobby. This is more like a place you would find in Las Vegas then anywhere else. The lobby is a three story atrium with people all over the place. Lots of airline workers, they must have a corporate rate here. The center is a round bar with giant pools of water and fountains. Dim mood lighting everwhere and four glass elevators on each corner. There are shops, restaurants, and lounges all around the sides. Couches and tables around the perimeter for free wifi access. After you check in you will be pointed toward your tower (red, blue, green, or yellow) I am not sure if there is any differences between the towers. I had the red tower which boasts a revolving restaurant on the 34th floor (I tried to grab a drink at the bar later that night, but they don't have a bar...only table seating) The rooms in the red tower are very nice. I had a great view of the city (floor to ceiling windows from side to side) as well as the blue tower's glass elevator which shoots up and down with passengers throughout the night. The bed took up most of the room and is super comfortable. The bathroom has all sorts of little amenities including the signature Westin Heavenly Shower head...the pressure was equal to a fire hose. The only drawback was an early morning powerwash of one of the roof's about 10 stories below my room. I needed to get up anyways. They have an outdoor pool located on the fourth floor roof. You can see it lit up at night from one of the red tower elevators. With my check-in I received one free glass of wine at the main lobby bar. I ate dinner as well..total tab $30. Free waters in the room, kinda surprised me. I never left the hotel. I think that is the idea. I could stay for a week and not go to all the different places in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Business Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Deb7111
Reviews.Content: The Westin Bonaventure offers the business traveler a perfect haven. The newly furnished rooms are sleek, soothing, and well designed. The linens were lovely, the bed comfortable, the staff helpful, and my view was outstanding. After a long business trip, I landed at the Bonaventure and loved every aspect of my stay. Don't forget to head to the revolving bar on the top floor for drinks.

Reviews.Title: “Business of making me feel comfortable”
Reviews.Author: NurseBethany
Reviews.Content: I was in LA on a short business trip. I have never stayed at the Westin Bonaventure..what a treat. The staff were incredible. I felt like a queen my entire stay.

Reviews.Title: “Comfy rooms, well appointed hotel - but eat elsewhere!”
Reviews.Author: CultureSleuth
Reviews.Content: Five night stay for business. Hotel service was accomodating and reasonably friendly. Room was quiet, bed comfy, heat and air worked well. Hotel is massive, but the colored "tower" elevators allow for easy navigation. Only drawback - and it was really a drawback - was the food was simply horrendous! We had @ 500 people in our group, so maybe this is not a fair assessment, but I simply never had a good meal. Also, a little over the top with the A/C - but again, may have been due to the large group.

Reviews.Title: “My first trip to Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: Moviemaker76
Reviews.Content: I'm pleased to say that I enjoyed my first visit to Los Angeles. I was welcomed at the Westin Hotel by the front desk clerk Ashley who reluctantly told me that my room was not available, this news upset me very much but Ashley graciously offered us an upgrade to a nicer room which immediately set me at ease. I was glad to see that the room was unbelieveable, the bed was absolutely devine and the room service was scrumptious! And I was lucky to get to checked out by Ashley. Overall I had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “This is a LARGE downtown business hotel, but does a great job of it.”
Reviews.Author: rowingman
Reviews.Content: Having seen the Westin Bonaventure used in movies for years (True Lies, In the Line of Fire, etc), I stayed here for a business meeting being held at the JW Marriott down the street. For a large, downtown I was extremely pleasantly surprised. The rooms have very recently been refurbished (new carpet, furniture, wall covering). My room was a 31st floor suite (thank you SPG platinum), with a very comfortable bed, great furnishings, and incredibly spacious. Views were unbelievable, and I got to make fun of my colleague who could not face the windows in the elevator (cowered against the door due to fear of heights). Breakfast in the restaurant was very well done, albeit at large downtown business hotel prices. Staff in the restaurant, front desk, bell desk, and doorman were great. My only critical comment would be a softball I threw to the concierge. I asked if he could have a bottle of champagne couriered to a business associate who is taking a new job. The request befuddled him, offering room service on the telephone. I know I was looking for a creative solution (the Ritz or the St Regis would take an address, and charge me out the wazoo to do it, but they'd do it). Instead I had to make other arrangements. No big deal. I recommend this hotel and will return if given the need to return to LA.

Reviews.Title: “Solid business stay at the Westin”
Reviews.Author: nkashyap
Reviews.Content: + Great location in downtown LA, lots of onsite restaurants, easy valet parking, no street noise (at least on 26th floor), good sized rooms, a couple of specials for SPG members, coffee bar - registration was slow - too many guests and too few checkin agents

Reviews.Title: “Great..slightly expensive!”
Reviews.Author: Creasians
Reviews.Content: I've camped at this hotel for over 5 months now and found this a great place to stay at along with some other downtown hotels I've reviewed earlier. Expensive, if you dont have a priceline price or a govt rate. Else, this place is super comfortable. Well appointed rooms, the beds and linens - nice, great newly done bathrooms etc. Onsite restaurants that are open until 10pm, food that you may not find anywhere else nearby if you decided to eat a late dinner. Some of the previous reviewers have mentioned bedbugs here. I,ve never been putup in a room with one though so I would doubt those claims. The downside..noisy elevators if your room happens to be close to one. In a nutshell, I'd always stay here if in the area..

Reviews.Title: “you are staying in a sculpture”
Reviews.Author: mamboveepee
Reviews.Content: Best location for downtown. up the street from j town and also from staples center. Some places are closer to one end or the other but this one is right in the middle. parking truely is expensive.... no really expensive (27USD per night the time of writing), but it ain't cheap to have realestate in downtown so suck it up. The benifit is that it is in and out parking and if you are from out of town, you can just park it and take the metro to hollywood (and avoid driving in the traffic). The concierge has a great map of downtown so pick one up. By the way Downtown in general is not the best place for you to stay. LA is not manhattan. Stay a few days here then move to the west side by the ocean. the main thing is you wont have to drive if you stay here for downtown events. That means more drinking. do go to the turning 360 bar upstaires. The curved floor to ceiling glass windows in each room is really cool (and oddly romantic for couples, if you know what I mean:). Sure you can stay at a cookie cutter square new building with all the man child hipsters or tired grumpy business people, but why not stay in a sculpture instead? When was the last time you took a picture of a hotel you stayed in? Yes the pool is a bit small and the rooms are a bit odd shaped but have some imagination! Get it for cheap on priceline and have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel downtown Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: Henriette_11
Reviews.Content: We prefer staying at the Bonaventure Hotel when we have a Trade-Show in downtown Los Angeles. It is close to all stores and it has a great gym and on the floor below the hotel is a whole selection of different restaurants and fast foods. Sometimes we like to eat out and other times we just like something quick.

Reviews.Title: “Giant Roaches Don't Faze the Staff... Avoid at all cost...”
Reviews.Author: Snowpocalypse
Reviews.Content: THIS IS THE 4 STAR DOWNTOWN LA HOTEL LISTED FOR ABOUT $100 ON PRICELINE & HOTWIRE.... NASTY I woke early one morning at this hotel, opened the door to the bathroom and saw the largest roaches I have ever seen. I captured one but it in a coffee cup and went to the front desk... The staff acted like it was no big deal and since it was a third party reservation said they could do nothing about my desire to not spend the rest of my stay at their hotel...

Reviews.Title: “great service!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 21SanDiego21
Reviews.Content: this hotel is so nice, great location everything you need is walking distance. Staple Center too. Beaware the coctail lounge is expensive, two house glasses of red wine was $28. Our first morning the hot water was gone. None in the entire hotel. We called guest service and they where so nice we got comps. went out for the day and came back to find a apology note and and some fruit. I was so surprised how they went above and beyond to make sure we enjoyed ourselves. I will always stay here when we are in L.A.

Reviews.Title: “Christmas in The Westin”
Reviews.Author: 171emma
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Westin for 2 nights over Christmas. It was our last stop on our round the world trip and a comfortable place to finish up in. The building is an iconic LA structure with fantastic glass lifts from which you can see city. The room was clean and comfortable with all the amenities you would expect. The receptionists and concierge were friendly. We very much enjoyed having cocktails in the revolving bar lounge on the top floor. The views from there were great. The heated outdoor pool was nice too and we enjoyed using it. Having stayed in a number of motels in the USA, I was quite surprised how a high end hotel such as this seemed to charge for everything. Free wi-fi isn't available in the rooms, but you can access it in the lobby, so don't bother paying for it as it's overpriced. They add around $4 plus a 19% tip to any room service orders you make. Also they charge you for the use of the phone for making toll free and local numbers, that includes using an international calling card. However I don't know if these charges are normal in US hotels such as this as we tended to stick to motels which we found were great in general. On the 4th floor there are some food outlets where you can pick up snacks and meals etc, but we didn't find they were particularly good and you would be better off eating elsewhere. Although we had a nice time in LA over Christmas, the Westin didn't make it particularly special.

Reviews.Title: “It ain't what it used to be”
Reviews.Author: BuffCrone
Reviews.Content: The Bonaventure isn't the luxury hotel that it used to be. It's shabby despite the lobby upgrade, weirdly empty (like the set of a scary movie) and the food is awful. But the rates reflect its reduced station in life, and the location is perfect for downtown business trips, and lets you walk to the library, Disney, MOCA, even Nokia Theater with ease. I've stayed here 5 times in recent years. The beds don't seem to have that Westin loft any more (or maybe it was just this one) but in other ways the service was fine. Parking is outrageous, so park nearby instead. Or even better, take the FlyAway shuttle to Union Station and then walk around downtown. Lots of good restaurants in the area, so no need to eat in the hotel. Especially avoid the overpriced LA Prime, where the food is just plain bad.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: amasnyc
Reviews.Content: The rooms are nice and the staff are very pleasant. Stop by the SPG Preferred Guest Desk and ask for Sophia, she is very pleasant and helpful At check in, I was offered my choice of the LA Times or US Today to be delivered to my room. I chose LA Times but it was never delivered to my room. I had to go to the desk on the ground floor to pick it up. Check out the 4th Floor High Rise Cafe breakfast special is $5.00 and the Brewery is also a great place for lunch. The elevators take forever.

Reviews.Title: “Good for a business trip to LA”
Reviews.Author: stetson
Reviews.Content: As a Platinum traveler I was upgraded to a suite which was a fairly large layout with a separate powder room. I was in room 1811 which was quiet and a decent view (higher would have been better). Valet parking was very expensive at $38, but I did not see much choice (nor did I investigate alternatives) I had a business dinner at LA Prime which was on the 38th floor and did have a nice view. Workout room was relatively small for a large hotel and was VERY busy at 5:45AM PT.

Reviews.Title: “Hit and miss with service”
Reviews.Author: RumRunner01
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over New Years to attend a hockey game on NYE. The location is not bad, just under a mile walk to Staples but everyone said to cab it so we did going there but waked home with a large group and felt safe enough. Our room was on the 30th floor with great views toward the Disney concert hall. We could also people watch into the exterior glass elevators and other tower rooms of the Westin. Windows in our room were floor to ceiling so you really got a good view out. But the room can get hot from the sun, make sure the ac is turned on in the afternoon. The ac worked well in our room but was noisy. We had a newly renovated room which was a bit compact but still felt spacious. There was plenty of space for everything you bring. Had flat screen tv, mini fridge, comfy bed, desk, chair and ottoman, etc. the bathroom was very nicely decorated and cozy. Lots of counter space. We enjoyed roaming all the shops located in this hotel/commerce building. There are lots of shops and eateries in the building. Our service was hit and miss at this hotel. Check in was great, Tim at the bar is great, NYE party in the bar that rotates was initially good. But we tried the lobby bar later on the night and one bartender is terrible, can't make simple drinks. Don't order from the Asian woman if she is working the bar. Then the NYE party in the rotating bar was supposed to go until 2am but started kicking everyone out at 1am, it was a downer. Tried to go back downstairs to lobby bar and the dj was playing all traditional Mecican music, odd choice for a hotel bar of this caliber and clientele. Needless to say, that was a buzz kill too. The only other trouble we had was checking out. This hotel is green and does not give you a bill under the door and it's not on your tv so you have to go to front desk to check out and make sure charges are ok. The line is very long due to this. I'm glad I waited, though, because there was an error on my bill and the gal did not want to fix it but eventually did. All in all it was a good stay and I'd stay again if I had to stay downtown (but the price would have to be right).

Reviews.Title: “Average for a Westin”
Reviews.Author: MemoryCamera
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business. Great service at front desk check in. Disappointed with amenities, not a great coffee option, restaurant options were average. Room was large, bed was excellent, nice desk, average bathroom. Overall hotel is fading a little. I would stay again at the right price although I would check other options next time I am in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CostasDaGreek
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Hotel with my family and the experience was great. The lobby was beautiful and we ate Breakfast there in the mornings. Great food. We also ate at the Restaurant that was at the top floor of the Hotel. Great food and amazing view. The rooms were nice, and had a good view of downtown LA, and many skyscrapers that surrounded the hotel. The idea if having "Towers" separate the rooms was interesting. We were in the Blue Tower. The only problem was the pool as when we stayed. the quality of it was pretty bad. But there are good beaches to make up for it. Overall our stay at the Westin was great and next time we return to LA we will look forward to staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “One would expect more...”
Reviews.Author: Worldtravellerz06
Reviews.Content: The hotel's pricelist puts it in competiotion with the likes of the Hilton but I am sad to say its amenities are outdated. Do not expect to get anything deliscious to eat at this hotel, it is either extremely overpriced or has hairs sticking out of...

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing ! Disappointing ! Disappointing !”
Reviews.Author: Irene X
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing as a 4-star level hotel. Rooms are small and smelly. There are stains on towels. Elevators are extremely slow, have to wait more than 10 minutes to take the elevator. Valet parking is expensive and don't think can be called as "valet parking". You have to drive the car into garage yourself, they take over the car from garage. Then you have to take all of your luggages from garage to lobby to check in. The overall service in the hotel is disappointing too. I won't recommend this hotel to my friends and won't come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Dissappointed...........”
Reviews.Author: scotta63
Reviews.Content: I have to say I expected a little more than what this particular Westin offered. We picked it because of the location of where we were spending our New Years Eve. So, the pro was the location. We also enjoyed a sandwich we picked up from a little sandwich shop in the hotel. We were told the rooms had been renovated recently. Although they looked okay, the beds were extremely hard. In fact, both our bed and the other couple who stayed next door to us, complained about how UN-heavenly the beds were, not to mention the shower and shower head, which needs some renovation. When we complained to someone at the front desk she stated, "Oh it's probably because the bed is new and needs to be broken in." Trust me that is not it at all. There was also a weird creaking sound coming form the bed frame every time I sat down on it. I would have to say the Westin Bonaventure is a "Has been.". One last thing, when we went to check out we saw some dog feces sitting on the Starwood Preferred mat, in front of the reception desk. I have stayed at other Westins and have never had a problem.

Reviews.Title: “A City within the City”
Reviews.Author: Ozma
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Westin Bonaventure was exactly the opposite of what I'd expect from a downtown L.A. hotel: the atmosphere inside its five towers is peaceful and calm. Everything I could possibly want was right there inside the building: I needed to go outside only if there was something I wanted to do in the city. Inside, I was invited simply to Be (at a price, of course.) My room was small, as some reviewers have commented, but the view was magnificent, the bed incredibly comfortable, and the wifi so fast that I almost didn't mind paying for it. ($13 per 24 hour period, although it's free in the lobby.) The television service included Showtime but not HBO. Room service is very expensive; I found the prices a bit deceptive given that they tack on a $3.50 delivery charge plus a 19% gratuity. The price of room service is the reason I gave it four stars, not five; the food was fine, but not worth what they are charging. Tip: If you cannot live without Diet Coke or some such, bring your own. There's a nice fridge in the room, and room service charges almost 5 bucks for a soda. If you don't want to bring your own, you can get them for a bit less in the hotel gift shop, lobby level. All that said, it's an environment with priceless views of the city from every room, a bed I would stuff in my suitcase and take home if I could, and housekeeping service as unobtrusive and thorough as I've ever seen. The desk was set up for business (a power strip! a power strip! bless them!) and everything was immaculately clean. They talk about each room having "spa amenities" and while I don't care about terry robes, I enjoyed the truly luxurious shower head and bathroom details. It's a city within the city, with many places to shop, to eat, to drink, and to enjoy. Here and here you will see little plaques mentioning that such-and-such a movie scene was filmed here. It's a big flashy building with many small delights.

Reviews.Title: “No heat in the room”
Reviews.Author: nancy l
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had been waiting all year to stay at the Bonaventure. We are not rich people and had saved all year for this experience. We do not have heating at home so we were really looking forward to a nice warm room. The room was cold when we arrived. The thermostat did not work. We called the front desk, they sent up a technician immediately. He got the heat going. We went out for something to eat, came back and went to sleep and when we woke up in the morning it was really cold. Thermostat was not working again. Being private people we did not want to have the technician come in the room while we were in our pj's and in bed. We just left after breakfast. Other than that, everything was really nice. LA is a great city (we both have lived 15 miles south of LA our entire lives) and we never had experienced the city life. We would recommend going to downtown and stay and enjoy the scene but will we stay at the Bonaventure...probably not. Expensive with no heat.

Reviews.Title: “Small and smelly room. Bad service. Valet parking at $38 per night is a little expensive but acceptable.”
Reviews.Author: JasonZou
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night and had them extended the checkout time to 1pm but our key cards were already disabled shortly after 12pm and we had to wait 10 min for a security guy right outside our door to get back in .

Reviews.Title: “Nice, but a few details lacking”
Reviews.Author: gapoi99
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at the Westin before, and chose to stay there again recently. The hotel is nicely located right downtown, and if you are a Y member, you can use the Y on top of the parking garage right across the street. Overall, I like the place, and I'd stay there again. Great architecture, the rooms are well laid out, and have great views, are clean and the beds are comfortable. Everyone on staff was very pleasant. A small annoyance: being a guy, I should not have to hold the toilet seat up with one hand while I'm standing there using it. I thought this was a problem unique to the first room I had stayed in there at the Westin, but apparently it's all of them. The marble shelf sticks out too far so the toilet seat cannot be put back to where it will stay up on its own. Not a problem for women, but a bit of an annoyance for us guys. And for the price I paid for a Friday night, I think all of the outlets in the room should work. On one outlet, neither plug worked, so I wound up unplugging something in order to charge my laptop. This was a one night extension of a business trip. Would I stay at the Westin again? Yes, but I hope that some more things get detailed before then.

Reviews.Title: “Downtown Energy.”
Reviews.Author: Baronent
Reviews.Content: There is something exciting about staying downtown. The lights. The busy office people. The hustle and bustle. The sounds. Stayed at the hotel for one night. This place is HUGE! Really something to look at. Calming in a strange sort of way. I was one of the lucky ones and did NOT have a car to park. Avoided the $400/night parking fee. Ok, not $400, but not cheap. Hate paying for wifi at hotels, so I didn't. **I think the time has come for luxury hotels to STOP charging for wifi! The room cost should cover that, especially at these rates. If even a 2 star hotel can cover the cost of wifi for the guests as most do, pretty sure, Hilton, Weston, Marriott etc. can afford to do so. I had a King room. Small room, but decorated nicely. Flat Panel TV. Good coffee. FREE water (Good job on the "free" water Westin) and a small, but well appointed bathroom. Loved the leaf formed soap! The views from the 25th floor were OUTSTANDING. Open the curtain and you are faced with a sea of lights. Thousands and thousands of lights! Loved it. Even this high up in the sky, you hear a lot of city noise. But I liked the noise. Felt like I was in New York for a night. The only lights I did NOT like, were the lights in the room while I was trying to sleep. I like it dark when I sleep, but it seems more and more hotels are using TVs, Clocks, Phones, all with lights that emit all-night-long. A green light. A red light. My room looked like a lazer light show was going on! Had to use my shoe to block the green light from the TV. Had to use my other shoe to block the light from the clock. Had to cover the phones with books. Had to put a towel by the base of the door- you get the idea. What ever happened to dark rooms? In the morning I found USA Today at my door. I also found, at my door, 2 empty drinking glasses that had been there since the night before, when I checked in. I know the place is huge, but someone really should have picked those up. Overall, I really enjoyed the place. Felt very comfortable and clean. Was looking forward to taking a shower in the morning with the nice shampoo and soap. Bummer. The shower sucked. The curtain smelled of mildew and the actual space to take a shower could not have been any smaller. My arm kept touching the nasty curtain! Oh, and after 2 minutes, I was standing in about 5 inches of water. Gross. Horrible draining problems. But WOW! My hair smelled amazing after! I think if the shower would have been a better experience, this place would be at the top of my list as far as Downtown Hotels go. Of course, this is the ONLY Downtown hotel I have ever stayed at, but you get the idea...

Reviews.Title: “An old favorite back to form”
Reviews.Author: kapohokine
Reviews.Content: I love the Bonaventure. I have stayed there for many years, but the last couple of stays the old girl was starting to age a bit. Arriving in the underground carpark this time, I knew instantly that something had changed. It's been about a year since my last visit, and right off I noticed the proper desk for the valets and the fresh paint and wood accents. That feeling carried over up the series of escalators to the lobby where I felt like I was looking at an old friend for the first time and thinking something is different, then realizing that everything is different. Reception is a sleek desk of the same colors and wood accents used throughout the hotel now. It was inviting and chic, although the wood couldn't look anymore like plastic than it does. Check in was the usual quick en efficient affair, and then up in the famous glass elevators to my room. I booked a Tower Suite, which is love at the Bonaventure. They are two regular rooms adjoining through a sliding door. Both rooms are curved with stunning and iconic views of LA. I remember when the Bonaventure was the tallest building in LA. Now it's dwarfed by it's neighbors, but that just makes the views better, more dramatic. The Tower Suites have been completely refurbed, and look great. Still 1.5 baths, which is really handy, but everything has been upgraded and improved. The wet bar area is now attractive and useful, and there are shelves in the bathroom. The furniture is very comfortable, and the TV is now flat panel. The desk still faces the windows, so it's hard to work there because you end up staring at the activity going on below you. But it's a very useful desk, and there is plenty of light throughout the suite. My rate included breakfast, so down I went. The lobby restaurant has been thoughtfully redesigned and organized, and is bright, attractive, and welcoming. A far cry from the dark abyss of yore. And the food at the buffet was delicious, a big surprise and huge improvement from years past. Parking this time around was expensive, more than I remember from before. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful, even talkative without being chatty. Comprehensive improvements to this old favorite has breathed new life into it, and I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay there again”
Reviews.Author: 3hounds
Reviews.Content: Had a 2 day stopover due to flight cancellations and had the opportunity to stay at the Westin. The staff were great and very helpful considering I only had part of my luggage. The buffet breakfast is to die for and the Heavenly beds are more than well named. I had the best 2 days sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and accomodations”
Reviews.Author: veliac
Reviews.Content: Mgr.,Marco Romero and his whole hotel staff, especially Ricardo Otis, made sure that our travel experiece exceeded our expectations. Stayed in renovated room on 26th floor--Heavenly beds were fantastic as well as amenities in the room (free water bottles were nice touches). We had a great view and such a relaxing stay. Parking was expensive, but Customer Service made up for it. Thanks again, Gil.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent room nice view, but parking nightmare”
Reviews.Author: SoccerCA
Reviews.Content: Expedient and friendly check-in. Comfortable and clean room. Great view from high floor. Had reservation for 2 people but towels and robe only provided for 1 person, needed two calls to correct. Shower head partially clogged, needs replacement. A word of caution: parking fee is $38/night, valet only, no self-parking available.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel, amazing location”
Reviews.Author: MissME3
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a leisure trip with some friends, and I have to say, the view is excellent of the skyline of LA, and it is in the heart of Downtown, with so many attractions and sights - it seems to be like the NYC in LA - and so much to do and see. The hotel itself was nice- would have liked it to be a but more renovated, and the parking is $$$$ but overall the deal was good in terms of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay, expensive valet parking”
Reviews.Author: stephane r
Reviews.Content: Great stay in a classical, somewhat old-fashioned hotel. Expensive valet parking

Reviews.Title: “Just okay- Very large, impersonal hotel. Okay choice if you need to be downtown.”
Reviews.Author: travelboundsandiego
Reviews.Content: Pros: Downtown location - good if you need to be in the financial district and close enough to walk to the Staples Center. It is a good venue for conventions. About 3 miles to USC and close to highway access. Clean rooms and practical bathrooms (has the essentials) Comfortable bed Nice work out/exercise room Higher floors have nice views Cons: The hotel is large and very impersonal Valet parking expensive at $38/night Additional charge for internet service Rooms are small but efficient for a business trip Bathrooms renovated but showerheads were not. Water temp was never hot Came in very late at night and made 3 stops at different entrances until someone directed me that parking/check in was on Flower Street underground.
