Not a good location if you want to explore LA nightlife by foot. Take a cab to LA Live or other locations. Recommendations: Not great value if you are paying the regular rate but if you can get a discount on some of the online hotel booking sites, then it is okay. Personally, I prefer the Marriot and Biltmore in downtown L.A as I had better service, nicer rooms and breakfast included when I stayed at those hotels. However, my son stayed on another occassion at the Westin and said he was upgraded to a very contemporary, large suite and since he did not have the added parking expense or internet service felt that it was good value.

Reviews.Title: “Really nice property with a lot of restaurants inhouse”
Reviews.Author: aliciamlo
Reviews.Content: We really loved the view from our room. All the tall buildings and lights at night. So beautiful. This place had a lot of restaurants like food courts in the hotel. It was a little difficult to get to at times because of all the way streets but it's also easy to get onto the freeway from here. The parking was a bit expensive but it may be standard for all the hotels in downtown. The pool area was lovely . I felt like it was a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to Staples Centre”
Reviews.Author: oldbeast
Reviews.Content: Stayed here when we went to LA to watch the Canucks vs. Kings. Close to the arena, within walking distance, and close to the Metro, which we used to get to Hollywood etc. Our room was a king bed and we found it to be quite small. Not bad since we were not in the room alot. It is right downtown, and parking is a premium at the hotel. We had rented a car, valet is $38 US per night. Convenient but expensive. Bars and main restaurants expensive but nice. They do have a "food Court" type floor but did not go there with so many other choices in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Easy cab ride to staple center.”
Reviews.Author: Cmh060
Reviews.Content: The rooms were nice a little small book the hotel itself was wonderful great to explore with kids and very easy cab ride down the staples center to see Katy Perry it was a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “loved this place”
Reviews.Author: made1024
Reviews.Content: The location was near our work venue so it worked fine, however I'm not sure I'd like to stay here on a pleasure trip. In LA you always have to rent a car so that's a plus if staying here. Business center and lobby restuarant outrageously expensive, although the buffet breakfast was great and had a huge variety the price was still high. Across the street is johnny rockets and starbucks and on the premises (4th floor) they have a few places to eat. I think this hotel has so much potential but the restaurant floor looks as if it's all going out of business and with such a large property you'd think these places would actually earn money but they are "fast foodish" not nice restaurants. The area does not offer many places to eat and the 4th floor has a subway, pizza place, healthy food joint but nothing for a nice dinner. They do have an amazing restaurant on the 51st floor - outrageously expensive. The suite I was in (the green tower) was the best. HUGE! it had a guest area (sofa, fridge and half bathroom) then it's divided by sliding wooden doors to the main room which is quite big and the bathroom with a nice size closet. It was perfect for my week stay. Great views too especially from the elevators which work on the outside of the structure. Personnel was very nice and helpful at all times. Valet parking is available $38/night. If you stay here you must visit Plaza Olvera, a beautiful mexican street with vendors,music and great INEXPENSIVE food - it's about 8 minutes away and no, it's not walking distance :)

Reviews.Title: “First LA visit”
Reviews.Author: socrog
Reviews.Content: Was in LA for the first time for Major League Soccer finals. Everything good about hotel. Staff was friendly, location was good (downtown), parking across street OK. Wireless internet conenction was TERRIBLE, but they did give us our money back on it. How can the budget hotels/motels have great wireless service and not charge, but the high-end hotels charge and always have problems????? And no free shuttle to airport?? Beds were very good, best thing about the place. Overall, a good place but definately not great.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and accomadations!”
Reviews.Author: DianaChicago
Reviews.Content: Mgr.,Marco Romero and his whole hotel staff made sure that our business travel experiece exceeded our expectations. Stayed in renovated room on 26th floor--beds were fantastic as well as amenities in the room (starbucks coffee, free water bottles were nice touches). Bell staff/ doormen were excellent and very helpful. Would stay here again!!! Only disapppoinment were the hotel shops....dated merchandise and strange hours.. Have breakfast a few blocks away at the French cafe, Bottega Louis....went twice!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, hotel is nice, with some drawbacks”
Reviews.Author: worldtravelpros
Reviews.Content: This hotel is nice, conveniently located downtown, newly renovated rooms with nice views - really a very nice Westin - A few observations: The elevators run alongside the outside of the building with glass windows so you can take in the view - there are a lot of elevators and they make the rooms next to the elevators sound like someone is bowling in your room until the wee hours of the morning until everyone is in bed. The valet service, which is convenient as it is in tbe building, is horribly slow. Two mornings I called in advance (multiple times) to have them pull the car around and they did not answer their phone. I even had the receptionist call them as I was checking out - and they did not answer her call - she just laughed and said - sometimes they don't answer. It took 45 minutes for my car to be pulled around. This is a major problem at this hotel and really all they need to do is likely hire a new valet manager - the gentlemen in charge clearly does not have the management skills to manage his staff in that environment. The rotating bar on the top floor is excellent - the food is great and the views amazing as the entire floor turns for a 360 degree view of the city in about an hour - great night out and not nearly as expensive as I would have imagined for such a great place!

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated Downtown hotel”
Reviews.Author: Debbiestravels
Reviews.Content: The new renovation has brought life back to the Westin! I have returned (I travel weekly to LA) and love it. ONe thing - plumbing is a bit noisy between floors but I still enjoy staying there. Good gym, good bar..HEAVENLY BEDS. Eat at the Border Grill restaurant across the street - Excellent. Ceviche...best.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: MlovesB
Reviews.Content: The Bonaventure's inside reminded me of a cross between an airport and low-end mall. The rooms were nice and clean. I especially liked how big our bathroom was and the abundance of towels provided. If you like big beds you'll like it here. We were told the rooms were recently renovated. The husband and I stayed here for one night and it was what we needed. If you are looking for a nice, clean room and safe place close to the good local downtown L.A. spots this is still a good place (with no frills). The service at registration was courteous. I hear the Suede lounge is pretty hip which is on the first floor. This used to be the spot in the 90's but the shine is a little tarnished. 3 1/2 rating (better than average)

Reviews.Title: “Impersonal, but very good”
Reviews.Author: wxzzy
Reviews.Content: At 1,700 rooms, this is the biggest hotel in Los Angeles. The front desk answers calls on the second ring, and requests are met in minutes. However, with up to a thousand check-ins a day, and staff that can accommodate a dozen languages, don’t expect the personal touches. Not a B&B. Think about it as dealing with AMEX as opposed to the local plumber. Good customer service, but scripted. The rooms are small and pis shaped, but it’s a 70's hotel and they have to cram kings where queens once lived. The views make up for it and the elevators are the best (Schwarzenegger rides a horse into one in True Lies). The interior public spaces are huge, unimaginably so, and laid out with four floors of shops, bridges and tunnels. You could spend a day just walking inside. Outside is worth a walk too: Chinatown, the Bradbury Building, Grand Central Market, the theater district, Little Italy and Little Tokyo. A lot of people write off downtown LA because it can look like a demilitarized zone. It is worth a look and there are people everywhere. The revolving bar attracts people who think a revolving bar is cool: yahoos in baseball caps and woo girls. The valet take 10 minutes so call ahead from the room. Also, its $ 38.00. High in the normal world, but cheep in LA. It’s a great hotel to get lost in, just know what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Is very close to all major freeways and in the center of everything”
Reviews.Author: Fervijeeo
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Priceline and got a great deal also the parking is very expensive do not park in this hotel park right across at the world trade center.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Looking Hotel With a Few Negatives”
Reviews.Author: LincolnAdams
Reviews.Content: Happy to say my stay was bed bug free despite finding several complaints of bed bugs in the bed bug registry. I think they are exercising due diligence to keep the rooms spotless considering even a single and unconfirmed report of bed bugs can be a death knell for its business. The hotel has been the setting for several blockbuster movies too, including one of my favorites, In The Line of Fire. It was a real treat to be standing in the same elevator John Malkovich and Clint Eastwood were in for the elevator scene. Westin consists of 4 towers that are color coded. Once you know the color code of the tower your room is in, it should be fairly easy to navigate around. If you want to exit onto Figueroa Street, you will need to take the escalator up from the lobby, but other than that it was easy for me to get around. The rooms were clean and the maid service very prompt and thorough. Valet parking experience was acceptable, sometimes the attendees will be a bit harried and confused, but they're hard working and bring your car out quickly even when you don't call ahead. There are a few dining options on the 4th floor, but to access it you need to ride to either the 3rd or 5th floor I believe and then take the stairs, so it's a bit of an inconvenience, plus their opening hours don't usually extend to the evenings, so you'll either need to head out or order room service. Room service was for me was predictably expensive but actually pretty satisfying. The hot chocolate itself might have been the best deal: while it's $5, it comes in a huge pitcher and could easily serve 4-5 people. Delicious too. My major complaints had to do with Wi-Fi and the holds they put on my PayPal card. I was there for BlogWorld so it was expected that everyone in creation would be using their Wi-Fi, but I especially needed it because of having to get my iPhone replaced after the antenna stopped working. I was trying to do an iCloud restore which only works through wi-fi and despite being at the hotel for 4 nights, the wi-fi STILL wasn't good enough for me to fully complete my restore. There were times when the wi-fi disappeared altogether, leaving me to use my cell phone or a wired connection just to get online. To be fair though, the wired connection did work really well. Still, it was the wi-fi I desperately needed, and the hotel failed miserably there. Secondly, I understand that hotels will sometimes put a hold on your debit card if you opt to use that instead of a credit card. What I don't understand or accept is putting a $824 hold on my card. Seriously? Because I opt for the convenience of using a PayPal card (which I reserve for all my travel expenses) it was necessary to hijack almost $1000 of my money? This, despite the fact that the room had ALREADY BEEN PAID FOR. While I understand a hold for valet parking and room service, holding the cost of the room when it was previously paid for and debited already was ridiculous. Normally I might have given the hotel 4 stars, but this issue grated on my nerves so much I deducted another star. :-P

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful suite with an amazing view, terrible wi-fi”
Reviews.Author: kfitzy7
Reviews.Content: I was upgraded for being an SPG member to probably the best and largest suite I've ever stayed in, I wish I hadn't been there for work travel as it would have been an awesome suite to have partied with a bunch of friends! My entire stay was great with the exception of one huge problem, the wi-fi in my room! It never worked successfully despite many calls to the help desk, which really wasn't helpful! It sounds like a common problem for those using an ipad2 at least what the help desk told me, but basically the hotel is ALL cement and therefor the negatively effects the wi-fi they told me, very annoying however after my complaints I did get some free points for my troubles! I would recommend if wi-fi isn't important to you!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Design, cool rotating bar”
Reviews.Author: Jcxny
Reviews.Content: Westin hotel has an really cool design with 4 column elevators that lead you to your room. Staff is friendly and service is good. Got a free upgrade being a SPG member. The 35th floor bar is cool because it rotates around the LA skyline. The only complain I have is that if you got a car in the valet be prepared to wait. The staff in the garage is not all to friendly and the one I encountered actually had a nasty attitude. Getting your car is a 10-15 minute wait at least. I guess I am just not use to this type of service

Reviews.Title: “Great location, in-room dining food needs improvement”
Reviews.Author: Seattle1313
Reviews.Content: The staff was very helpful and efficient. The room was good-sized and comfortable. Given the location and price, I would have said five stars but for the terrible in-room dining food. I ordered a full dinner and dessert. It was not appetizing. The mozzarella in the caprese salad was so soft it was runny. The dessert was slightly frozen (and wasn't supposed to be). For breakfast, I ordered the broccoli omelet and it lacked flavor. On a positive note, my room was near the elevator but nice and quiet!

Reviews.Title: “Solid DTLA Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: TheHonestWord
Reviews.Content: While not quite up to the standards of other Westin properties, the Bonaventure continues to be a solid choice for accommodations in DTLA. Definitely worth a visit; clean and comfortable. One thing about this place; it confuses most people. Almost everyone I come across has troubles navigating around the property and gets lost at some point. Handicapped individuals might want to consider another property. Overall, it's fun and a good place to stay for a night if in town for business. The rates are usually pretty reasonable and the rooms themselves are comfortable, decently appointed and offer great views of the city. This hotel has been here a long time and will continue to be a good value if you need a night or two in DTLA.

Reviews.Title: “Big hotel, but clean and nice”
Reviews.Author: JShooman
Reviews.Content: This Westin was clean with newly remodeled rooms. The parking valet is $38/night which is a little pricey, especially since it took a while to get the car because of the size of the hotel. But, the hotel is in a convenient area in downtown LA. The hotel is a little big and feels like a convention hotel. But for the right price (which I paid) it is a nice stay. Our view was nice (looking onto the Hollywood sign). Overall, impersonal, but clean and good location.

Reviews.Title: “Parking Nightmare”
Reviews.Author: sdsmilecrafter
Reviews.Content: Just came back from a stay at the Westin Bonaventure. While the hotel stay was very pleasant, the parking situation was a nightmare! First, they charge $38 to park per night! This was for valet with in and out priviledges, you can't self park. They gave us our ticket and told us to call 10-15 minutes in advance to have the car waiting for us. The first time we needed our car, we called down in advance just like they told us in order to have it ready. It was not. We had to wait as if we had just requested it. That was nothing compared to the next day. First we tried to call down in advance to have the car ready. No one answered. Repeatedly. Next we called the front desk who told us that parking was not taking advance calls, we'll have to go down and request the car. When we came downstairs, the line to get your car was so long, they had someone distributing water bottles. People had been waiting 45 minutes to an hour for their car. Luckily, we didn't need our car immediately. I felt bad for anyone who needed to get their car to get to the airport to catch a plane. In the Westin's favor I have to say they did refund our $38 parking fee. But what a mess this was. I would recommend parking across the street in the parking structure instead.

Reviews.Title: “Worth the Priceline.com price.”
Reviews.Author: nkim009
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I decided to stay in LA for the night since it was Halloween weekend (this past weekend). We decided to use priceline.com to get a 4 star hotel for a 3 star price. For $100 we were able to stay at the Bonaventure in downtown LA. The location is wonderful- right in the heart of the bars, fancy places to eat, etc. The hotel itself is beautiful- rooms are found in different towers according to colors (red, blue, yellow). Inside the hotel there are little shops along with different restaurants depending on your preference. I liked the idea of different dining choices- most expensive being LA Prime located on the 35th floor with great views of LA. Other choices were a brewery (mediocre food), a food court with many different choices, the lounge/bar, etc. The room itself is very small- pretty standard. Open the door and there is your bathroom, bed, and TV. Other than that there isn't much room for anything else but I guess you're at a hotel to mainly just sleep right? The view of LA was beautiful we were on the 31st floor- LA lights are always nice. Downfalls were that on that morning there was a marathon going on so EARLY MORNING NOISE! music so loud to wake you up from a nice slumber. and $40 for parking- but there was a huge crowd and the wait for valet was 25 minutes! ridiculous. If they knew they were going to have a mass exit they should have planned ahead. Luckily they did comp the fee so I guess we couldn't be that upset.. Overall I would say this hotel is not a 4 star but more like a 3- but compared to the $179/night price on the website- I would definitely use priceline.com

Reviews.Title: “It was a wise decision”
Reviews.Author: Rekon
Reviews.Content: Just got back from the Westin. This hotel is top notch. The rooms are well equipped with a small refrigerator, security box, working desk area, flat screen HD TV and the bed was nice and comfortable. I stayed on the 21st floor nice view of downtown. This hotel is huge. Probably this why I got a good deal through priceline $90 per night. Parking is offered through a valet service which charges 38 dollars per 24 hours; however right next to the Westin there the World Trade CTR Parking which charges 8 dollars after 4:30 p.m. including Saturdays and Sundays. There prices go up on weekdays. There an elevator from the parking that will take to the main lobby of the World Trade Ctr. Parking and from there take the electric escalators that will take directly to a bridge connecting you to the Westin Hotel. I must mention using the valet service for 38 dollars per night you have in and out Privileges where as the 8 dollar special you do not have in and out privelige. You will have to pay 8 dollars everytime drive your car out in of the lot. I had a incident with the employee who is charge of greeting you once you pull up with the car to drop off your pasengers and luggage. I only had one suitcase and a backpack with I carry my laptop and electronics. As I opened the trunk the employee reach out for luggage with me asking for help and scratch paint/finish on my car. I did not a choice but to report the incident at check-in. Management are supposed to call me and forward the claim to their insurance company. All of the employees were very attentive and professional. I was offered free breakfast and free internet for the two nights I stayed at the Westin. Independently whether I had this mishap with my car all of the employees from housekeeping to the waiters at the restaurant, at check-in and security were courteous and always willing to go out their way to answer my questions or request. I would not hesitate to stay at this hotel again it was a wise decision.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Downtown- visit the lounge on 35th floor!”
Reviews.Author: CATrvl08
Reviews.Content: The most confusing part of finding this hotel was the hidden underground valet. Although I will excuse it since they have a waiting area complete with printers so you can check in for your flight while you wait for your car! Nice touch. We checked in and were given a room in the yellow tower on the 20th floor. Nice views, the service at the lobby bar was quick and wen I sent back a drink because it didn't taste right they brought me a replacement to my satisfaction. We went to a game at Staples center and this was very closeby- about a $6 taxi ride or about 8-10 blocks. Do NOT miss Bonavista revolving lounge and the souvenir drink glasses, we had such a great time. Our air conditioning decided to heat up to 90 degrees at 1:30am and staff was in our room within 5 minutes of our call to fix it! I was impressed with the friendly and attentive service at every restaurant down to the valets and maintenance staff. While the room leaves a bit to be desired- rather small for $200 the views and the staff make this hotel a charm when visiting Los Angeles. I would definitely consider staying here again if I were in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay for Staples Center Concert”
Reviews.Author: unchindeliz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one night when we saw a concert at the Staples Center. The elevators are very fun, and I asked for a good view and was pleased with the 24th floor. Rooms are not huge, but have great floor to ceiling views, and are very clean. Our floor was incredibly quiet, I did not hear a peep from anyone during our stay. Easy walk by plenty of restaurants to the concert. The only downside was the overnight parking was $38/night. Yikes!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: YAK823
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Westin Bonaventure for a conference. The check in process was excellent. The room I stayed in was on the 28th floor and had an excellent view of the mountains and city. The room was large and the bed was comfortable. The room was very quiet with very little hallway noise. One thing I was extremely disappointed with was the WIFI. I have stayed at several less expensive hotels in the downtown LA area that offer free WIFI in the rooms and lobby. The Westin charged $12 a day for this service, way too expensive for a daily rate.

Reviews.Title: “It's A Bit Odd, But In A Good Way...My Fave Hotel In LA”
Reviews.Author: dv8r
Reviews.Content: I stay here quite often, in the dozens of times, and really have few complaints. I've been in love with this place since it was used as a futuristic backdrop set for NBC's Buck Rogers in the 25th Century shortly after opening in the early 1980's and have been coming back ever since. It's recently had a slight makeover to update the fixtures & look, but it's still a glass-tastrophe & crazy concrete cavern of a lobby. Phil Spector and his murder trial legal team loved it so much awhile back they rented a whole floor, ran up a huge bill in the 100s of thousands and then didn't pay...isn't that just so LA? I read other reviews and the things some people complain about, I find endearing or have just become used to. I consider this place my favorite 4 star budget hotel...and what I mean is that I usually get the rate reduced as much as half via a bidding site, and never park in the hotel's own garage which adds $40 to your bill a day (parking $8 a night one bldg over at World Trade Center garage)... I also rarely order anything from room service or the hotel's restaurant or bars...I'll buy beer at a little shop on the third floor for $2 and walk around drinking those looking at all the plaques from all the movies that have been shot here. It's a big busy place & after check in, no one is probably going to hold your hand, so just start adventuring and you'll figure it all out. It's in the heart of LA's downtown biz district, which can be a little boring or bleak if you don't know where to go for fun, but even if you don't leave the building their are worthwhile ways to kill time. Check out the actual beer brewing pub on the outdoor plaza, or go the top of the hotel for the rotating spinning bar with a view. I once got so buzzed at the center lobby bar before closing time, that I then got lost in this hotel and it took me over an hour to get back to the right tower and figure out on which floor was my room. The drawbacks are there is no free internet, that's pretty standard policy in most big-city big name properties, so bite the bullet and get used to it. The bedding, as in most Westin properties is always superior to whatever I sleep on at home.I like the baffling maze like winding stairwells that still disorientate me on my way to buy sundries, and cheaper quick serve food from the independent vendors that inhabit the third floor, which is absolutely inaccessible via any elevator I know of. If you find the weird little food court, you'll run into counters offering pizza, pasta, middle-eastern fare, salads and Asian dishes...and of course the food group known as Fried. If you are on a budget, this may be far preferable to ordering room service or dining in some stodgy steakhouse.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay after clubbing all night”
Reviews.Author: kaisuva
Reviews.Content: We did not do much but sleep...aaaah, the heavenly beds are indeed heavenly after a night of partying and drinking.

Reviews.Title: “noisy, sketchy food court and parking was rather pricey”
Reviews.Author: Dave-in-SA
Reviews.Content: After a month of travelling California we ended up here, we got woken up both nights, the first night neighbours on one side were having an all night partyand the next night it sounded like the other neighbours were acting out scenes from "debbie does dallas". Parking was a ripper at $40 a night which is what hotel guests can expect to pay, but it is also the norm for downtown LA. If you are staying here make sure to time your exits and entries right because traffic can be stand still. In addition if you don't plan to eat at the restaurants in the hotel, then don't bother with a trip to their food court, its siff and dirty and the food joints don't lookappealing at all. Our next few nights we stayed down near manhattan beach at a quarter of the price and it was 100 times more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “,Better somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: dapr0d1gy
Reviews.Content: Customer service needs more attention. As a starwood property I expected more... from front office to service express to valet. No one from a different depertments knew what was going on nor capable of what was going on. Before I could finish my sentence, I was transfered to another department where I had to repeat myself all over again. They had no verbage, and finding a place to eat was an obstacle. One employee even suggested to go off property to even receive decent service! They definately did not have the touch of a starwood property nor the customer service that is desperiately needed. The employees are there to get paid and nothing more. They do not assist any anything further than their typical duties as service express, valet, batending or server. They do not take pride in their job. At one point we wanted to sight see on the different levels of the hotel and was "shooed" off because they were closed! That manager did not ask what was our intentions were but to watch us like a hawk till we left the premises. Which made us very uncomfortable. We did not feel welcomeded to even enjoy the view that downtown had to offer. I'm not the one to confront but definately needs to be said. If you want REAL and TRUE customer service, do NOT stay at the westin bonadventure. If you are planning to come to the los angles area do not stay at the westin bonadventure if you want customer service.

Reviews.Title: “A Fine Experience in Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: maxbialy
Reviews.Content: As luck would have it, Priceline got me a great rate ($90.00 a night) over a holiday weekend in downtown Los Angeles. The front desk was very supportive, from small tasks like cleaning my window to generous favors. The clerk gave me complimentary Wi-Fi and put me on a high floor so I could photograph the panoramic view of the city. The breakfast buffet was fresh and reasonable, the night time revolving restaurant was very impressive, the view and the service. Valet parking was swift and always courteous. The surrounding neighborhood has many attractions and the freeway access close by gets you anywhere you need to go. They were filming an action film just outside the hotel in the middle of the night, so "Hollywood" was even closer than normal!!! I had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Travel197299
Reviews.Content: I had the pleasure of staying in this hotel for five nights in September. Staff was friendly and hospitable. I was greeted by concierge, Jorge Arriaga as soon as I stepped into the hotel. He was passing by and wanted to know if I needed help with anything. He gave me directions to Walgreens and Rite Aid (about five blocks away). He also gave me a map, which was easy to read. I had no problem walking near the hotel to find restaurants. I had the buffet breakfast most mornings in the hotel. Cost, tax and tip were about $25.00. I discovered that IHOP was four blocks away. There is a food court in the hotel, which I did not use. There is also an underground food court in the next block. It was easy to navigate around this large hotel once you understood the lay out. I think there were three or four towers. They were color coordinated. The outside elevators was a little intimidating at first. After the second day, I looked forward to riding them while taking in the beautiful view. The room was clean and well furnished. It may have been recently remodeled, I do not know. When the bellman brought me my bags; he wanted to know if I would like some bottles of water. It appears that water is left only in certain rooms. The bed was very comfortable. The hotel is in the business district. I enjoyed walking aound exploring the area. The hotel also offers many sightseeing tours. I was in town for a National Event. Transportation was provided to the various functions. I could have walked one mile to the convention center if we did not have transportation and felt safe. My only problem with the hotel was the FedEx manager. He quoted me a price to ship some things. After he packed, sealed and labeled my box, the cost doubled. The next day I shared the incident with the concierge, Mr. Arriaga. He apologized for what had happened. He also offered me a meal for two to rectify the matter. I felt that it was an acceptable offer. If I am ever in downtown Los Angeles again. I would definitely stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel...other than it's location”
Reviews.Author: Frank L
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Bonaventure for 3 days and I liked it enough...once I finally got there. Getting to this hotel is not easy especially if you are coming from LAX. The hotel is located in downtown Los Angeles which without traffic can take roughly 20 minutes which is completely unrealistic during the day. I would say give yourself an hour during rush hour to get there. Also, parking there is not cheap. I happened to know about the traffic so I decided to use a local limo company because I don't care much for regular taxis and I didn't feel like driving myself and dealing with parking. I used this company, 1800fly800.com and it was a great, comfortable ride. I recommend using a private transportation service like them if you are planning to stay at the hotel instead of driving yourself or a taking a taxi from the airport. One more item about the location, there isn't really much to do downtown. You have to head to West LA (Santa Monica area) to find more night life and shopping. Anyway, enough ranting about the location. As other reviewers have mentioned on here, the hotel is huge. I felt like I was staying at a hotel on the strip in Vegas...minus the casino. The rooms are pretty spacious, though not quite as big as I had envisioned. The bed makes up for that flaw though, they are really comfortable. The bathroom is decent. The one thing that I like about this hotel's location is the view at night time. All in all, I gave this star 4 stars instead of 5 was mainly the location. Next time, I will try a hotel in Santa Monica. I do like how big the hotel is, the staff is really friendly if you treat them right, and the beds are really comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “too expensive for what you get”
Reviews.Author: gejmerqo
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel for the business trip. Don´t expect too much for 200 USD/day + tax. Breakfast/lunch/dinner is extra, internet is extra and it is cold in the room. Overall, there are much better places at far better price.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel, poor location...”
Reviews.Author: Khoazy
Reviews.Content: I very much enjoyed my stay at the Westin Bonaventure and the more I think about it the more I’d like to go back. The staffs were helpful as with most hotels, and there were no issues during my five-day stay. The rooms were a good size and bathroom was clean. I used the gym and pool during my stay and enjoyed both facilities. There are shops within this hotel, although I don’t know too many people to go shopping at hotels. At first I did not enjoy the extra fees for valet parking and felt it was excessive for force people to pay for the service. After calling down for my car several times I am now a fan of valet parking, just call 20 minutes before you head down. Location has nothing close and downtown LA can be a bit shady so going out at night is interesting. This hotel has a running circle on the 4th floor for people to jog around. Lots of mothers use this area to walk with a stroller, and it’s a first for hotels that I’ve seen. By far the best part though is that a food court exists on the 3rd floor providing food for cheap; great for people like me tired of being ripped off buying food in hotels. In-room wireless internet cost money as usual, unless you know the special code: [--] Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “wish I could give it 3.5 stars”
Reviews.Author: bman6262
Reviews.Content: This Westin in the heart of downtown LA was probably very cool when it first opened and while it is an overall nice hotel it is now a little bit dated. Beds were comfortable and the staff was great but everything could have used a bit of of an overhaul. I was on the 30th floor and my room was nice but a little small. Breakfast buffet was pretty typical but very good. Downtown LA is not the most exciting place but if you had to stay down there the Westin would be a good place to stay. There are several cool places to eat around the area and I never felt unsafe walking late at night.

Reviews.Title: “A great revitalizing stay. The only downside is the parking”
Reviews.Author: LeCreuset
Reviews.Content: This is my second time staying here. I get great service, a great location convenient to the freeway, and a wonderful, updated room. If I feel dusty and tired tooling around LA, this hotel is great for refreshing me and giving me an oasis to recharge and go out some more! bathroom great, bed AMAZING (almost as good as my super invested bed at home). great service--including generous pet policy for those who care. nice ice machines, 24 hour room service, convenient gym, nice pool... really--a worthwhile place to stay. and i've stayed at the higher rated Omni nearby. While the Omni is good, I'd say my stay at Westin B is a much better value easily. And I'll keep patronizing the Westin B as long as they continue to treat me great. The main downside, which is common in DTLA hotels is the parking. It costs 30+. If you're a preferred member (Starwood) you might be able to work some wonderful freebies. 1. upgrade to suite on starwood floors (typically green towers?) 2. 50% off parking (not free, but still great. in the past i've gotten 100% off, but i've heard the parking garage was bought by a company) 3. free drinks during happy hour with a letter 4. free wifi if you can get these, then staying here is an absolute huge value. i hesitate to say all this, but i do tip $20 to the front desk person and I don't ask for anything in return. i just ask them to do their best to look for complimentary upgrades (a la $20 trick in las vegas). on the weekends, and if the hotel is not busy, this can help. but i don't impose it on the front desk people and demand things. And I do often get my room via priceline/betterbidding research--so the extra tip is simply part of my expected cost in my opinion. the internet alone i get free pays for the tip. the service people there are smart and respectable--so if you treat them nicely, they will be nice in return.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, comfortable place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Tooz H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Bonaventure with my boyfriend for 4 days and it was great! The staffs were very friendly and hospitable; the concierge was very helpful giving us direction and trip suggestion! We got a room which was on the 27th floor, the view was just amazing! Also, they've got vacuum elevators, you can enjoy the view while taking the elevator. If you're going to Los Angeles, I would recommend staying at Westin Bonaventure, it's close to bus/metro station as well!

Reviews.Title: “I had a great stay”
Reviews.Author: MajDollison
Reviews.Content: I would definitely recommend this hotel. First off you can't begin talking about this hotel without discussing the view in the rooms. I was lucky enough to be on the 25th floor. It was amazing. Had a beautiful view of Fifth and Flower, below, scene of the famous shoot-out in Heat (1995). Definitely the highlight of the trip. I was there for a meeting and found the catered food to be great. Valet was convenient, but pricey, however the conference paid for it. Very convenient. Close to LAX, and very close to Hollywood and the LA Freeways. A subway station was a few blocks away. It had a an arcade of shops, which didn't seem to be doing that well, but they had nice things and they were on sale. I got an extended checkout. Elegant bathroom. Pool looked beautiful down below but I didn't get to use it. This is a resort hotel in the middle of downtown Los Angeles. Just spectacular. An older property, but the rooms had been redone and were incredibly modern.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: claremac1
Reviews.Content: Myself and a friend stayed here on 2 separate occasions. Both times our room was clean and a decent size. The views from the rooms are good of the business district. Just down the road is a food court and also some shopping, macys is a five minute walk. It is also not too far from the airport, $50 cab ride. This is why we stayed there the second time. On the first occasion we did not have a good experience. We went to the hotel bar the night before so didn't get to bed till late. At 830am we were awoken by hammering from the room above. I can only presume they were having some sort of renovation. I rang the front desk to complain and was told that they would sort it out and call back. About 35 mins later it was still going on. We rang the front desk again and they apologised and said they would speak to a manager. The hammering did then seem to move to another room but we could still hear it faintly and never received a callback from reception. The second time we booked again in this hotel for two nights. Although we had a negative experience we felt this hotel was still good value (booked on hotwire) and in a good location for what we wanted. We were arriving from Cabos mexico and missed our flight (not our fault). We booked into the westin in cabos for the night and contacted LA to let them know we would not be arriving that day. When we did I spoke with the front desk about a refund for our first night and they explained that hotwire would be responsible. After speaking to hotwire I was getting nowhere so the gentleman on the front desk took over and spoke to the manager who in turn contacted hotwire for us and arranged for a refund. This was a big relief as we had spent so much extra on having to buy another plane ticket and booking the hotel in mexico. I really appreciate that they went out of their way to help us and thought this was excellent customer service. On this basis I can only imagine that our first experience was an unfortunate one off. I would recommend this hotel if you are staying in the area the rooms are good and I can now say that the staff are extremely helpful also.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: RSH01
Reviews.Content: Our initial room was nice and clean but we had neighbors who were there to "party" in LA. The hotel tried to diminish the noise in a very professional manner but at same time moved us to a small suite which was amazing(great view, comfortable king bed, separate siting area with sleeper sofa for my kids). The views from the hotel are excellent and location idea for us since we were visiting our son at USC. The concierge went out of his way to help us with restaurants. I really like the hotel and for LA, I thought prices were quite good. We will return.

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong with Westin”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravel7778
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a business trip. Everything was great and live that there were so many restaurant options within the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointing. Seemed tired and old”
Reviews.Author: Marie H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I only stayed one night enroute from Las Vegas to Vancouver. We chose the hotel because we had stayed in other Westin Hotels in Australia and found them to be first class. First impressions were disappointing. The reception was rather bleak and looked as if it could do with a makeover. The staff were pleasant and helpful though. Our room, when we eventually got to it, had wet carpet. Obviously it had been shampooed quite recently. There was also a leak in the bathroom, adjacent to the toilet. On mentioning this to reception, they quickly moved us to another room, which was a lot more inviting. We stayed in and had room service. Our meal arrived promptly and was delicious. And we found the bed to be very comfortable. Next morning our account was processed quickly and the doorman checked for us that our coach to the airport was on time. We did enjoy reading the plaques near the elevators that told which movies had been made at the Westin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Quality and location”
Reviews.Author: hernargentino
Reviews.Content: I was lucky to get an amazing rate through Priceline and received a 4 star treatment, Great Location, Fine rooms, awesome swimming pool

Reviews.Title: “Average, but comfortable stay in Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: solotrvllr
Reviews.Content: For my first time in downtown LA, I decided to chance it with the Westin despite the mixed reviews. Overall, I had a comfortable stay, but the housekeeping could have done a much better job. I might stay here again, but for the price, I think the Hilton Checkers two blocks away is probably better. Check-in and check-out was quick; although there seemed to only two or three people at the front-desk at any given point despite there being at least 6 or 7 check-in counters. No one at the Starwood preferred guest check-in all the times that I checked. I got a room on the 27th floor, which was reasonably clean and large enough. The nicest thing about the room was the floor to ceiling view. The king bed was large and comfortable. The flat screen TV had a good selection of channels and movies. The bathroom was very clean, but the tub had a few stains - an indicator of the age of the place, more so than anything else. Plenty of plush towels and a complementary robe. The amount of hot water and shower pressure was also pretty good. The trash bins in the room were not empty on check-in which leads me to think that the room was hastily cleaned. I immediately checked the bed to see if the cleaning was superficial, but it appeared to be clean enough. Two of the pillows had a couple of small spots of blood, so I was worried about bedbugs. It took a couple of tries calling the front desk to get housekeeping to come and clean the room again. There was no complementary water in the room on check-in, but the housekeeping included this on the second day of the stay. The hotel complex is a labyrinth, and the concrete structure is reminiscent of a shopping mall, but I actually liked the architecture. There were some reviews about waiting ages for the elevators but this was not my experience. In fact, I felt that average time I needed to wait for was 30 seconds or less. I was given complementary internet access which was unexpected and pleasant - connecting to it was quick and it was fast. Parking and internet costs in general are somewhat astronomical in the area anyway. Overall, I would give this place 3.5 stars. If they paid attention to some small details (like ensuring housekeeping is immaculate), I would give it 4 - 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: “Rooms nice. Staff friendly.”
Reviews.Author: inro41
Reviews.Content: I spent four days in LA. Checked in late and got a double room. Staff were nice and moved me to a King bed the next day. Valet folks great......they gave me a discount and I didnt even have to ask......charged me only $14/day instead of $35/day. Rooms on the smaller side but quality very nice. Location excellent. P.S. Saying thank you to the staff goes a very long way !

Reviews.Title: “What a Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: smartmart4475832
Reviews.Content: This was our second visit to LA and we stayed at the Bonaventure both times. The rooms are spaceous and have fabulous views, the glass lifts (elevators) on the outside of the building are amazing as are the views from the cocktail bar. The staff were all very polite and helpful and gave us a walking tour map taking in all of the intersting sights without having to worship celebrity status LA has a wealth of culture to enjoy and we thoroughly enjoyed our visit.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful and Interesting”
Reviews.Author: angelfish6428
Reviews.Content: The beds were very comfy, the hotel was beautiful (lobby was having some renovations, but could tell it will be gorgeous when done), the rooms were interesting. Our room had lovely floor to ceiling windows and was circle shaped! Each of 4 elevators had a theme and I'm guessing the rooms were the different shapes - circle, triangle, rectangle, and for the life of me I can't remember the 4th! Convenient downtown LA location, beautiful view from the room.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable accommodations in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: germatt2
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean, yet a little small. All of the staff were extremely nice. The location is great and easy entrance access to the 110 freeway.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay as Usual”
Reviews.Author: JGCruiser
Reviews.Content: Stayed 9 nights as part of a large conference. Have stayed here before several times and always enjoy it. This time I was assigned a very nice room on the blue tower. The only observation I have is that parts of the room had a moldy smell. Asked for a de-humidifier and they did not have one. But overall a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Awkward Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sirk98
Reviews.Content: Wife and I stayed here to be closer to some friends on a trip to LA. While the hotel looks like the future (I suppose, if you were here in 1970), it is very awkward in layout. It became a PAIN trying to just get to the elevator from the garage. Staff was exceptionally friendly, but I was very annoyed that they wouldnt give us a room with a king sized bed because we booked through priceline.

Reviews.Title: “Would Definately go Back!!”
Reviews.Author: MsTrinaWilliams
Reviews.Content: The Westin Bonaventure Hotel was a beautiful hotel. The staff was friendly and helpful. Though the rooms were kind of small, the view was beautiful and the room was beautiful. There are several restaurants in the hotel (full food court on the 4th floor), although because it was a holiday weekend, most of the restaurants were closed. The hotel is within walking distance of the metro station. Bus service is right outside. Macys and the Staples Center is also within walking distance of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “poor service, charges for everything possible”
Reviews.Author: Vivian L
Reviews.Content: On top of the charges for parking ($35) and internet ($12), local call starts at $1.50. Unlucky for me, I forgot to bring a copy of one of my reversions, I was directed to the business center, which took me 10 minutes to find, because it is inside the FEDEX office, and the hotel staff I talked to didn't bother to tell me!! And, of course, I had to pay for that one piece of paper, $1.05. It is a big deal when you're staying 4 nights and are paying such high room charges already, then find everything other than the bed you sleep in costs ADDITIONAL!!! I was traveling in the mid-west the week before, a 2-star hotel I stayed at offered free wi-fi and free access to their business center. I will never come back!

Reviews.Title: “Concrete glam foyer - nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Mayoress
Reviews.Content: If you need to stay in downtown LA, this is a nice spot. Not sure if there was something on, but the hotel seemed quite busy. The parking is pricey at $35 per day, but not always uncommon at hotels these days. Get in early because guest parking tends to fill. Allow a decent amount of time for valets to retrieve your car also. Rooms were clean and staff were friendly. Some of the rooms have been recently renovated, Didn't really have any complaints about noise at all. The only negatives I have was that our room service took an hour. We ordered at 2am and at 3am after falling asleep, we were brought our cold grilled cheese and fries. But at 3am, who's looking for quality? It's also a shame that hotels charge for Wifi. Any Wifi charge is steep, with parking and wifi, that's almost an extra $50 per day. Ouch! The pool was also pretty dirty, the next day it was drained so we didn't get to use it.

Reviews.Title: “A cool building but watch out for fees”
Reviews.Author: Danielle W
Reviews.Content: This hotel was for us a spur of the moment Priceline find, and after learning where we'd be staying, we were pessimistic based on reviews here. We were pleasantly surprised to find the hotel more awesome than we had thought. Nice robes, a good bed, and a freshly reno-ed room with an amazing view from the 23rd floor! The rooftop pool is clean, the perfect temperature, and quietly hidden above the bustle of the city. The architecture of the building is really interesting and the exterior elevators are fun to ride in. As other posters have mentioned, the $35 mandatory valet parking fee is kind of lame, and we opted out of the $13 daily internet to keep our costs down, but since we got such a good deal on Priceline, this hotel ended up costing about the same as our airport hotel the night before, and it was much of higher caliber. Also a note on the neighbourhood - we (small town Canadians) had been scared into not looking elsewhere for cheaper parking fearing mugging or break-ins, but we walked to Pitfire Pizza (about 6-8 blocks away) and back that evening, and although the neighbourhood does have some interesting residents, its quite busy and we felt safe the entire time. I think if your times worked out OK, you could find a deal on parking in one of the neighbouring office towers. There are some flow issues due to ongoing renovations, but when they are complete, the Westin Bonaventure will be a solid choice in downtown LA hotels. At which point we probably won't be able to afford it. :)

Reviews.Title: “Awful, don't stay there”
Reviews.Author: tuesdayjones
Reviews.Content: I booked in last minute when our flight was delayed in LA overnight. I just wanted a nice hotel, with good room service, in-house movies and quality toiletries. I thought I would be safe to go to a Westin hotel. Maybe Westin as a brand in the US is third tier, because it isn't in other countries I have stayed in. I am usually delighted by my Westin experiences. This was dreadful. It is a concrete monstrosity, ugly, dark poky rooms, no in-house movies, just tv channels. Room service was a major rip off, over cooked steaks for $40+ and an inhouse wifi so complicated to join I gave up. In addition toiletries was soap and some cheap shower get.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with our stay!”
Reviews.Author: MA_Vacationer
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights in August. We were in LA for a concert and wanted to stay Downtown to be close to the Staples Ctr. Our room (on the 18th floor of the blue tower) was small but clean. According to the front desk staff it was recently remodeled. The staff were great - very nice and responsive. We didn't have a car so parking wasn't a factor for us. My 10 year old daughter loved the elevators and the pool. One evening we went to the revolving lounge on the 34th floor and enjoyed watching the sun set over the city. I would recommend this hotel to my friends. We flew into LAX and took the Union Station FlyAway bus then the metro red line to 7th St/Metro Ctr then walked a few blocks up Flower Street to the hotel (don't take Figueroa as that entrance to the hotel was closed). It was a very easy commute.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Rooms and Delightful staff”
Reviews.Author: VarfWizOne
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a convention at this hotel. It was a lovely place to stay, although it's still under renovation. The lovely fountains you see in the pictures were dry but that was fine. Our room was adequate in size - not large but then I didn't go to LA to hang out in the room. It was very clean. the elevators are amazing and FAST. Never had to wait more than 30 seconds and the place was full. The food options were good within the hotel and reasonably priced for hotel food. Our conference meals were also lovely although if you're a tea drinker in the morning you'll have to ASK for something other than decaf. The location is good for downtown access. Easy walk to the metro station and the DASH bus can get you to the garment district for 50 cents each way. We used the bus system and metro to get around town with no problem at all ALTHOUGH we didn't walk too far from the hotel after dark. WARNING: There is NO free internet access ANYWHERE in the hotel. It's $12 a day that I consider usery. We had wi-fi on our cell phones and used that but only the Verizon had access. ATT could not hit a wifi hub until I walked over to the library across the street a block.

Reviews.Title: “Suites are incredible - rest of the hotel not so impressive”
Reviews.Author: schmelke1
Reviews.Content: Stayed here only one night on business -- in a gorgeous suite -- absolutely beautiful, huge, and with great amenities. If I judged this hotel based on the initial reception and the lobby, this would have been negative. We were not allowed to unload at the hotel entrance, but in the garage. If anyone would have told us how far we were from the reception, we would have asked for assistance. VERY poor welcome. Reception was busy and while there was a separate line for SPG members, it was unattended. Service was mixed -- some was fabulous, some seemed disinterested.

Reviews.Title: “Some good..some not so good”
Reviews.Author: SDDots
Reviews.Content: The hotel layout is confusing with four towers and elevators that do not stop at every floor. I was attending a conference and was constantly trying to figure out which stairs/escalator was where. Parking was $35 a day!!! Nice pool and exercise room. Hotel rooms were good size, water pressure in shower was perfect and the double shower curtain actually worked. The only thig missing was a shower cap, yes, they will bring you one, but do you really want to stand there naked and shivering while someone brings it to you? Personnel was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “The expensive (and mandatory) valet aside, the Westin Bonaventure is a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Maclock
Reviews.Content: With many places to eat and drink in the hotel itself -- something that comes in handy when night rolls around and downtown LA closes until the following morning -- the Westin Bonaventure is a great place to stay. I found the staff members to be gracious and eager to serve. I would recommend the Westin Bonaventure should your business travels take you to downtown Los Angeles, even if getting nickled and dimed for things like parking and wi-fi/Internet access is thoroughly annoying and transparently cheap.

Reviews.Title: “another westin with too many rooms and carzy parking prices~”
Reviews.Author: navawritz
Reviews.Content: well, what can i say? the hotel is located in down town los angeles area. we needed to stay for early meetup to avoid driving on the 405 in the early morning hours. which is another los angeles story by its self. i am glad we got to stay there as i was not sure about down town los angeles. the hotel its just too big. you have a "factory guests" feel. let them in, let them out .robe them blind and go next. the cost of everything is such an insulate to people indulgence. the rooms were fine not to large but ok.the walk to the room it was another story. the beds were comfy but the noise of the next door guest talking on the phone was so annoying. we got a good rate via hotwire. we will never had paid the asking crazy prices. yet the parking cost is 45 dollars a night and you must have a car as one of the costly things in los angeles after parking is taxi's. smiling i will not come back and will watch any hotel with that size of room numbers. have a good day in la~

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased, Would Return”
Reviews.Author: MinnesotaPrincess
Reviews.Content: Staff was very pleasant, elevators fast, weekday breakfast buffet seemed a little over-priced for lack of breadth of selections.

Reviews.Title: “it was okay”
Reviews.Author: ricemuncher
Reviews.Content: first off, the housekeeping is terrific. probably the best housekeeping we have ever had. secondly, the concierge is fantastic. we had a tough time with the front desk but we got it at 1am so i may have just been cranky. we booked through priceline at an amazing rate, so it was worth it. i would not pay full price for this joint. as the other reviews have said, the place is a bit dated and confusing but so is all of downtown LA.

Reviews.Title: “Just fab”
Reviews.Author: DurhamTeddy
Reviews.Content: What a lovely hotel, excellent helpful staff and immaculately clean, Rooms are a very good size bathrooms excellent, and huge TV's ....if you get chance to watch. Revolving returant on top floor with a bar you can use if you don't want a big meal, views excellent.Hop on Hop off bus stops outside, possibly not best company but does get you around if only here for short time and is very convenient, has 3 loops, you'll need to go early if doing all in 24hrs,but 48hr ticket is available too. I would highly recommend this hotel, the lifts(glass) are an experience on their own, if a little scary for those of us with mortal fear of heights!! A little out of the way but all is accessible if need be.Car Valet service excellent and worth the cost for hassel free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Got a Good price for a clean place to sleep and shower”
Reviews.Author: SandraMchelle
Reviews.Content: This hotel is definitely not at the same level as other Westin hotels I've been to, but the room and bathroom are very clean and the bathroom had updated fixtures. The housekeeping staff were pleasant and thorough. The people next door were WAY TOO LOUD but after calling the front desk, that was quickly resolved. We got a great price on priceline.com so I think I got more than enough for my money. The staff overall were nice. I didn't have any problems with the elevators and I ate at some of the small restaurants on level 3. Well priced and tasty. The hotel is about two blocks from the metro. Would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a sneer”
Reviews.Author: jarthurw
Reviews.Content: My partner and I flew in from Australia and got to the Westin Bonaventure by about 11 am. We thought we were clever, since we had rung a few days before and were assured that there should be no problems with an early check-in, and the request was in the system. So we went to the reception desk and were met with a VERY icy reception. The desk clerk told us that check-in was 3 pm and that the hotel was full. I asked to speak to the supervisor, and Sonya came out. She told me that there was a "request" for an early check-in, but that really didn't mean anything. I asked if there were any rooms where the guests had already checked-out and where we could get in early. Sonya was uninterested in checking for such a room and told us that check-in was at 3 pm and our "request" was really unimportant. We finally did get into a room at about 1.30 after annoying the desk staff every half hour to check on room progress. We ate at the lobby restaurant and again service was terrible. We had to request service, although there were many staff. The food was adequate but nothing special. Internet service at the Westin Bonaventure costs about $12.00 per day and starts at 3 pm -- not $12.00 for 24 hours! Fortunately the internet service went down on the morning of our second day, so we were not charged for 2 days (even though we only were in the room for 23 hours!) Although the rooms were adequate and the views good, we got the idea that the staff were doing us a favour by allowing us to stay at the Westin Bonaventure. In over 30 years of international travel, I have never received such snotty service. If we ever need to stay in Los Angeles again, we will try to choose a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “a hotel whose time has passed”
Reviews.Author: mtx4
Reviews.Content: this hotel may have been great in the 80s but it does not have a 'westin' feel about it- the presentation is okay but there's nothing to write home about. room service took one and a half hours. we had to order room service because we were misinformed about the lobby restaurant- apparently their receptionists don't know when the restaurant closes! we were also given incorrect information about the airport taxi during check out. there is one other really expensive restaurant and some shabby eateries on one level that are more liek 1- star than 4-star. the location is not bad, there are restaurants within walking distance and there's a metro within walking distance as well. the tour bus comes right outside the front doors which is convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking”
Reviews.Author: Mumnelsk
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel which takes your breath away inside as it is amazing to look at. Lifts are not for the faint hearted as they are glass and outdoors, and I found them very scary as i am scared of heights, but I overcame this by looking at the lift door instead! Hop off and hop on buses stop outside the hotel, convenient, but perhaps not the best operators as you tend to wait a long time for busses, but it was an excellent way to see all of LA in a short time.. If you don't mind the wait.try the revolving bar at the top of the hotel, really worth a look, but the staff weren't great there. On then whole, an excellent hotel but not very central.

Reviews.Title: “It Was Ok, Valet Parking adds up”
Reviews.Author: Ed R
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fairly nice, the location is central to a lot of places in the area and is close to the freeway. The rooms were a bit on the smallish side but had a great view. The Hotel is pretty famous for being in several movies so its a pretty good cool factor. The Valet parking adds up though I booked the room through hotwire and the Valet parking cost a 1/3 of the room. Kinda steep but I guess thats the price for parking in downtown LA.

Reviews.Title: “Decent room, terrible elevators”
Reviews.Author: yohagopelo
Reviews.Content: On Tuesday morning I waited 17 minutes for an elevator. That is not a typo. 17 minutes. I would have been late for a business meeting had I not known that the elevators were terrible and given myself some extra time. The rooms are decent, there are plenty of food options and the location is in the middle of downtown. Just be prepared that there are certain things - horrible elevators, shoddy wifi, bland furnishings - that make this a hotel I would not want to return to.

Reviews.Title: “stay here every time i visit los angeles.”
Reviews.Author: kriste614
Reviews.Content: this hotel has great service and being a starwoods member makes it even better. my room is always clean and the beds are so comfy. it's within walking distance to a mall but the garment district is only about a mile away. great shopping there. i always seem to get a good rest here. the restaurant on the top floor is amazing. good food, but the view is awesome and the rotating room is an added plus.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal, good location”
Reviews.Author: Gris909
Reviews.Content: This is the second time staying in this hotel. Got a great deal on Hotwire. Some of the good things about staying here: location comfy bed re done bathroom/great lighted mirror for make up application awesome view from almost all floors nice pool area flat screen tv Now the bad; $35 per night for parking??!! WTF clover design kinda irritating small rooms still renovating very pricey restaurant All in all not bad. I know a lot of people are hating on this place, but hello??? It is like over 25 year old place. Anyway I would recommend this hotel. Tip: walk to the metro (subway station) on 7th and metro and take red line. Goes to Hollywood and Highland, lots of "touristy" museums and places. All day pass only $6.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent beds!”
Reviews.Author: airtimejunkie
Reviews.Content: We really did enjoy our one night at the Westin Bonaventure! The rooms were very comfortable (loved the carpet!) and the beds are heavenly indeed! The hotel was easy to navigate with signage everywhere. The rooms featured Starbuck's coffee (Africa Kitamu) which was a nice touch! The bathroom was roomy with plenty of thick towels. The bathroom products were also very nice. Our ONLY complaint was that the hotel charges $35 per night for valet parking, and it's the only parking they have there. After we checked out of the hotel, we waited at least 10 minutes for them to retrieve our car. Would I recommend this hotel? Absolutely! Just don't be surprised when you're hit with the parking fee!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Pacman1968
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin Bonaventure this week since my corporate office is up the road and also because I am a Starwoord Platinum member. Compared to other Starwood properties that Ive stayed at, this was a pretty disappointing experience. It started at the check-in counter on the Tuesday. The room with the king bed I reserved was not available so I was a given a room with two queen beds. No big deal until I got into the room and it looked as if the previous guest was still occupying the room (beds not made, towels on the floor, etc). Back down to the registration desk. I was given another 'wonderful' room next to one of the elevators on a lower floor. I had to adjust the AC fan to high in order to drown out the external elevator and guest noise. It did not help me the next day for my business presentation. The registration desk told me they would call me the next day with a new room assignment and never did. This is an older hotel and navigating around the 'cloverleaf' silos and outside crosswalks is a pain. The rooms are renovated but the wireless did not work for me, nor did the ethernet cable in the room. I was lucky I had an aircard with me. Also, the desks do not have powerplugs and are positioned too far away from a wall plug, so I had to relocate the furniture in order to even work on my laptop. Phone, ipad and bluetooth I had to charge in the bathroom. Staff are friendly (when you can reach them). I spent more than 5 min on the phone waiting for someone to pick up from the operator and the phone was never picked up when I was transferred to the registration desk. I had to call the operator back and have someone call me. I know folks are busy, but this was a little frustrating. I just switched to the airport westin instead, even though it means dealing with the LA traffic to get downtown. To add on the experience, as I was just wrapping up this review the room service staff entered my room even though I have a "Do Not Disturb" sign on the door. This place has been an experience. I will never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again and again”
Reviews.Author: rveras
Reviews.Content: This hotel was very upscale for the price we paid (I used hotwire to book it and only paid $104). The check in was seamless. The room was beautiful with updated furniture and LCD TV. The bathroom was very clean and very big. I couldn't believe how great of a hotel this was for the price I paid. It was a great value! We were able to walk to the LA Live area where there are a lot of restaurants. I would most definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Getaway in Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: mnasf
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the weekend when we went to see Les Mis in LA. The hotel is very large with a big city feel. The rooms were comfortable, but we had to wait for our rooms to be available (after the 4pm check-in time). The hotel is in a good location and the breakfast was very nice. The rooms are very typical big city hotel rooms, very efficeint, but not much room. I think this is a better hotel for business, but if I needed to stay in downtown LA in the future, I would consider staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Carmageddon Staycation Success”
Reviews.Author: Crystalized
Reviews.Content: The Great The views! The hotel itself and the rooms are really unique Floor to ceiling windows and glass elevators - love it! The beds and amenities are top-notch My staff encounters at all times were A++, and I’m a bit high maintenance The Good I treated myself to room service twice and it was delicious Really good location – easy access to Red Line and walking distance to a lot of good downtown restaurants and bars The Huh? No pay-per-view movies available I had a clear view of the pool from my room and wanted to go down but every time I looked down there were not enough chairs and people were laying out on the ground – no thank you! The Bad Parking is $35 a night Wi-fi reception in my room was spotty at best and $12.95/day

Reviews.Title: “The Westin Wonkavator”
Reviews.Author: KaliKross
Reviews.Content: This hotel RULES! Maybe it doesn't possess the glitz of the W, nor does it have the trendy hipness of The Standard nearby, but it has far too many great points to be lightly tossed aside. It is a city unto itself, only missing a grocery/drugstore/Rx to complete it to perfection. I haven't had the experience of booking on an auction site & getting a chintzy room. As an SPG member, who books directly via Starwood's site, I got reasonable rates & free upgrades to suites that rival any downtown apt.. By analogy, some ppl buy on eBay then expect to have the right to a manufacturer's warranty or perks at the store. It's ridiculous logic, regardless of one's SPG status. The hotel itself, as well as the Westin with all its plush amenities, is a DREAM. Service, however, is mixed. Some ppl are nicer than others. Three were downright nasty (Sophia at the front desk... I think her name was... Sonia? Unbelievably accusatory & rude, even after I proved her fault. She refused to apologize!) One point taken for service only & that restaurant offerings are limited at certain times. Can't do the Bona Vista before 4pm, but can't get Chinese food at Mandarin West after 5pm or on weekends. Grrr. I love the views, waking up to my beloved 'Hollywood' sign. To make the Westin even more of a delight, it's in the middle of everything in DTLA. Walk a few blocks to LA Live. Stroll to Lil' Tokyo. Take the train to Hollywood or... This is my fave SPG in California so far, and I've stayed at nine of them... and counting. My lil' one and I lovingly refer to this Westin as the "Westin Wonkavator" for its zippy elevators.

Reviews.Title: “Nice experience for a business visit”
Reviews.Author: TusharSrivastava
Reviews.Content: Among the architecturally better Westins within US, it has a great modern feel to its interior with multiple shops and restaurants at various levels. Interconnected footbridges with tennis courts and YMCA provide incentives for sporty people. The standard King size room is slightly small compared to others but is definitely worth the price quoted. If I were to point out the one standout factor it would be the external elegance of the building with its unique look and design. Its definitely worth a visit if you are staying on business in downtown LA.

Reviews.Title: “Fine if staying in Downtown Area”
Reviews.Author: kareny13
Reviews.Content: I find the Bonaventure complex itself a bit complicated if are going to different areas of the hotel -- the food court, gym, the penthouse bar/lounge as you walk through the 3 interconnected buildings. As a Starwood Platinum member, was upgraded to a 1 bedroom suite with 1 1/2 baths; large space, fridge (no mini bar) and received a coupon for a free drink at the Penthouse. Old clock radio - wish they had an iPod station dock. Surprised how quiet the hotel from the traffic. Great location if you need to be in the downtown area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice”
Reviews.Author: Johnptx
Reviews.Content: I was in town for a conference at a nearby hotel but the price was a budget buster. I had to find a way to reduce my expenses and found the Westin Bonaventure Hotel and Suites via Hotwire. My room rate was almost $150 less per night so I was happy on that count. After arriving any fears I had were gone. It was clean, well run, and with a pleasant ambience. The staff was courteous and professional and all in all I had a great stay. I did have to pay for internet service daily and the breakfast buffet was good but much too pricey. The room was smallish but as I was traveling alone, not a problem at all.

Reviews.Title: “Comodo”
Reviews.Author: Lukins82
Reviews.Content: Very nice place to spend 1 or 2 nights. Everyone is very friendly and helpfull. Nice breakfast, good connections. Parking costs 40$/night and it's an hidden cost. If your neighbour is not quite, you may hear some noise. Room Are not perfectly isolated. Anyway I will suggest it for a short period

Reviews.Title: “Waste of Time and Money”
Reviews.Author: MJRez
Reviews.Content: It all started with the major back up in the valet, your only parking option. Moving down hill fast the front desk staff were poorly trained and slow. Their favorite answer is an emotionless “Company Policy”. They choose to charge our credit card with a $100 incident fee that would be refunded after we checked out. Then followed we the “Company Policy” answer. The recently remolded room was still poorly maintained. It was clean but the air conditioning was not working correctly in the bedroom. We eat in the lounge on the 34th floor, the view was amazing, the food was great and the staff hardly bothered us. They were very nice and helpful when they did stop by the table. No express checkout!! The very slow line at the checkout was not as horrific as the valet line. The one person collecting valet tickets was on a ten minute phone call, make the paying customer wait to just check in the parking tickets. When I got in line I was 6 from the counter and by the time he took my ticket the line was 30 deep. The entire experience was disappointing, I would not recommend this Hotel, Westin Hotels or Starwood Hotels.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT, WOULD DEFINITELY GO BACK!”
Reviews.Author: MaryKayPinkLady
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the perfect start to our US trip. The staff were polite and friendly!!! Incredibly helpful. The room was immaculately clean and beautiful decor and setup. For us it was a perfect location. Loved the store Ralph's for food!

Reviews.Title: “The staff are incredible”
Reviews.Author: Kencuisine
Reviews.Content: Having checked in late and being sent to a room that housekeeping hadn't cleaned the staff were most obliging at 1 am and upgraded me tona suite and did so efficiently , mistakes happen , it's how they are rectified that matters! Well done

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel with newly renovated rooms”
Reviews.Author: jfreeman7
Reviews.Content: I found the rooms very nice, and all staff we encountered were helpful and friendly. We didn't realize there was an Enterprise rental desk in the hotel, and the lady there quickly helped us switch our reservation from a nearby Enterprise office that we thought we would have to take a taxi to. There's a weird, dated mall on the fourth floor, which was helpful when I needed to buy a fingernail clipper and a bottle of wine. Breakfast to go from the lobby bar was good - try the ham and cheese croissant! Rooms were spacious, tastefully renovated, and I was able to walk to the metro station and some nearby shops. There's a Starbucks across the street from the hotel - on both sides. I'd recommend this for a few nights in L.A. for business - my husband was there for a conference and I met him there before we headed south for vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay in LA!”
Reviews.Author: VoyagerTom
Reviews.Content: This was my second trip to the Westin Bonaventure, and both times we really enjoyed the rooms and the location! The hotel is very central, and we were able to walk to restaurants and places where our friends live. Recommended! Thank you Westin!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel really made my trip to Los Angeles amazing”
Reviews.Author: Heyxxx
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 11 nights and have not got one bad word to say. From day one the staff at reception were extremely helpfull, one person even let me use their mobile when my phone wasn't working. Rooms were lovely and house keeping was emaculate. Beds were comfy , had a nice tv in room aswell . The hotel had many restaurants so I always had a nice breakfast and dinner . Nice pizza place in there as well which was cheap. Hotel was really close to everything aswell was only a 5 minute walk to the metro and was only 15 minutes from Hollywood. Eveything you needed was on your doorstep here.
