There are cheaper parking rates available in the area, along flower and figueroa street, but you'll have a longer walk with your baggage. Aside from that, I had no real complaints. 3.5 star would be an apt rating. If you are looking for a cheap breakfast/lunch head to one of the deli's on the 3rd or 4th floors - there is also a nice outdoor seating area.

Reviews.Title: “Not really a four-star hotel”
Reviews.Author: ImproptuTraveler
Reviews.Content: Thought it would be better. If you are looking for a four-star hotel experience, go somewhere else. Staff was polite but very impersonal. In fact, everything about the Bonaventure is impersonal. After finding out we were going to pay $35 for parking overnight, we finally got to our room. First impression was not great. Carpet is old, which gives the room a dated impression. Beds were super-small, definitely not queen-size. Despite these issues, the room was quite, which was great. Also, bed and pillows were comfortable. At 7 am though the alarm went off (without us being even aware we had an alarm in the room). So, make sure you turn the thing off before going to bed. Morning shower got the entire bathroom fogged up ... Anyway, if you need to stay in downtown and ride in cool elevators, you may consider, otherwise find another place.

Reviews.Title: “ok if you get a great rate”
Reviews.Author: engphile
Reviews.Content: As others have noted, the public areas need renovating and the layout is confusing. If you are a budget vacation traveler and get a great rate, fine. However, if you are a business traveler and spend much time in hotels, you will be disappointed. My room, while clean, had a poorly made bed. The bottom sheet never stayed tucked in. Some days I would receive bottled water but not others. It is important here because the tap water is nearly undrinkable. Some of my colleagues had dresser drawers with trash in them. If you have a room that adjoins to another one, you will definitely be able to hear any conversations in the next room.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel- stay if you get a great room price. expect other costs.”
Reviews.Author: Canshy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here after booking it on Priceline. We paid $100 a night for the room and we stayed two nights. The room was very clean and modern. Had a comfortable bed but a small bath tub. We were miffed to discover it was going to cost us $12.95 a night for wifi. Our safe didn't work so we stashed stuff at the front desk when we were out sight seeing but they eventually offered to have someone come and fix the safe. The hotel lobby was very attractive looking but the layout of the hotel was a pain. They have limited signage guiding you to the restaurants etc. Staff seemed friendly enough. We ordered room service- the food was decent and the service was speedy and friendly. They mistakenly gave us a wrong side dish (cole slaw) instead of fruit so when we called to let them know the error we had an enormous fruit tray delivered to our room right away (free of charge). Having come from Vegas where parking was free I was irritated that we still had to pay $35 a night for parking despite being hotel guests but I've heard that is typical in the city. I would have recommended this hotel until I saw a sign that's a little disturbing hanging in their valet parking area that reads: "CHEMICALS KNOWN TO THE STATE OF CALIFORNIA TO CAUSE CANCER OR BIRTH DEFECTS OR OTHER REPRODUCTIVE HARM MAY BE PRESENT IN FOODS OR BEVERAGES SOLD OR SERVED HERE". I mean seriously?????

Reviews.Title: “Improvements needed for this class of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: harrier86
Reviews.Content: The only reason I gave this hotel a 3 was the service. I found it to be very good, especially the bell hops and valets. The cons are numerous, including the confusing layout of 5 towers and trying to navigate to the food court area where the elevators do not stop. The room space was wasted due to the circular walls. The room carpet was stained, the beds were excessively bouncy, and were short. I am 6'2" and my feet hung over the end. The availability of the food court (clearly mentioned in the hotel's guide found on room's desk) was nice. However, I was not impressed with the hotel and would not recommend it to Los Angeles travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Did not like the Service!”
Reviews.Author: checkoutmywebsite
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for an acting convention. It is very big. Tons of restaurants, Outdoor pool. Our room was ok. There were stains on the floor. The bathroom was nice with marble counters and floors. I had lunch at the lobby bar with friends, and the people that worked there did not seem like they cared about us and they just wanted us to go so they could serve the agents and directors that were there for the convention. Other then that service was good. Would recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Renovate Me Please!”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaArchitect
Reviews.Content: The Bonaventure is a distinct one-of-a-kind property and has been featured in numerous movies. It has an amazing (but uber tired) lobby, and zippy indoor outdoor elevators. The pie shaped rooms are small and according to the desk clerk who checked me in, mine had recently been 'refurbished". All I can say is if my room had been recently refurbished I'd hate to think what it looked like before! It was tired, carpet dirty, lamps all crooked and the Internet was virtually useless. This hotel is an original John Portman design and almost 40 years old and man it shows. It is in serious need of a complete refurbishment. Not a room by room paint and carpet effort, but a complete, close it for a year and restore it to its original splendor, renovation. It deserves it. Until then, go somewhere else. Beware if you drive here, the overnight parking is $35!

Reviews.Title: “Downtown is a wasteland on weekends”
Reviews.Author: luxurylady99
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for the Rose Bowl becuaseit was close to the LA Metro which went out near Pasadena. The hotel was very full for New Year's. Our room was on a low floor, but still had a view of LA from floor to ceiling windows. It was tiny, and as the hotel is a circular tower, it all was at an odd angle. The bathroom was very large in comarision to the size of the bedroom, however. Even though it was New Year's, we slept very well. We knew downtown LA was very boring but you are really stuck out there. The hotel bar serves food but it is very expensive. There are a few little restaurants hidden in the hotel that none of the literature talks about---a pizza place, a salad place, a couple of Asian restaurants--they are back near the pool. They seem to cater to the workweek crowd, but were open on a Sunday when we finally found them. It is hard to get around the hotel because you have to take the right elevator to the right floor... The pool is tiny, but there is a nice grass area around it, and it gets sun refelcting from the local buildings. The finess room is a series of machines located throughout this area where there are also eateries--very bizarre. I'd stay here for business, but it isn't romantic or in a good location at all. It was very clean, but the lobby and public areas were really warm. A lot of the shop rental spaces were closed, so it just gave a weird feeling.

Reviews.Title: “Once in a livetime”
Reviews.Author: palrost
Reviews.Content: Nice staff and a good location. Splendid stop on our trip round the globe from Norway to Fiji Island.

Reviews.Title: “BADDDDD experience.”
Reviews.Author: ladyandgent
Reviews.Content: BADDDDD experience. We arrived at the hotel at 10 p.m. after a very long day of driving and didn’t get into a CLEAN room until after midnight. Room after room we went into was either partially clean, (missing linens, toiletries and towels) or fully not cleaned (slept in sheets/ place as left by prior guests). To make matters worse, it took repeat trips to the lobby which, in the tallest hotel in downtown L.A. isn’t a short trip, before a staff member actual got out from behind the counter to find us a clean room. Once he began helping us go in and out of rooms with his master key we eventually found a made up room which was older than our original dirty room but clean.

Reviews.Title: “A GEM OF A HOTEL IN DOWNTOWN LA!”
Reviews.Author: MLD31
Reviews.Content: Everyone at this hotel was courteous and friendly. Go out of their way to assist you. Had drinks at the top and it was amazing! Great location. Great staff. I would stay again. This is my FAVORITE Westin now.

Reviews.Title: “Great downtown hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Footloose39
Reviews.Content: Wow! Starting to really love priceline. Scored big on this very nice downtown hotel with all the amenities you'd hope to find, for $87.nt, when everywhere else was asking for at least twice that. My room was on the small side, but nicely done and the bed was awesome. The hotel itself is an atrium style downtown highrise, complete with glass elevators and indoor fountains. Check in was pleasant and efficient. I needed a one night stay somewhere nice, specifically in a downtown LA location, and feel that I got what I asked for and more.

Reviews.Title: “Westin in name only.”
Reviews.Author: fros1y
Reviews.Content: I travel a decent amount, and usual choose Westins when I can. I would not stay at this Westin willingly again. First impressions matter, and my first impression walking into the brutal 70s era concrete and ridiculous fountain lobby was that I had walked into a rundown, kid-friendly hotel that happened to reek of stale booze from the crappy bar in the middle of the lobby. Many of my complaints are hard to address, since they stem from the ridiculous building with complicated elevator system, horrible "wedge" shaped rooms, and just hideous decor. Others are embarrassing, like the crushed french fry and filthy hallways, which clearly went my stay without cleaning or vacuuming. The entire lobby and hallways are a stained, nasty mildew smelling horror that reminds me more of a run down Embassy Suites than a high-end hotel like a Westin. As others have said, the rooms are very noisy. Even on the 27th floor, I had more traffic noise than I do in my apartment on 2nd Ave. in Manhattan. The room itself, despite the bizarre and uncomfortable layout to fit into a wedge, was fine. The rug, colored in 70s drab to match the rest of the 70s drag, was clean and unstained, etc. I normally wouldn't mention this about a Westin, since I'd take it for granted, but the rest of my review prompts me to at least acknowledge this. The cavernous hotel is clearly geared first and foremost to convention travel, not "business" travel. About the only unqualified good thing I can say is that the hotel is centrally located to several large office buildings where I had meetings.

Reviews.Title: “Great If You Want to Drive Constantly Or Never Leave Your Room”
Reviews.Author: sfexile
Reviews.Content: I travel frequently to participate in academic conferences and for pleasure. I have stayed at big hotels all over the U.S. and Canada and never had as awful an experience as I did here. In fact, I usually have a good time, and am not a whiner, or "whinner" as one reviewer says those who don't love this hotel are. Generally I like to go for a walk every day to relax and explore the city I'm in, trying new restaurants, shopping, sight seeing, and checking out little neighborhoods. That was impossible here because the hotel has been designed so that it is almost impossible to go anywhere outside if you are not in a car. The proximity to freeways where the traffic never stops makes the air quality disgustingly bad outside, and you can't walk more than a couple of blocks without coming to an uncrossable freeway or road. The hotel staff seemed to have no idea how to get to anything in any way other than driving and had no maps to give out to tourists. There were also no maps or city guides in the room. On Saturday I found that even the small cafes near the hotel -- all grotesquely overpriced -- were closed for the weekend and there was nowhere to go for breakfast except the hotel restaurant where the simplest meal on the menu cost $22. The staff are nice and do the best they can in a bad situation, but the hotel is claustrophobic and there's no escape except to rent a car and drive away. Due to a physical disability I can;t do that. But they did give us free Wifi, so at least I got a lot of work done. Like all Westins, the rooms are clean and comfortable with a great bed.

Reviews.Title: “Was really concerned based on prior reviews... but what a relief! It was great!”
Reviews.Author: Missy025
Reviews.Content: Thanks to prior reviews we asked for - and cheerfully received - a renovated room. It was just fine - typical of any other Westin I've stayed at. Notables: This place is HUGE - a town (Westin) within a city (LA). Multiple restaurants, towers of rooms, etc. Service was quick and friendly - from the valets to front desk - easy and no complaints. Very comfortable bed - very. Slept like a baby The downside... ELEVATORS. ELEVATORS. ELEVATORS! Took FOREVER!!! And my husband once got stuck on the 19th floor (we were on the 27th). Seriously - waited 10+ minutes for an elevator. Very strange. PS We paid $85 on priceline.... that was a bargain! Parking $35.

Reviews.Title: “Dated, central LA downtown, Parking up to $47 per day!”
Reviews.Author: DoesNotGetOutMuch
Reviews.Content: Single night here after some years. Nothing has been refurbished. The bed was good. We had a meeting that was well attended, service was not outstanding, facilities OK. Several attendees asked to pay $47 to park for the day. I stayed overnight so it only cost $35 .... Discount rooms from $99 on line, do the mathematics.

Reviews.Title: “Some good; some not so good.”
Reviews.Author: benleo56
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel 20 years ago. It was ok then. Presently the rooms are being renovated and I stayed in a renovated room which I was upgraded to a suite. This was a true suite with very complete living room separate from the bedroom and bath area. The renovated furnishings are nice and of high quality. The room cleaning was ok, not great, missing attention to detail. (One lamp was unplugged, a few lamp shades were cockeyed. The kitchenette area in the suite made no sense. They ran electric cords between a cabinet and door. (In other words the cabinet door had to stay open. They needed to drill a hole in the counter or relocate an electric socket to power a microwave and a coffee maker. (They clearly hadn't thought through their remodel.) However the bigger problem is that this hotel doesn't have honor bars. So if you want a coke or beer or drink or snack you have to order room service, wait 30 minutes and really overpay. Additional there is no sink in the kitchenette area. Now the problems: The drive-in for check-in is in an underground parking lot. It looks really bad. They didn't have enough attendants to get people out of their cars and avoid long waits. The common areas are really dated and need of a true overhaul. Not just paint, the lobby has pools or water throughout, there is splashing water noise and it is way too loud. It makes everyone have to speak loudly or not hear one another. The lobby is dark, dank and unappealing. The check in counter looks bad and you can see bare wood casing that supports the monitors being used by the front desk personnel. I ate at the hotel's LA Prime restaurant at the top of the red tower. Steak was a B-. No sizzle, not particularly hot, but properly prepared re: medium etc. Salad was a C. Wedge salad with blue cheese. One of the tomatos was so old it was shriveled on the edge and the dressing tasted like ok grocery store bought. Certainly not worth $12. Had a side of creamed spinach with bacon. This was the best thing served. However, the Cowboy fries were limp and not hot. My guess is they were prepared too far in advance. I will say the service in the restaurant was very good. Last nit. The elevators, which are glass and can provide great views of downtown LA are not ventilated. When it is 98 degrees outside in July this becomes an issue. All in all for $259 it was ok. Next time I need to be in downtown LA I'll try somewhere else. Don't stay here until you've confirmed they have completely renovated the common areas and lobbies and make sure you are booked into a refurbished room.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE!”
Reviews.Author: msaligumba
Reviews.Content: We got this hotel through priceline and no matter how cheap we may have gotten this hotel room I would NOT STAY HERE AGAIN! The room looks old and the hotel itself is so dull looking. Parking is $35 a day! My bf called for towels and he forgot to ask for toothpaste and he calls them back right away and said oh im sorry is it possible to also get toothpaste? and the person on the other end of the line was like "u already called for towels.. what else do you need?!?" SERVICE IS HORRIBLE!!!! ALSO I left my moms IPHONE on the table and when we came back in it was GONE!!! we had to call security (he was very nice) and he told us they were gonna have to investigate it.. we left the room at 11:30 and when we called at&t they said someone tried to access the internet at 2 p.m that same day! and i kept calling the phone it was off.. CMON! u know when your phone is off someone stole it and turned it off! we filed for a police report cause this phone is very important!! We tried to talk to management but we just kept getting connected through security and said their insurance will have to investigate! We are a family that LOVES TO STAY at hotels sometimes we stay at hotels during the weekend and we have left things like laptops and cameras in the rooms and HAVE NEVER EVER HAD ANYTHING STOLEN! we were pretty chocked. PLS STAY FAR AWAY from this hotel!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Housekeeping Issues & Poorly Soundproofed”
Reviews.Author: GoBanana
Reviews.Content: Things were fine till the next to last day of my week-long stay. The maid dumped the trash and made the bed, which is all I need. On the scary day, I took a mid-day break and found all my toiletries rearranged, some from one side of the bathroom to the other. I had everything set up just the way I like, and found this very presumptuous. On top of which, she took my toothbursh & flosser out of the cup I'd been using & put them on the counter WHERE I PURPOSELY DIDN'T PUT THEM!! This was not only rude, but unsanitary. Yeah, wipe the toilet, then handle my toothbrush. So I had to throw out the toothbrush & buy a new one. I suppose it was because of all this that I didn't look at the bed to notice the bloodstain on the replacement sheets till evening. It took 90 minutes & 2 calls to get someone to come up, and then she argued with me. She tried to claim that it had to have been like that, because the sheets were wrinkled. This was absolute crap, since the stain was quite obvious at a glance. So that just told me that someone had put stained, wrinkled sheets on my bed. Also, the door wasn't sound-proofed well. Even ordinary sounds like people walking and having quiet conversations were audible. On the plus side the bed was VERY comfortable, and conference services were great.

Reviews.Title: “This place is no Westin!”
Reviews.Author: Hockeyscribe22
Reviews.Content: This was just as all the reviews said. Completely out-dated unless you get updated or renovated rooms and that's hard because even if you request and are assured, it's no certainty you'll get on! Rugs had stains and room had musty ghetto hotel smell. Bathroom, walls, and almost everything but bed were disgusting! I booked through Hotwire.com and they should be ashamed to call this a 4-star hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Classy, comfortable but slightly jaded”
Reviews.Author: Indie_Viajero
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin LA as I was always interested in this hotel design, which is supposed to be a great example of modern hotel design architecturally. The hotel is a giant sized establishment with a complete set of facilities including multiple dining and shopping options in 3 levels of the hotel. It is easy to get lost except for the maps of the 4 towers placed at regular intervals. The location of the hotel is in downtown LA and it can be quiet in the nights. Getting a taxi is slightly difficult especially if you have to take an early morning transit. The traffic from LA airport in the evening is VERY bad! But the hotel looms as a majestic building and dominates the landscape in a uber modern downtown environment. The nearest subway is 2 blocks away and that connects you to Hollywood and Universal Studios. The drive from here to Santa Monica/ Rodeo drive is also quite long, so its not very well located from the point of view of popular tourist destinations. This is particularly troublesome if you do not have a car as public transport in LA was a bit dicey. The hotel room was big, bright and very very comfortable. The lobby and common areas though looked jaded and in need of a makeover. There are multiple eating options at anytime of the day or night, and as we were coping with heavy jetlag and needed midnight snacks, it was really convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms, great staff, great price...”
Reviews.Author: markmccauley
Reviews.Content: I was a little concerned about my booking at this hotel, prior to arriving. There are a lot of negative reviews. But here's the deal. It's downtown Los Angeles which, as a city, is just seeing what urban revitalization can do. The hotel is a kickback from the 80's. I kinda like the decoratve pools with fountains and under water lighting. It reminds me of grand Carribean resorts when I was a child. It is a 1200 room hotel with countless meeting and conference rooms, so it is tailored for that market and it's busy. Real busy. While I was here this weekend, there were Emmy Technical Awards for Daytime, a wedding, an NHL draft, three days of Dodgers-Yankees games, an Electronic Music Festival, LA Film Festival and that's just what I was aware of. The lobby, hallways and most common spaces definitely made the bottom of the priority list in what I assume is an ongoing renovation. My room was medium sized, but immaculate, great view, Heavenly Bed (TM) nice Panasonic Flast Screen television a great desk and ergonomical chair. The staff are really pleasant, welcoming and accomodating. The maids scurry around the floors trying to be is unobstrusive as possible. The servers and bar tenders are quick, know the product, perform their work accurately, professionally and politely. Bellmen were very eager to assist me with luggage and holding luggage on my check out day. Front desk remagnetized my room key on at least three occasions. Concierge is amazing, I'm just about to write a letter to Westin with compliments to him. So, I'm not sure where people were staying before they came here -- that would motivate them to criticize so heavily. I took a quick wander to JW Marriott and the Ritz Carlton to scope the place out and have a little bite to eat. Yes, they're nicer. Newer furniture, fresher paint, tailored uniforms for the staff, but when I was shopping for a hotel for this stay, I ended up using Hotwire but had looked at Expedia prices for the competition pricing. They were all $300+ P/N. So when it comes to value, I was quite pleased with my $95 P/N room.

Reviews.Title: “A Good Family Hotel”
Reviews.Author: RoshiniKS
Reviews.Content: The main reason for staying at this hotel is to specially attend the SRF Convocation that is held annually at this hotel only. The atmosphere is nice and the staff is friendly. Great Food Court too.

Reviews.Title: “This Westin deserves a poor review!”
Reviews.Author: BMWM5Driver
Reviews.Content: There is no Heavenly experiernce here. Except for the bathroom soap, I cant even tell its a Westin. Might as well be a run down Sheraton. The room is small, but nicely decorated. The common areas - hallway, elevators, lobby feel dirty and neglected. Surely this hotel is at the top of Westins list of needed make overs. I'm a SPG Gold level member and I dont think my hotel room is anything special. I'm here for a conferernce and the meeting facility, service and food is very adequate.

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay”
Reviews.Author: mselle83
Reviews.Content: We stay at the Westin Bonaventure for three nights in May 10 with my husband and it was very nice. First, the service was good, the staff at desk kindly answers to all of our questions. We had a room in the "red" tower, at 28th level. The elevator to go to the room level is really original because, from the 6th level, it is outside of the tower. Once you get up, you can see the beautiful panorama of downtown Los Angeles. The room was not small, clean and had a big flat TV. The bathroom was nice too. Each morning a free newspaper was drop off the door of the room. We ate twice in the launch restaurant at the first floor. The service and the food were very good! And the lobby is beautiful with all the fountains. The hotel is located in the downtown Los Angeles so if you stay here during a week-end the neighborhood is very very quiet (too quiet, it seems the area is uninhabited). The hotel has a valet parking ~ 20$ for 1 night. It's not cheap but it's the easiest place to leave you car. In conclusion it's a very nice hotel, we really appreciate our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Needs Further Renovation/Cleanliness issues”
Reviews.Author: bill89117
Reviews.Content: Although rooms have been redone, my room had stains on the carpet and I did not get housekeeping service until after 5:00 p.m.; room service trays stayed in hall all day and hallways not vaccuumed.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel exceeded my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Arkansasgranny2
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the hotel stay. The staff was courteous and friendly. Although the rooms were small, they were acceptable. A refrigerator was provided and you could request a microwave. You also had to request more soap and shampoo when needed. Food court on 4th floor had many good choices. Sudway on 6th fl. Relvolving restaraunt and lounge on 35th floor was neat. Don't miss it. Go early -no food after 10pm. A few expensive shops on the 6th. Excellent fitness center and walking path on 3rd. Getting on correct color elevator so that you could get off close to your room was minor inconvenience. A lot of walking in the hotel just to get to correct street levels. Too far from convention center or Staples center if you plan to walk. All in all It is worth the price.

Reviews.Title: “One of the worst hotels!”
Reviews.Author: shakergrandma
Reviews.Content: I am sitting here in my room as I write this review. I had to pay for internet service! My first impression of this hotel--filthy dirty carpet in the lobby and main areas, old, dirty rundown, in need of updating badly! The staff have a "I don't care about you or this hotel attitude", it's a little unnerving! The rooms aren't quite as bad, they are cleaner, however they are small, oddly shaped, and noisy. Because the hotel is round (there are several towers) the room is pie shaped, which makes everything seem out of whack. The housekeeping staff do not replenish the bathroom or coffee supplies which is very aggravating. They pretty much make the bed, and put fresh towels in the bathroom. My room is in desperate need of vacuuming, but I'm sure it won't get done until I check out in 4 more days! I hate this place and wouldn't have stayed here if it weren't for the fact that this is where our business meetings are being held. I sure hope they never book this hotel again. It is in no way like any other Westin property I've ever stayed at. The shops and restaurants in the hotel are closed most of the time, so don't rely on them. I went into the gift shop to purchase a diet coke and without even looking up was told "we're out". How does that happen? I will stick with Marriott and Hilton properties from now on!!!

Reviews.Title: “Guest Rooms are better than the rest of the hotel”
Reviews.Author: LineeNYC
Reviews.Content: I had once heard this hotel was special and the glass elevators do indeed give you spectacular views of the skyline but the rest of the common areas are too dark and feel out of date. The Guest room was fine. The bed was comfortable with good linens. View from 19th Floor was memorable. Bathroom was clean. Flat panel TV has plenty of channels. Close to the metro station & area businesses. I never tried the food but heard there is a restaurant overlooking the city from the top floor. I would not have enjoyed any time beyond my one day stay. Concierge wasn't helpful and lacked interesting ideas. Front Desk Staff weren’t particularly cheery. They should liven and brighten the lobby atmosphere up a lot. It is one giant dark colored oval with pools of water in the center – these are not fountains but pools. The water looked murky to me. There are shops (i.e: jewelry, clothing store) and services(registration, concierge, car rental, baggage services, gift shop) around the oval but none of these “stations” were enticing. I would not recommend paying over $100 / night for this place.

Reviews.Title: “A nice stay”
Reviews.Author: Katemonster128
Reviews.Content: Spent four nights in the hotel while in town visiting family. The location is really great and convenient. Our room was comfortable and the hotel was nicely maintained. The elevators were really cool, unlike anything I have ever seen in a hotel before. The only complaint I had was that the little cafe/bar in the lobby seemed to run out of breakfast stuff pretty quickly, with the only alternative being the sit down restaurant. Also, the shops/food places on the upper lobby levels looked a little shady. There also seemed to be a lot of empty storefronts upstairs as well. Overall though, a perfectly nice hotel in a really convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Ridiculous charges for parking, internet and breakfast.”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel720
Reviews.Content: My issue is with the $35.00 a night parking. That is totally ridiculous. I wish that I had researched this hotel better and I would have stayed somewhere else.. Also breakfast for 2 came to over $50.00! I'm sorry but there are alot of nice places to stay in LA without all the piled on charges. The rooms were O.K, nothing special......But never agian. When I questioned the parking price I was told "it use to be $42.00"....Like $35 was a big favor... They also charged for internet.....that was the final straw for me....I think it was $13.00 a day. I made a big mistake in this place.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what we expected”
Reviews.Author: DeltaFlyer_Boston
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with a friend back in April before a LA Kings playoff game (Kings will be back in the playoffs and stronger next year!) and we couldn't have asked for anything more. We were given a room on an upper floor with fantastic views of downtown, hung out at the pool before walking down to Staples Center and as always, the Heavenly Beds did not dissapoint. Yes the hotel is not new and shows its age in areas, but we didn't come in expecting a Four Seasons or Ritz. Within the hotel there are many restaurants (some full-service, others fast food), retail outlets (gift shops, liquor store), a gym and complementary lobby computers to print airline boarding passes. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Opportunity lost”
Reviews.Author: BossFan62
Reviews.Content: From the outside, this is an interesting looking hotel. On the inside, it has lots of quirky potential. Unfortunately, in staying here for two nights I got the sense (almost from check-in to check-out) that the hotel is on life support and they've called the priest for last rites. What a shame. Some clues are small. They've taken out amenities like minibars, pay per view. The public areas are dimly lit, with worn carpet and furniture. My room has carpet straight out of 1977 with the only upgrade being a flat screen tv. Even the bath amenities are less than Westin standard. I'm a Starwood fan, a platinum preferred guest, and I will never stay here again. Sad, because - as I said, it has great potential if somebody would put a little money into it.

Reviews.Title: “great vacation hotel..don't listen to whinners!!”
Reviews.Author: mickeygabe
Reviews.Content: Hotel was great!!..Excellent location...Rooms with great views of city...Very clean...1.5 miles from Dodger Stadium....Don't listen to the "Hoite' Toite'" reviews that some write complaining about this hotel.....Unless trumpets call out their arrival they'll always complain....Kids had a good time here too...Pool...Ice cream at stores..Fast food court on site...Hotel was used in the filming of "True Lies" (elevator horse scene) so it has that coolness for the kids too...The only downside was the price of parking ($35) but if you park across the street at the world trade center lot it's only $10...Anyways I would stay and recommend this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A different Era”
Reviews.Author: Live-only-once
Reviews.Content: This is a Hotel from a different era. It must have been magnificent in it's time. My first impression was "OMG, what is this?" but the Hotel grew on us and generally made me smile. There has been "selective" remodeling but the whole place really needs a major overhaul. It looks tired. The rooms are extreamly small with great views. They have been updated cosmetically but the doors have cracks and the air/heat units are old and badly placed. There is a disco in the Hotel !!! who has that anymore ? :) There are boutiques and fast foods, hair salon, spa, gym, etc on a few floors. The Hotel restaurant is expensive so we didn't try it. The Hotel is priced accordingly. The cost of parking and internet is the same at all the hotels in the financial center...high. The staff are not overly friendly or helpful...they are there to do their jobs with minimum effort and stay distant and professional. The valet only parking can be a drag on weekends as they do tend to get busy with functions and such. We stayed here to attend a concert at the Staples Center and were booking last minute. Of course the LA Live hotels such as the new Ritz Carlton and the J.W. Mariott were out of our price range. The Sheraton Hotel on Hope street would have been our first choice as it is very nice, modern, and reasonably priced, but again I couldn't find good rates. On the whole, this is not a bad hotel and is usually priced well on weekends. It's just sad to see it in it's current shape.

Reviews.Title: “Time warp - back in the '70's”
Reviews.Author: Moonray1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin Bonaventure because we wanted to be near the California Club for a conference (It's walking distance). Were told at the front desk that the hotel was in the midst of a 3 year major refurbishment. It's about time. The whole interior looks like a bad 70's version of what they thought the 21st century was going to look like. It's a sterile, conrete Star Trek/ Battlestar Gallatica kind of look complete with external all-window pod looking elevators - remember those? The staff told us that most of the double rooms and suites were already renovated. The lobby would be done by next year end. We stayed in a suite and if this is what they call renovated, it's still nothing like the Westin's we've stayed at in terms of modernity, comfort and design. The parking and valet situation is terrible. The Westin has outsourced it to a parking firm. So there is a serious lack of coordination and commincation among the Westin parking staff and the parking attendants. The spa looks like a health hazard. I believe the Westin has outsourced that as well. It's another trip down 70's lane. The women's bathroom has a huge gapping hole in one of the walls and about half of the place is out of order. HOWEVER, the masseuses at the spa are FABULOUS. The two Chinese ladies were are amazing. I would battle the hotel issues just to go back just for them! The spa staff was also very helpful. I couldn't help but wonder if they are just cash-cowing the facility, because it is very obvious that no renovations, updates or even fixing HOLES in walls, showers and saunas has been made. The best part of the hotel was the location. We needed to be walking distance to our conference and that was the only reason we chose the Westin. Otherwise I would not recommend it (unless you just pop in for a massage!).

Reviews.Title: “Positive experience except for price gouging.”
Reviews.Author: Allen60
Reviews.Content: Service and cleanliness was very good. Many amenities. Great views of downtown LA. Downside is charging $13 for wireless? Even economy-chain hotels offer free wireless these days! Only free computer use is to print boarding passes. Also, parking is $32? Really?

Reviews.Title: “Think twice before you book...”
Reviews.Author: RollPositve
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I travel all over the country each month so we are far from novice travelers. We where in LA for a convention at Convention Center which once we got there was way to far away. Having grown up in the area was interested in seeing what Starwood/Westin had done with the hotel. We got a late flight from LAX and checked in late about 11p very tired we where sent to a standard room that was so tight we could not fit! Back to the lobby the FC agent told the night manager who went up to check the next room and never came down personally to say the room was fine he just called the front counter. So up we went only to be told it was under construction (literally) dry wall dust everywhere, grout all over bathroom, shower was still taped up and oh need I mention no TV not even connected? We did sleep in the room only to be placed in a suite the next day but it was already to late. Staff was ok, the layout very confusing, people where getting lost in the 4 different elevators. Hotel is under major construction!!! Lobby bar did have good food, staff at breakfast very rude. Then there was a bar (private) not run by the hotel but access was in the lobby (Suede) we where dressed causal, nice dress but refused access because we didnt "fit" in. Next day the bar manager (Big Hispanic with Minney Mouse voice) said if we didnt like it we could go to another club down the street? Stay away from this hotel, major disappointment for a Starwood Hotel! JW Marriott at LA Live much nicer, better area!

Reviews.Title: “Past its prime!”
Reviews.Author: lisaj816
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Bonaventure in conjunction with a large professional conference. We were sorely disappointed with the experience. Of the dozen Westins I've visited, this property was the most run-down. The other reviews are right - the Brutalist lobby lacks any good restaurants (though there are many good eats to be found downtown). The guest rooms are small and oddly shaped based on the tower design. There was little space beyond the edge of the bed. To make matters worse, the televisions have poor satellite reception! I used the workout facilities and I'd rate them as just okay (several cardio machines, but a windowless space with a drop ceiling). When evaluating the price of the room, the nightly parking was $32/night and internet runs $12/day.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel on the outside...Not impressed with anything else”
Reviews.Author: bkkrogman
Reviews.Content: The best part of the two nights was the bed...and that is why we like the Sheratons and Westins. The room seemed to be recently updated but things were just done half [--]. The toilet seat could be raised all the way, it hit the counter, thier was uneven hole cut out in the shower exposing the sprinkler system. the chair had to sit out in the room since it did not fit under the desk. The carpet in the hallways was very worn, and their seemed to be a lack of maintence all around the hotel. Things were loose, and hanging all over the place. I was at this hotel for business that was being held nearby. If you are looking for nightlife and dining please look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Not family or handicapped friendly”
Reviews.Author: iamthejwalker
Reviews.Content: I was traveling with my wife, 3 year old son and our new born son about a week old. All we wanted was a nice place for one night in LA. What we got was a joke. Before I start on the bad the valet and bellhop did a nice job. But that is it, after we parked the car we had a baby in a stroller and had to use the Handicap elevator and that should have been fine and just as nice as going up the stairs but it was just nasty, stinky and dirty. If I had someone Handicapped with me I would have been ashamed. The girl at check in could care less about helping us, the room should have been nice, it was recently remodeled but the contractor did a terrible job. The bathroom was short on towels; for some strange reason had only one bathrobe not the normal two and it looked old. It was tagged to where we could buy one if we wanted. The TV had very limited channels, over all the room felt very small. The Bonaventure did the one price for the room, but if you bring a car it is $35 for parking, if you want internet $15 more and this would be fine if it was a higher end hotel. But for us at the price we paid and what we were given. 1 Star and never will return.

Reviews.Title: “Modernist nightmare”
Reviews.Author: lawman99
Reviews.Content: I can't fault the people who worked here - they did their best. However, the hotel itself is was designed in the 70s and is terrible. The first 5 floors which contain the lobby and several floors of resturants, bars and other guest services are built around a central atrium. There are no windows and are not desinged for those with a fear of heights. It is hard to see whether it is day or night outside and it is easy to forget which floor you are on. Worse, the hotel is built around 4 glass silos and you need to remember whether your room is in the blue, green, red or yellow silo and you need to choose the appropriate elevator to get to your room. This probably seemed very chic in 1975, but it hasn't aged well. The decor in the rooms is very dated; the Westin should be ashamed to include this hotel in their chain. While I stayed here, a friend paid a third of the price at the nearby Biltmore - that's a hotel with real style, and I wish I had chosen to stay there instead.

Reviews.Title: “Depressing”
Reviews.Author: rhody2007
Reviews.Content: If you are a frequent Westin customer, you will be disappointed with this hotel. At check in, I have never received such a brush off at a Westin - this week I stayed at the Westin LAX and the Westin Waterfront in Boston, and the Westin Ft. Lauderdale last month, where you feel like a VIP when you check in. The hotel staff here have given up and I feel badly, since nearly every store in the hotel is shuttered. It isreally pretty depressing. If you want a nice room at a fair price, this place is fine and I guess the location is ok (although downtown is a little beat if you ask me - the LA public library across the street is fantastic though.) My room was recently renovated and quite nice, but there were crackers and a straw on floor when I checked into it. I just picked them up, as figure everyone has a bad day. However, the service just didn't get better. My key kept failing at my room, forcing me to retreat back 28 floors each time. Most disappointing was the gym - it is too small, machines not working, equipment was old and rusty, and it was way too small for the size of the hotel - there were a bunch of people waiting to work out at 6 a.m. There is a brand new YMCA next door and they should arrange for guests to work out there. I love the Westin brand and was extremely disappointed with this hotel. The doorman as I left was the friendliest and most helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: KimmyG4
Reviews.Content: This was an awesome hotel! and waking up and seeing Will Smith shooting his John Hancock movie right outside our window was the highlight of the trip! it was so awesome! The hotel beds were the bEST!!!! my fiance' wants to buy one sooo bad lol....

Reviews.Title: “A Fun Adventure -- we will return!”
Reviews.Author: PantsOnTheGround
Reviews.Content: We decided to do a shopping and night life trip for our anniversary, using the Bonaventure as a home base. This place actually turned out to be a big part of the fun on our trip. It's a high-rise surrounded by the biggest skyscrapers in L.A., chock full of stuff: Speedy outside glass elevators, shops, restaurants, a club, a spinning cocktail lounge, even a hostess bar! First, the bad: Parking costs some $32/day for residents! Elevator noise was very noticeable at night. We went during the week, and it felt like we had the place almost to ourselves -- kind of creepy. Seafood at the top-floor restaurant, L.A. Prime was expensive, but not fresh. May try it again when business is not so slow. Hotel is a little dated, in general, and we had little idea of where anything was because nobody told us anything. If you are not adventurous, stay away from this place. The good: Ask for a renovated room -- we got one, and were most pleased. Considering the low rate, the room was very clean, comfortable, and had a great view. No problems with the staff at all, but I like to see no staff at all unless I need 'em, so this place was perfect. Cocktail lounge on 35 slowly rotates 360 degrees, and it's a blast, with comfortable surroundings and nice staff. The club on the bottom floor was some fun drinking and dancing. Rates on our dates were extremely low, and we were left with the sense that we had gotten a very good value. If when your day is done, you still want to have some fun before you sleep, I would recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “A Slice of Hollywood in Downtown L.A.”
Reviews.Author: Trevorbord
Reviews.Content: Westin Bonaventure is a nice hotel located in downtown Los Angeles. I am a Starwood Preferred Guest so I chose this location for a quick one night stay in Los Angeles. The hotel is Hollywood themed and there are several plaques and markers which tell of movies being filmed on location. The hotel is massive; the lobby is surrounded by the four towers of rooms. Glass elevators give you a great view of the area as the rise and fall. The room was interestingly shaped, but very nice, and of course the Heavenly Bed was just as advertised, Heavenly! My room rate included free valet parking with in and out privileges and a free wine flight at the bar in the lounge on the 35th floor. I really enjoyed my one night stay at the Westin Bonaventure, and will return again. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the L.A. area.

Reviews.Title: “Stay somewhere else if you can.”
Reviews.Author: Mom_on_the_Road2010
Reviews.Content: The Westin Bonaventure - The room is fine as long as you don't mind finding somebody else's hair in a towel. Room was renovated, but still not great. Housekeeping was vacuuming the room next door at 9:45 pm. Go figure?! The lobby is dated and smells like an "indoor" ride at Disneyland -- too many water features. Staff didn't seem to care if you were there or not. It's nearly impossible to find your way around the place as well. If you find another hotel you like in downtown LA, go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Worn down hotel with lousy service”
Reviews.Author: Deenschoo
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very run down and disappointing. The lobby was dark and grey and the rooms were not well maintained either, The first room given to us was on a floor that had construction works going on. We naturally rejected the room. The second one they gave us had a water leak in the closet! It caused our belonging to be soaked wet and we had to pack and switch rooms half way through our stay. The concierge was not very friendly and were only interested in selling packages that they could earn a commission from. All in all, it was a bad experience and i would never go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: jonna30
Reviews.Content: As others have said, the hotel is dated. At check in, their system was down. Without a lot of information at check in (what time breakfast started, where the gym is, etc.), when I got to my room I looked for the hotel "book" - you know, the one with all of the hotel info. Couldn't find it. What I did find was a photocopy of the room service menu. Seemed ridiculous to me that I had to call and ask for one. My room had been revovated but the TV was old and did not work. They came and immediately fixed the TV when I called, but it still was not clear reception. For the trouble, they did offer me a free movie. So, at least they realized it was a problem that should not have been. Maybe they are working on replacing all of the TV's. I did see flat screen TV's in some of the other rooms, so who knows.... So, after they offer me a free movie, the TV won't let me even see what movies are available...call number 3. Even though the furniture and countertops were "new", the doors and ceiling were very dated. The breakfast buffet was great. They open early at 6:00 which I like. Food was terrific and plentiful. However be prepared to pay, it is $22. The service there was great with the exception of the young female hostess. She had attitude. When I asked if there was coffee to go in the lobby as I was leaving the breakfast area she responded with a simple yes. As I got to where the coffee was, it turns out it is a Starbucks. I went back to her and let her know that I was looking for some that I did not have to pay for, after all, breakfast was $22. Wouldn't it have been easier and much better service for her to have simply asked if she could get me a cup to go? Anyway, overall the hotel was generally clean and safe, I slept well and ate well. Was it the best? Probably not. That said, I am not sure that there is a "best" in downtown LA. A good hotel to me is not having to ask for anything. I don't think I require alot, just basics. I REALLY did not appreciate that I had to make three calls for things that should have been a given.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I was expecting”
Reviews.Author: Buzzie8
Reviews.Content: I was pretty excited about staying downtown on Grammy weekend. The Bonaventure had a reasonable rate. Valet service was well done. Yet at check-in they had just 2 people handling the line. I up graded to a suite and that was nice. Rooms did seem very dated however. The thing that really bugged me was the TV. LA, the meca of television and limited channels. But what was worse was horrible reception. Snow and static on both sets and no HD. I was not there to watch TV. But it seemed out of place in such a hotel?! Staff was friendly and helpful. There were many shops, businesses and restuarants to chose from in the lower level...yet many were closed or out of business. Heavenly Bed was the only redeeming value.

Reviews.Title: “Staff is great, but there's too much noise”
Reviews.Author: DC-Logan
Reviews.Content: Recently attended a business meeting at this hotel which I understand is going through a remodel; was first provided a room with a connecting door; I could hear every word being said, so I asked to be moved. Only other room available was near the elevator; quieter but still could hear neighbors and hallway conversations late into the night. Staff is pleasant and very helpful; room service was good and its centrally located. Rooms are remodeled and not very roomy; but fine for one person.

Reviews.Title: “Room cater for 4 people? Sure... four kids under 5, maybe. Get real!”
Reviews.Author: Vannette
Reviews.Content: We booked it as triple shared room. Found the room was too small, but were told that the room was big enough for 4! We had 3 very small built girls sharing. There was no way we could have 2 girls comfortable fitting into one bed, one of us ended up sleeping on the floor. The beds were that small! Why the heck couldn't they provide us with a roll-away-bed like the other hotels did? Never again!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient but walls are paper thin”
Reviews.Author: MplsBoys
Reviews.Content: The hotel is well situated if you need to stay in downtown LA for business. Be sure to ask for a renovated room - they are pretty nice, although the basic rooms are small. My primary complaint with this hotel is that the walls/doors are paper thin, even worse if you have an adjoining room - you literally can hear everything your next door neighbors have to say during normal conversations. Another annoyance for business travelers is the ridiculous surcharge for internet access - the fitness center is also getting outdated and had several broken machines. Room service was good, front desk helpful and pleasant, Lobby Court restaurant a good option for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “beautifully renovated rooms in a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: joeperz
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over the Holidays. The room we stayed in was recently renovated so we enjoyed a super-comfortable bed, superior bedding, a flat screen tv, great new bathroom and toiletries, free Starbucks in room everyday-even an empty refrigerator to stock ourselves. Perfect! The room is large in part due to the rounded floor to ceiling windows. Ask for a high floor for great views. A nice plus is having a large 24 hr gym with lots of good cardio machines and enough weights for a vacation workout. The lobby is dramatic-4 stories with water features and a circular bar. Good restaurants right in the hotel. Downtown was very quiet over the Holidays so getting around was very easy from here. Only quibble is the $30 per day parking. Walk a few blocks for less expensive lot parking. Downtown is quite lovely, you won't mind the stroll! Would definitely return here.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Downtown December Stay”
Reviews.Author: CaitlinW
Reviews.Content: Hotel was very well presented, room was tidy and liked that they were trying to adopt a green approach by asking guests to request clean linen and towels if desired, unlike many other hotels we stayed at. The room mini fridge wasn't connected (as we discovered when we wanted to drink the wine (!) and the TV remote was missing, these were promptly rectified upon request. Hotel was also non smoking which we appreciated (not sure if this is a legal requirement in California though?). Concierge was not very friendly though - luckily the Visitor Centre was just around the corner and we obtained a lot of useful information from there to compensate! As we arrived in late December (27th) it was very quite in terms of attractions near the hotel as it was in the financial district of dowtown and not much is open at that time of the year. Was quite central for reaching Hollywood, Universal Studios, Disneyland, and Santa Monica as day trips for each. Lots of public transport nearby. The hotel also has many shops and eateries inside, though we did not spend much time there as we were too busy exploring! Overall it was a pleasant stay, my one recommendation being that the timing was perhaps a bit off considering the slowing of the area over the holiday season.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: TRavlerbarry
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin, as I was taking the train from Union Station. Check-in took minutes. They up graded me to a suite on the 14th floor. Room was spot less, bed was great. Had dinner in my room, it arrived in about 20 minutes. Had breakfast in room, it came in about 15 minutes. Check out was a breeze. Hotel was maybe 10-15 minutes to the train station, so worked out great. I have stayed at this hotel numorous times and have never encounted a problem.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel we've stayed in--pool is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Carrie F
Reviews.Content: We were surprised that some of the reviews were not very positive; we had a great experience! The hotel is so fun with all the towers and fun elevators with amazing views, water features and open interior. We loved walking around the grounds. The pool is warm and perfect for swimming at night with all the skyscrapers lit up around you. The bonaVenture brewing co had a band and we could hear it from the pool--which we had completely to ourselves! We found good deals all over this place, from the happy hour menu in the revolving Buenavista lounge (from 5 to 8) to the $3.50 tall cans of beer you can bring out to the pool from the "market" inside. I loved my room--it had the white bedding, soft towels, comfy robe, new carpet, pretty (and working!) bathroom, and of course the view. We could see both the Hollywood sign and the Griffith Observatory from our room. The rooms are pie shaped due to the shape of the towers, which is perfect for great views. The pillows weren't as fluffy as I like, but the bed was very comfortable. Good noon check out too. Yes the valet parking is $32, but thats the going rate and it's convenient with in and out privileges. Walk to MOCA and the LA Phil. Oh and the restaurants are a bit disappointing. I had to send back my cheesecake (how can you mess that up?) and the brunch was $22 each for nothing exciting.

Reviews.Title: “awesine”
Reviews.Author: princessrvils
Reviews.Content: this place is awesome an old and a new section. bathrooms all glass. service is awesome. area in back with water pools to hold parties. you won't be disappointed, but may be overwhelmed. Many famous people walking around like nothing. Sheryl Crow, Lyle Lovett, I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “A Famous movie star finally getting her facelift”
Reviews.Author: SecretAgentReview
Reviews.Content: Ive wanted to stay here since I saw High Anxiety, and later a horse in teh elevator in true lies. Starwood Preferred Guest check in was fast and efficient. As a SPG member recived a 'custom' welsome letter with what amenities are extended. Free internet, cocktail in the revolving lounge (how '60's). Room was on the 25th floor exterior column..the hotel looks like stcoks of quarters around a central rotunded. Room was as expected. Bath broghtly lit. For a biz hotel it did not have enoug outlets , a pet peeve of mine, and one bare shelf of 8 that hold items was nt dusted in weeks or longer. Westins sig Tea scent products supplied, bathrobe (one) internet connection was sporadic. When we retired to bed we found one side was 6 inches lower!!! later found it was not properly placed .. Rooom change took us to same floor but the inner rotunda. These rooms are a bit LARGER btw. The lobby had a bar, restaurant, and many retail - offices. So food from subway to higher end available, all had A board of health ratings. We opted for hair cuts at the salon. The owner was meticulous and a pleasure telling the history of his experience here in LA and the property. He stated many of teh rooms are mid renovation so I look forward to seeing that as wel, its dated. Must have been a wonder when new!! bill arrives under the door and , of course, charged for internet. Never a problem having the fee removed but hate to HAVE TO do it and pysically check out. A 4pm checkout was arranged and is a SPG benefit Parking is expensive though discounted for guests. You can find a parking lot nearby at a lower rate especially on weekends though you must consider benefit of in out privieges. Read a review of not having a micrwave, well thats not teh westin nor proerty standard and not advertised so an puzzled. All chains have their pros and cons. Im writing this from teh magic castle full, and i mean full kitchen...Hampton inns have micro and fridge so it pays to look at the website for all details. Also many items can be requests (some at a fee) Overall a decent property though the bed incdent should have offered compensation of some type. ie. LAX Hilton, id problem or rooms not ready a voucher for a free meal at their bistro is provided. HOTELS AND STAFF FORGET THEY ARE AUDITIONING EVER DAY WITH EVERY GUEST!! With sites like tripadvisor they forget people talk and loudly ; that said I look forward to trying it again when renovated

Reviews.Title: “Nice Outside, not so good inside.”
Reviews.Author: freakeystylie
Reviews.Content: From the outside this hotel looks amazing with it's very unique design, the elevators run up and down the outside of the building's 4 towers. This does not continue inside though, a concrete jungle which feels unwelcoming and industrial. There are many empty or closed retail and food outlets within the hotel which does not help with it's grey interior. The 'unique' layout means getting anywhere in the hotel is confusing due to the 4 towers. The big draw for tourists is the fact that this hotel has been used in a number of movies, eg In the Line of Fire, True Lies etc. That was a while ago now and you can tell that nothing has changed since then with very dated carpets and decor. This hotel is also in downtown LA and not ideal for holiday makers as there's not much nearby apart from a small shopping mall and a few restaurants. You need a car here ideally and there's a good valet service but at $32 a night. Rooms were fine with fridge, TV, safe, a very confortable bed and decent enough bathroom. You get what you pay for! I enjoyed my first stay in LA and liked the hotel but I certainly did not feel drawn to eat or shop there. Would stay there again but would probably rather try different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “rude management, 1980's decor and electronics with bad to no T.V. reception”
Reviews.Author: patsy74484
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Westin Bonavnture with my mother over Thanksgiving. Parking is more costly than NYC. We ate Thanksgiving dinner at L.A. Prime at the top of the hotel and we had the 4-course Thanksgiving meal (there were 3 of us). We were brought the wrong courses a the wrong time. Service was extremely slow and we were not even offered an apology let alone a discount to our bill which was $345.00 for that meal. For that kind of money everything should have been on time and in order with no excuses for kitchen mix-ups. At the time of my checkout, I had been double-billed and asked to speak to someone in accounting. This person presented automatically with a rude attitude and when I demanded a printed confirmation of the refund due me she told me it was impossible to do and that I was trying to tell her how to do her job. Amazingly, when I got on the phone with my credit card co., a printed receipt automatically appeared. I asked to speak with the manager of the hotel and while relating my issue to him, I only got a lot of nodding and he asked me if I was checking out!! I said yes and told him I would never return. I believe they are using the fact that movies have been filmed in the hotel as a "snob factor" to sell themselves. Rooms are dated with very old t.v.s Don't order a movie because the reception is lousy and at times the screen goes to static and you will NOT receive a refund. I am presently at a Best Western in another state n a small Texas community and the service and amenities are well-above what I experienced at the Westin. Nothing against Best Western, they are great but when you are paying the prices that a Westin property charges you do expect a different level of care and attention. I was dismissed as a nuisance. I guess since my face is not publicly recognizable, they assumed I had no influence or importance. They were wrong. Do yourself a favor, stay someplace less expensive or if you want the 4/5 star experience there are a lot nicer, cleanerand more courteous places to stay in L.A. Plus, your T.V. may have been made before 1980! I have a HD flat-screen here at the Best Western in TX with an excellent ribeye thru room service!!

Reviews.Title: “No hot tub!”
Reviews.Author: pcwizard786
Reviews.Content: I called the front desk several times because of loud people down the hall and no one ever showed up. We did not sleep all night. Anemities are fewer than most hotels for example: no microwave, internet for a fee, parking cost $32 and pool but no hot tub! Not worth the price to stay at this place.

Reviews.Title: “Very dissappointing”
Reviews.Author: BrisBorto
Reviews.Content: Our five night stay at the Westin could only be described as dissappointing. Our first experience with the Westin was struggling with our luggage as the door staff looking on with disinterest. Check-in was a problem with the room we booked not available despite the booking confirmation being in my hand. The rooms were small and their idea of a double bed leaves a lot to be desired. We had to ring the front desk on a number of occasions as the room was not stocked properly. We had no hot water on the second night and we were offered a free movie to make up for not being able to shower. Sorry not good enough. I would strongly recommend people look for one of the many better alternatives nearby. We won't be coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated room was fine”
Reviews.Author: Halfalemon
Reviews.Content: ASK FOR A RENOVATED ROOM Even though my association was picking up the tab, I was concerned about the quality of my room and stay because of the negative reviews. In an attempt to improve the chances of a comfortable stay here's what I did: 4 days before arrival, I called the local hotel number, asked for the front desk, and they forwarded me to reservations to confirm my reservation. I pecifically asked for a renovated room. Though my original reservation was made for 2 double beds, I was told that the renovated rooms were only outfitted with king beds. No problem! I'll take the king. Then I was informed that they could only enter a request on my reservation and that the actual room assignment would be made upon arrival. During this time I also made sure that I gave them my Starwood Preferred Guest (SPG) number and that I was staying for five nights. I figured every little bit helps. At 09:00, six hours before my arrival, I called the hotel front desk and was again switched to their reservations department. I again asked to be assigned to a renovated room, and when the reservationist opened my reservation, she said that they still had my request on file, but, as before, the room would not be assigned until check-in. When I arrived to register, my room apparently had already been assigned since the receptionist did not have to look for a room in the system. THE ROOM ITSELF I was ensconced in a 24th floor room in the yellow tower (there are 3 other color-coded towers). To my relief, the room was clean, looked and smelled new, and there even was a flat panel TV! In the bathroom I found two bars of soap, but I still got sealed-in-a-wrapper plastic cups. But what the hey, everything else was within expectations of a comfortable and clean room. TIPPING THE HOUSEKEEPER I commonly tip the housekeeper a dollar, but towards the end of my stay, I tipped $2 because she went to the trouble of arranging the toiletries that I left on the bathroom counter the day before. Later, when I returned to my room in the evening, I found that she had brought in and hung up a bathrobe and left an extra bottle of water for me too. I can only assume that she was expressing thanks for a tip that perhaps does not come that frequently. A NEW MARRIOTT WITHIN A STONE'S THROW Our association had booked hotel rooms months ago for our meeting and was planning to use the LA Marriott Downtown as its headquarters hotel. However, the Marriott's completion date was pushed back so Plan B was invoked, i.e., to use the Bonaventure. I suspect that the new Marriott is causing the Westin to respond with the upgrade and make-over. SUMMARY Had a nice stay; the staff was universally friendly, the room was comfortable. Make sure you get a renovated room.

Reviews.Title: “What a disappointment”
Reviews.Author: dcpam
Reviews.Content: This hotel is not aging well. The room was small and not stocked properly, requiring a call to housekeeping. I used Westin points and check-in took longer than it should have. When I got to the room, it felt like I was sent to the room designated for "free stays". The shops reminded me of what you'd find in a discount shopping area, not on par with what I expect from Westin. Other than it's proximity to Olvera Street and other downtown LA landmarks, I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A ok hotel. Good location for a business traveller, rooms a bit dated.”
Reviews.Author: flygirlie
Reviews.Content: My first time in LA was for a conference on May 2009, westin Bonaventure was the conference hotel. The location was good and I have no complaints about the service. I got a good conference price and that is the main reason to recommend this hotel. The rooms were a bit out of date; the plug of the bathtub in my room did not work. Also, the walls did not attenuate noise very well, I could clearly hear wha tv-channel my neighbor was watching (I think this was because of the door between our rooms, I guess they usually open the door to make family rooms or something). Besides that, nothing to complain. Not worth a 200 $ / night, but with a good offer, go for it.

Reviews.Title: “Was so nice and relaxing”
Reviews.Author: RebeccaE2
Reviews.Content: Must eat on the top floor restaurant and have cocktails in the spinning lounge. We staid on the 26th floor and it was so nice we could see the hole city.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for 5 Star hotel in the heart of LA”
Reviews.Author: sydneyberlin
Reviews.Content: Don't understand why some people seem to have a bad experience with this hotel: Yes, it looks like from the 80ies with all the concrete in the lobby and the outside areas also showing their age. However, it is very much a 5 Star hotel and the location is great. After reading some of the reviews, I was afraid that the room might be run down and old fashioned but it turned out to have been renovated at some stage and the bed was actually as comfortable as you would expect from a Westin. Service was also perfect and the pool very nice in the midst of all those surrounding highrise buildings. They force you to use the overpriced valet parking which is the only negative I can find but at a rediculous low rate of only just above 100 bucks a night this is easy to get over.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny wedge rooms, not at all Heavenly”
Reviews.Author: Cinz123
Reviews.Content: We were put in the blue tower where the room was a tiny, coffinshaped wedge. We were bumping into the furniture trying to get around. The sheets had lipstick on them, yuk. I had read about the heavenly shower but our shower was just regular, no double head or anything special. The double beds were more like oversized twins, one was very hard and one was very soft. For the price it was not worth it and I will never stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown LA Hotel”
Reviews.Author: dancingf00l
Reviews.Content: Hotel is a large hotel in the Downtown area. Some in our party did not like hotel. They felt it was worn, too large and impersonal. I thought it was really nice. The lobby is set up like an atrium and you could see about 6 floors up. Around these 6 floors are shops, restaurants (most not open however), food court and a track and gym. The lobby had a nice bar / restaurant, and the 35th floor also had a really nice restaurant with a view (I heard). Never did get to see it. They have a few different towers in the hotel. We were in renovated rooms, so I thought the rooms were very nice. Some in our party did not have renovated rooms, and I think that is one reason they didn't like the hotel. Beds very comfortable. Clean. Great views of Hollywood sign from afar. Very expensive. Parking was about $35 a day. Seems like a bargain for the area, as parking very expensive in downtown area. Some restaurants nearby. Not too far from convention center. Although a very long walk. I would stay here again. Staff very nice. Nice outside pool. Missed a jacuzzi. Hotel had no jacuzzi.

Reviews.Title: “Tell them you know about the rooms”
Reviews.Author: GaryGilchrist
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference and the consistent bad reviews on Trip Advisor was a concern. I told the lady at check in that I had read about the old smoke smelling rooms etc and asked if I could be put in a recently renovated one. She did and I got one in the blue tower on floor 20. It was perfectly fine; great bed and decent amenities. The bathroom was a bit old with hard water stains, but it was clean. I had no problems, but my colleague got one of the old rooms and complained about it. Also be very careful of eating at the top floor revolving restaurant. The menu is sparse and they just seem to order from room service. We waited so long (about 2 hours) for our order that we had to cancel and leave hungry. Even the waitress agreed something was broken down and it was not her fault. This is another one of those hotels that charge for wireless (very lame for $160 a night). Try the access code adobe/max2009 as it might still work for a while. Or if you are traveling in a group, let one person get an access code then all use it.

Reviews.Title: “Good location - unsurpassed views”
Reviews.Author: motormomma
Reviews.Content: Be sure to go to the top and have a drink or dinner in BonaVista Lounge. Its a revolving restaurant with great views. The appetizers and wine flight made for a nice light dinner. Its worth a trip back with my family. The elevators were cool.

Reviews.Title: “A Grand Stay”
Reviews.Author: cgm95
Reviews.Content: It is impossible for me to understand the negative reviews this hotel gets. It is gorgeous inside and out, centrally located with top-notch service. The room is a tiny bit small, but was clean and efficient (with a huge bathroom). The view was incomparable and the hotel was easy walking distance to, well, everything in downtown LA. My only criticism is the $32 /night car park charge. That's pretty high. Otherwise, no complaints.

Reviews.Title: “not a 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: odonata9
Reviews.Content: I got this hotel on hotwire - I knew it would be either this or the Omni, as they have the same amenities, both 4 star, both downtown LA. I have stayed in the Omni previously and it is SO MUCH nicer than the Westin. We checked in Friday night, it was busy and sold out. We got our room, which a) turned out to be next to an elevator (many are since there are 4 circular towers), b) did not have shampoo or conditioner, c) did not have a guest service guide and d) had plastic cups in the room. I'm sorry, a 4 star hotel should have glass glasses. And normally I wouldn't care about the guide, but there are several restaurants, and I wanted to know about the pool and hours, etc. I called about the guide and shampoo - I was told there is no guide because they are being reprinted (why wouldn't they leave the old ones in the rooms if they don't have the replacements yet?) and someone will bring us the shampoo. While waiting for the shampoo (which took over an hour we had left, and they brought everything but shampoo so we had to call AGAIN), we noticed we could hear the elevator clearly! And it was a busy weekend, so it was dinging a lot. I tried to have our room switched - front desk service was nice, but could not accomodate us as it was sold out. This walls are not thick and it was busy busy busy - all night I heard not only the elevator, but every door that shut on our floor. We stayed 2 nights, so the next night they were able to switch us to a quieter room, (which magically had a temporary guide with hours and room service menus!) but we could still hear the doors closing all over the hotel. The concrete lobby is terribly dated, but there isn't much they can do about that. While at first, I thought the food court was cool since you weren't forced to go to a pricy hotel restaurant, it turned out the places were dingy, depressing, and overpriced. Had dinner at the brewery, which was nice to sit outside - food was good and reasonably priced for a hotel restaurant. Parking is $32/night, but that is about standard for downtown LA hotels. I feel bad for people paying full price for this hotel and expecting a 4 star experience.

Reviews.Title: “very average”
Reviews.Author: sophien
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ok for a business trip, but nothing else. It is not cozy. The carpets in the rooms are very dirty. They really need to steam them once in a while at least.

Reviews.Title: “Business + Pleasure”
Reviews.Author: TarrahF
Reviews.Content: I grew up in Newport Beach, but I had to stay in Los Angeles for about 5 weeks in January for a business opportunity. They gave me really good rates and treated me very well.

Reviews.Title: “Bare bones business hotel - I'd never select it myself!”
Reviews.Author: Cardsgal
Reviews.Content: My company booked us into this hotel because it was close to the venue at which we were working, and we knew at best that the hotel would be like other Westins -- generic, devoid of character, a hotel that could be located in Anywhere U.S.A. -- but this hotel was substandard judged even against other Westin offerings. The toiletries featured in my room were two bottles of hair conditioner (that's ALL), one of two bathroom light bulbs was burned out, the dirty carpet had a four-inch red stain (nail polish, I HOPE, as opposed to the alternatives), and my bed's legs were uneven and it literally tilted back and forth as I moved. Also, no robe was provided, and the a/c sounded like a jet on the tarmac. Need I continue? I would have asked for a different room, but I doubt other offerings were much better, judging by my colleagues' experiences. Did I mention the old-school (i.e. not flatscreen) TVs? Grass around the pool is full of barren and dead patches...this is a depressing place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “This Place Sucks”
Reviews.Author: ethompson555
Reviews.Content: The rooms were ghetto, the service was AWFUL the food for the buffet was awful. DON'T STAY HERE

Reviews.Title: “Save your money and go somewhere else.”
Reviews.Author: madisonj26
Reviews.Content: Ok. Lets be honest here people. This Westin hotel is an absolute disgrace !!!!! I have stayed at many of the Westin Locations throughout the US, and by far this location deserves 1 star!!!! First, the hotel was built in the 70's, and i don't think it has had a re-model since they first opened it. When I went to the Westin's website, the rooms look very nice(just like they should be). As we arrived, I started smelling this strange stench throughout the lobby. When we entered our room, I immediately noticed the stains on the 20-year old carpet and the disgusting smell of cigarettes. I called the front desk to complain, and they sent up a gentleman to spray our room with air freshner(it may have been worse than the cigaretts0 :(:( The furniture in the room was at least 15 years old. The best part was the TV. It was the same television my parents gave me when i was 10 years old!!!(15 years ago!!) The bathroom had visible rust around the lighting fixtures and the bath was not even close to Heavenly!!! More like a deathly bath to me!!! I called the front desk again and I asked them about the web-site and how disgusted i was with the hotel. They explained that they were in the process of remodeling their hotel, and no new rooms were available. I was very upset because I was never told this prior to booking my non-refundable room!! The only neat thing about this hotel is the revolving lounge on the 34th floor, and the LA prime steakhouse on the 35th floor. I am truly dissappointed Westin... Truly .... oh parking is about 35 dollars a night to park.. very exciting

Reviews.Title: “Right off the highway and very clean”
Reviews.Author: Beitrizenow
