Reviews.Content: We stayed here for a wedding we had to attend and it was a nice location and very clean rooms. They were acoomidating to all of our needs. We were not there too much becuase of the wedding but it was a nice place to sleep and get ready. I would recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “A disgrace to Westin”
Reviews.Author: Sine_Patria
Reviews.Content: This was one of the more uncharacteristic Westin stays. The hotel is dirty and worn out. Rooms stuffy with the smell of cleaning chemicals and moldy carpets. The carpets were so dirty that I had to lay down towels so I could move through the room in my socks. Room service is slow and front desk staff inattentive. The hotel consists of several towers joined at ground level by a gigantic lobby with fountains. Just getting from my room to a conference room at the same hotel was a 15-min adventure. Retro-cool glass elevators are overburdened with traffic and vibrate noisily when in motion--a trip to the 27th floor was long and nerve wrecking. Will avoid in the future.

Reviews.Title: “A very confusing hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mightyrover
Reviews.Content: Our organization reserved room and parking for four days. I still had to put a deposit down. I gave a $100 cash deposit as I dont use credit cards. I was told in order to use the room phone to call out I would have to secure with a credit card. I could call room to room with no charge. Wow. Once in my room, I set up my lap top. I was told I would have to secure the fee with a credit card. What, these people didnt listen. I dont use credit cards. What did I pay a deposit for if I couldnt use the internet or make outside phone calls. There were pay phones by the restrooms, which meant I had to go down the elevator again to the lobby to get to the phone. After about 15 minutes of arguing they finally realized that I had made a cash deposit, sent in the tech and set up the internet, which was 12.99 per 24 hours. I had requested a room close to the elevators which I received. The room was not to bad and was close to the elevator- blue tower. Well then comes the elevators, what a mess. In order to get to the 3,4,5,6 floors, you have to go to the lobby then take the access elevator- if you are handicapped- to those floors., if you are not handicapped. you have the stairs or escalator. The shops and the somewhat cheaper places to eat are on those floors. To get to these places and outside patios you had to walk and walk and walk. I ate mostly in those places as to eat in the buffet cost 15.00 each for breakfast and lunch and I dont know how much dinner was. The buffet seemed nice but too expensive for my pocketbook. The one restaurant I ate in was reasonable. It was on the 4th floor, and by the time I got to it I had worked up quite an appitite. To get to the pool patio area, you had to walk all the way around to the green tower. A long long walk. The food that was negotiated was good and the service was good, but when you have a handicap you need to lessen the walking. This is not a hotel for handicapped people. I walk with walker. I used valet parking and this was great, only had to wait 15 minutes to receive our car and the bellhops were at my room within 15 minutes for checkout. It is a very nice hotel, but the rooms could be bigger to accomodate people with walkers, and they need to have elevator access to all floors. I am referring to tower elevators. All in all, I enjoyed my stay, however I will not stay there again as it seemed as if you had to have a credit card to get what you want, and it is not really handicapped accessable.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is awesome. I loved every part of it! Very cool place!”
Reviews.Author: kevinarthur
Reviews.Content: I just stayed here at the Bonavenure in LA. My wife warned me about the Trip Advisory reviews. I was nervous, but as soon as I got there nothing that was warned about on the bad reviews was a problem. I checked in within 3 minutes, had a room on the 26th floor in the red circle tower. It was a King room, one of the refurbished rooms. It was a great room. Great bed, great shower, great view of downtown especially at night. I walked to the 7th street metro station with no problems. I have read that the neighborhood was not good, but it's downtown and a busy place during the day with nothing out of sorts that I saw. I probably wouldn't be hanging out down there at 2am, but thats a lot of places. The hotel is really fun to walk around and see different levels in the shopping gallery. I ate chinese food at the Panda Hut, it was good. Subway was there too which was good. One morning I had the breakfast buffet and it was really good! I will be back to this hotel for a vacation sometime, I really had a blast there.

Reviews.Title: “Good Surprise”
Reviews.Author: Sanoca
Reviews.Content: I became really worried when, after booking this hotel for 2 nights in August trough Hotwire, I saw the revies in TripAdvisor. Being the first hotel in our 2 week trip to California, I thought that a bad experience could ruin the spirit of the entire vacation. But, overall, our experience in Westin Bonaventure was quite good. First, the location. Ok, its on downtown, which didnt seem to have a lot of life at night. But, since we had a car, we arrived really fast to every site we wanted to visit (it was weekend, might have helped it). We arrived Friday night (after 11 pm) and the check in was very fast and corteous. They asked our preference in terms of floor height and type of bed, which was a nice touch. We ended up staying at the 31st floor in the green tower (great elevator) with a view to the pool. The room and the bathroom were of a very good size, the toiletries were of good quality, the bed was really "heavenly", the level of cleanliness was appropriate (no foul smells in our bedroom like other reviews mentioned) and I loved the free Starbucks coffe in bedroom. I would say that the worst things aboout this hotel were the price to park (32$/night) and the lobby - very old fashioned and decadent - especially the stores and restaurants above it (they seemed really shady). So, I would say that if you got a good deal on the price of the hotel, dont be afraid, give it a try. Maybe it's not a luxurious 4 star hotel but it was a really good value.

Reviews.Title: “super”
Reviews.Author: calanudinsaguna
Reviews.Content: Got the room through priceline.com at a great price and was horrified when I read the reviews. But surprise: spent there 5 great days! One ata time: VALET PARKING: 28/day with super service. The most we waited for them to bring our car was 5 minutes. If it was crowded when we returned we just left the car in line with the keys in and left. ROOM: being a cylindrical building, the shape of the room is a bit odd and rooms are not huge. Still, we managed to find room for two air-inflated mattresses around the two double beds. Very nice and roomy bathroom. Elevators have outside view; never had to wait more than 30 seconds for elevator. POOL: heated; wonderful to splash in the pool when it's dark; incredible sensation to swim surrounded by scy scrapers. RESTAURANTS: for lunch there are a bunch of them on the 4th floor; the one by the pool has it's own brewary with happy hour from 4-7:30 and 11pm-1am!!!!! Great wings. NEIGHBORHOOD: we walked the streets one night and there is nothing going on. It's strictly business area around the hotel. We didn't see any "scary people" in downtown LA, so probably the reviewer describing the area as scary didn't even adventure outside or remembered the 20-year old images of the LA riot. If you don't have a car pick another hotel. Overall: wonderful. More so if you get a low price as we did. We paid less, but if you pay up to $100/night you will get good value for your dollar.

Reviews.Title: “The worst hotel I have ever stayed at in North America (and maybe the world)”
Reviews.Author: travel4workandplay
Reviews.Content: I had the misfortune of staying at this hotel for 2 nights in August. It started badly when after a long drive to LA I arrived to find that the driveway to the hotel entrance was closed. I drove round the side of the hotel and pulled in beside the bellboy desk. I got out of the car to speak to the bellboy but he was too busy smoking and speaking on his blackberry to talk to me. Eventually he waved me round to the other side of the hotel and left the car with the valet. I went to the front desk and they checked me into a SPG room on the 12th floor. This room was despressing and had not seen a paint brush for 20+ years. The lamp shade was broken and was hanging off the wall and this room stunk of smoke. I called the front desk and was finally moved into a different room. This was no better and also stunk of smoke. Despite these being non smoking rooms the smell of stale smoke is clearly lodged in the carpets and curtains which have not been upgraded for many years. Again I asked to be moved and this time spoke to the duty manager who had no interest or care in the problems experiences so far. Fortunately they moved me into a renovated room the following day and this room did not smell. On the day of check out I explained to the front desk that I had a night flight back to the UK. I asked if there was anywhere I could take a shower before leaving for the airport and they told me that there was a shower in the basement below the swimming pool. So at the end of the day I tried to access this shower room but I could not do so using my key card. So I went back to the front desk and asked them to give me a key card so that I could get into the shower room. After much discussion with the girl on the front desk she reluctantly agreed to let me use the shower room but would not give me a key. Instead she organised for securty to let me into the shower room. I waited for a good 15 minutes for security to show up and then I had to go through the same explanation with the security guy before he would let me in. Some other points: - the corridors are very run down and smell very unpleasant - most of the staff are really quite rude - the hotel is huge and a real hassle to get around - the lifts don't work very well If you do have to endure this hotel and don't want to pay their wifi fees then there is a restauarant on the swimming pool level called the Angry Chef where you can get free wifi (also works around the swimming pool area).

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: sanfrandlle
Reviews.Content: What a yuck hotel. I was put in a "renovated room" but despite the updated decor and electronics, the room seems kind of seedy and run down, much like the rest of the hotel. Everything was difficult here. When I checked in the counter guy disappeared into a back room for :20 minutes to discuss God knows what with his boss. The same thing happened when I went to get my car out of valet which made me late for my meeting (parking here, by the way, costs almost $40/night). When I misplaced my key I was given a new key that did not work. I would not recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Westin Ever!!!!”
Reviews.Author: MPJPTravel
Reviews.Content: A bit of background: I'm a Gold SPG member and LOVE, LOVE, LOVE to stay at Westin's. I travel quite a bit and Westin's are always my first choice. This past weekend my boyfriend and I decided to have some fun in DTLA so we booked a night at the Bonaventure so that we could do some bar hopping and end the night at Suede. We arrived to the check-in line which was only staffed with 2 attendees and about 15 ppl standing at the check-in line, about 5 ppl in the Starwood line and another 20 ppl from the airlines at a seperate line. It was a major mess!!! We finally arrived to the checked-in counter and were told that our room was not available. We requested a double bed and the hotel only had singles. As a Gold member, our rooms are confirmed upon booking. We couldn't settle for the king because we had two friends that were not capable of driving home that night. I asked to speak with a manager and Dora came out to tell me that my room was not available and I could cancel without a penalty. I have never, ever been given the option to cancel. Usually, a manager will attempt to accomodate the guest before they cancel a reservation. Aren't we in a recession - fix it before you loose $$$?? Why would a hotel manager cancel a reservation before attempting to remedy the situation? I was so angry that I cancelled the reservation and immediately called the Westin's courtesy desk for SPG members and complained. I'm not a whiner but I felt compelled to do this because I have never been treated this way! The service was so bad that the person that was checking in next to me approached Dora and told her that this was the worst service he had ever seen at a Westin hotel. This was a complete stranger!! Dora got a call from the SPG people and ungratefully gave us a suite with a roll away bed. Why didn't she do that from the get-go? Now comes the room: the room was outdated with stained carpets and the entire place looked like a time wharp to the early '90's when True Lies was filmed there. Nothing was really nice about this place. There are several other nearby hotels that would be pleased to have your business. Stay there before choosing the Bonaventure!

Reviews.Title: “Wow, this was a GREAT hotel. Not sure about other reviews?”
Reviews.Author: inspiration100
Reviews.Content: I had been keeping up with the latest reviews of this hotel on tripadvisor before I went. I was expecting a run down unfriendly hotel. I was extremely surprised with what I found. I checked in at 10 PM, got a newly remodeled room on the 22nd foor. The elevator was great. Since I had just come from the Amtrak station, I was rather hungry, so I asked the front desk what was open and they had a subway restaurant on the 6th floor. That was just perfect, and I got a footlong sub for $5 without having to go out of the hotel! I slept really well on the heavenly beds, although I think the base of the beds could have been better since they were a little wobbly. We were right by one of the elevators, so it did rattle a little bit, but no biggie. The lobby is amazing (I'll add some pics later) with fountains and great seating areas. It also has alot of wifi connections for your laptop which I found to be handy since the hotel charges WAY too much for internet. The bathroom had a dimmer swich which was nice since your eyeballs don't adjust well from a good dark room. The room also had a fridge which is a plus to most hotels. Again though, I got a renovated room. Overall, my conclusion is that this is a great hotel, but people are ticked off about the parking fees and they take it out on the hotel. Staff could be a bit more friendly I suppose.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location, not up to Westin standard”
Reviews.Author: xavierkuai
Reviews.Content: I definitely expect more from a Westin branded hotel. The location is good, but AAA only gives this hotel 3 diamonds. I had sead some negative reviews before, worried at first. However (maybe I am a SPG guest), I am on 29th which is a SPG-only floor. The room is pretty spacious, all the furniture are new. Rooms are generally clean except some hairs on bed sheets and mattress protector. Plasma TV, but half channels are scrambled, VOD doesn't work either. The outdoor pool is always crowded, so never have a chance to try. This hotel is more like a upscaled Holiday Inn. So i am not really impressed, stayed in several Westin hotels this year (Shanghai, Vancouver Grand, Seattle Edmonton, SF Market St.), this is definitely the worst.

Reviews.Title: “View of the on ramp of the expressway”
Reviews.Author: Wobross
Reviews.Content: We paid for a suite with view , top whack and were given a low floor room overlooking the on ramp of the express way . When I called reception to voice my concerns, they explained I could have a room higher up but would have to have an old style room so we stayed put with no rate reduction. We had dinner in the revolving restaurant which gives you a great view of the city, with okay food. I would go for the cheapest rate room I could if I stayed here again to avoid disappointment. There are better hotels around.

Reviews.Title: “Dusty, dirty hallways, dog dander, old mattresses,stay away”
Reviews.Author: Westmontgal
Reviews.Content: Had continuous asthma attacks from dust and dog dander. Nightmare, hallway carpets not shampooed in this century, parking $30 per day, bottle of water $ 4 and dangerous neighborhoods nearby, young 17 year old Lily Burk had throat slashed and died in broad daylight when we were there, never again, please do yourself a favor, stay away.

Reviews.Title: “Poor management”
Reviews.Author: y2000k
Reviews.Content: I didn't want to believe all the poor reviews here, but after my recent stay, I have to agree with many reviews that - basically the hotel doesn't care. I got this hotel through Priceline, so at least I didn't pay a lot for this hotel. I stayed here with my mom for 2 nights. On arrival, our request for a double-bedded room was honored and was given a room on a low floor in the Red Tower. The room is on the small side, but not as tiny as some claimed. At least, our room was bigger than the room we got at the Westin St Francis in San Francisco. I also thought the decor was okay, not as outdated as others have said, so perhaps we got a renovated room. However, a number of issues I noticed as soon as we arrived: 1) Only 1 wastebasket for the entire room. We had to constantly move it between the bedroom area and the bathroom. 2) Only 1 soap in the bathroom for both the sink and the shower. 3) No "Privacy Please" door sign, no pen to write with (though there is post-it note pad), no glasses (only paper and styrofoam cups) 4) The in-room safe was locked when we arrived. We had to call hotel security to open it. 5) The in-room mini-fridge doesn't work. There is actually a quarter-inch deep of water on the bottom shelf. In terms of the room, the bathroom desperately needs an exhaust fan, because it turns into a sauna/steam room even after a quick shower. The a/c vent is located on the wall right above one of the 2 double beds. Basically, you have cold air blowing directly onto your head if you go to bed with the A/C on. The vent cannot be adjusted to blow air towards a different direction. Overall, this hotel does not measure up to the usual Westin quality.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I've ever stayed at... seriously”
Reviews.Author: rata_200
Reviews.Content: Why is this a Westin? To be honest I've been very dissapointed with Westin such as the Galleria, but this is the bottom of the bottom. The lobby has the feeling of being a subway station or an abandoned factory, it is really ugly and outdated; it is like 5 floors tall full with horrible small restaurants, abandoned locales and dark corners. The rooms are very unconfortable, very impersonal and small; tiny Tv and tiny beds. The service wasreally bad, as if they didn't care, although it was not terrible, it was just impersonal. On weekend nights the bar/club located in the lobby opens turning the lobby a place full of drunk people and some even making out in the middle of the lobby.... Elevators were very very slow, sometimes it took the elevator 5 minutes to arrive! Stay away from this hotel, trust me, it is not worth it even if you got an amazing rate. This is as bad as it gets, and Westin, what is going on???

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable and convenient.”
Reviews.Author: TravellinSolo101
Reviews.Content: I treated myself to 2 nights here, but at an internet discounted rate, I wouldn't have paid full price. This hotel is really handy to downtown LA and very comfortable. It's only a few blocks to the metro station at 7th. The rooms are a little small and the bathroom extractor fans don't appear to work (if they in fact even exist). When you shower, the entire room fills up with steam. I told the staff about this and they say that's just how it is despite many people complaining about it. It's the first time I've ever experienced it! It's quiet and comfortable if you're after a decent night's sleep. Rooms have a fridge, which many don't. Getting around the complex internally can be a bit confusing because of all the towers and access points, but it's not too bad once you work it out! The hotel has a nice pool which is welcome relief after a hot day in LA. Best of all is the revolving cocktail bar on th 35th floor which gives spectacular views over LA!

Reviews.Title: “We're done with this hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kipellen
Reviews.Content: This is the third time in the last year and a half that we have stayed at the Westin Bonaventure and that is because we got a great deal on Priceline. Each time we have been unimpressed with the rooms - which are small and outdated (orange striped wallpaper, old green carpet, blue and gold upholstered chairs) - and on two visits have had ripped or very faded, mismatched furniture. When we checked in late at night ( I had called at 3:30 pm in the afternoon to confirm that we were arriving late and to please hold a room for us) we were told that the only room available was a "handicapped access" room which was not very nice (according to the front desk clerk) and they were sorry. They wondered why I had requested it. Of course, I hadn't. I had only made the reservation on Priceline and called in the afternoon to make sure a room was available, but had no specific request for a handicapped access room. The room was small as are all the rooms in this hotel and when we asked for two beds the clerk told us the hotel didn't have rooms with two beds- weird! Anyway, he apologized and said he couldn't do anything about it and he was very sorry. Since the hotel was full no upgrades were possible, either. We were tired so we didn't argue with him. He did offer us complimentary parking which was very nice since parking costs $35.00 a day. When we saw the room, we understood the caution: the bathroom had a very cheap hand-shower which only delivered a weak ring of water - damn near impossible to get warm or clean! And it had a huge special bathing chair which took up a great deal of space. It also had no closet and no safe and the area for hanging clothes was low so everything dragged on the ground. The bed, however, was a great Westin bed so that made up for some of the discomfort. Since this is the third time we have received what we considered a "substandard" room, we have decided we will never stay here again, even with the Priceline discount. We hate the lobby which has heavily chlorinated water and no place to gather. The elevators broke twice during our two day stay and the hallways and elevators themselves are not airconditioned so those areas get very hot and stuffy. Also, on Sunday morning at 8:30am we were wakened by loud drumming and music coming from an event at the lower level (near the pool) and we were up 24 floors! This is definitely not a four star hotel and I believe Priceline should change its designation.

Reviews.Title: “Worst hotel I have ever been to...”
Reviews.Author: IRoseA
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at a variety of hotels from the more expensive to the very cheap. From this, I can easily say the Westin Bonaventure is a terrible hotel. Most of my bad experience was due to terrible customer service and cleanliness. My questions were completely ignored by the staff, and I was never told how much I was paying in the end after they were randomly throwing in charges without reason. The valet staff had my boyfriend retrieve his own car, going 3 levels down. Once down there, he saw that the keys of all the cars on the lower levels were just thrown on the hoods. Anyone could walk down there and steal a car. The room's floor was stained, and the sheets didn't look clean. We tried to get someone up there to clean it, but no one showed up. The room was tiny, and I mean tiny. There were four of us in the room, and we could barely move once you throw luggage into the mix. We would have taken a lost on the money and stayed elsewhere, but because it was the fourth of July weekend, we could not find another hotel. You can tell that the Westin puts all of its effort into it's lobby, which is pretty, but I wasn't staying in the lobby. They should put more effort into the rooms. I have stayed at a Motel 6 in the Arizona desert for $39 a night. The room was bigger, the staff was nicer, and it was far more clean. If you will be staying in downtown LA, choose another hotel. I stayed at the Wilshire Grand the last time I was in LA, and they were much more friendly.

Reviews.Title: “OK Stay”
Reviews.Author: suzzy230
Reviews.Content: I was not really impressed. The room was TINY!!!!!! It was comfortable, and nice, but I just wasn't impressed. It was over-priced, and the valet's were not nice. They drove my car horribly through the garage!!!!!! and parking is EXPENSIVE!!!!! But, the morning breakfast buffet I thought was great!

Reviews.Title: “pleasantly suprised”
Reviews.Author: bjean
Reviews.Content: I was very apprehensive after reading the reviews here after getting this hotel on a priceline bid. My husband and I were in LA attending a freshman orientation at USC with our son. We stayed 3 nights. We were in a king bed room in the red tower. Our son stayed in our room the first night only and then was at the dorm the other two nights, so we had a roll a way the first night which was fine. The heavenly bed was great. Loved the double head shower. We had a great view of the downtown on the 24th floor. The room was smaller than some hotels, but was more than adequate. The bathroom had new granite counters. We really enjoyed the location. Walked to LA live and the staples center and visited some great happy hour menus! The top of the westin revolving lounge was a magnificant view and well worth the high priced menu items! I'm not sure if we just lucked out and had a nice room or if we had a different experience than many other reviewers, but I will definately consider this hotel again if I can get a good price. Parking was steep at $32/day, but I'm told that's typical of downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced but clean and safe”
Reviews.Author: BlueHeeler777
Reviews.Content: Had to stay here at short notice for a business trip. Hotel is a bit of an icon due to the innovative design. I thought the hotel was expensive at $169 USD per night but I suppose for a business CBD location some might have found it reasonable. Beds were comfy and the room was clean. We had 2 double beds so there was not a lot of spare room. There are stacks of eateries ranging from cheap cafes to upmarket restaurants on the various lower floors. There is even a car rental agency but don't expect discount prices there. There is not much to see or do in this downtown location, but if business is the order of the day then it suits. However, given this, one would think that the business center would be reasonably priced, but the charges were outrageous.

Reviews.Title: “If it's not at a big discount - DON'T stay here!!!”
Reviews.Author: Myanna912
Reviews.Content: For a hotel that charges about 170 bux per night - this is NOT worth this money. I got it at a very big discount, and I stayed only 1 night (walls in my apartment were being painted so I had to get a hotel) - I don't feel robbed but you, traveller, beware! Junky rooms, not as they are supposed to be in a hotel of this class. Best Western would be a better choice, I mean it. Plastic cups in the rooms - are you kidding me??? The mini bar was empty in my room. NO desk, just a bed and an awkward table with 2 absolutely cheap and uncomfortable chairs. The floor in the bathroom is sticky. No shower cap, no tea - the things that are usually found at hotels of such rate. My TV remote did not work. I have no idea why this hotel has higher ratings, I have been all over the USA staying in similar rank hotels and I tell you with all my knowledge and experience - this one is NOT WORTH YOUR MONEY!

Reviews.Title: “Nice on the outside, lacking on the inside”
Reviews.Author: Tandog111
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very impressive and attractive from the outside. The inside is a bit dated in terms of design, but is still nice. The center bar/restaurant on the first floor is very enjoyable. Aside from that, there are about 5 levels with shops and restaurants (how to get to each of these levels and the hours these locations are open is truly a mystery). The majority of these shops, restaurants and the business center are not hotel affiliated. They are outside vendors, which feels a bit disjointed. The rooms themselves were quite overdue to be redecorated. Quite small, which was not a big deal. However, cleanliness, was a BIG problem. The bedding had spots. The carpet had many stains. The walls were scratched and marked. The bathroom looks nice but upon closer inspection, the shower is in terrible condition. The tub is peeling and there is mold on the showerheads (see pics). All in all, despite the fact that the staff was very friendly, I could not recommend this hotel to anyone, given the condition of the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Good Dining and Shopping, Horrible Room & Service”
Reviews.Author: Irishgirl21N
Reviews.Content: The Bonaventure has great extras in the restaurants, shopping & lounges. However, the room & service left alot to be desired. My room was to the right of the solo elevator in the red tower. When I got to my room and opened my curtains, I was staring directly at the people that were in the elevator. My friends got in it when they left my room and advised they could see everything. I never opened my curtains again. A coat hanger sign advised that I should enjoy my Heavenly robe, but one was not hanging there. I called and was told one would be brought up, but no one ever came. There were pen scribbles on my bathroom wall. There were 2 toilet paper dispensers but the maid only ever filled one, and never with a full role. One bar of soap was left on the sink but there was nothing for the bath, and no mini bottle of shower gel, which I prefer to use for my body. When I called Guest Services, they advised that I could purchase shower gel in the Gift shop. On the 2nd day, my maid never came. I left at 8 AM and returned at 2 PM to take an afternoon nap. The maid had not yet arrived so I put the Do Not Disturb sign on my door. I left again at 4 PM, removed the sign and came back at 10 PM. Still no maid, or no voicemail asking if I needed fresh towels, etc. On the 3rd day, the maid left me 1 bottle of water. I was there 6 nights, and this was the only time a bottle of water was ever left for me. I had a dinner reservation at LA Prime and called to update the number of guests. The concierge intercepted the call and told me they would take care of it. They never did, and when my clients and I arrived, we had to wait for them to set another table to accommodate us. The pool is so tiny for the size of this massive hotel. I could not believe it. On my last night, my guests were having a party when I got back to my room at 1 AM. At 2 AM, I finally called the front desk to complain. They said they would send someone up and ask them to quiet down, but no one ever did. Their party continued until 5 AM and I had to get up at 6 AM to catch my flight home. And charging so much money for internet sevice in a hotel so massive is highway robbery. There is no excuse for such a pricey charge. If I ever return to LA, I will stay at the Hilton Checkers. My friends did and I visited them often. It was fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “GREAT HOTEL - MARCO & HENRY ARE 100% CLASS ACTS !!”
Reviews.Author: THEGUYFROMSOCALIF
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel (3) different times already this year and look forward to coming back every time. First, the front desk manager, Marco, is super! How many other front desk managers offer you their personal cell phone number (without asking for it) to call them if you have any issues while staying at their hotel? And, then there is Henry - the Sommelier at the fine restaurant located within the hotel, The 34th floor louge rotates and you get to see all of Los Angeles over the 1 hour period the louge slowly rotates 360 degrees. Henry is only too happy to come down from the 35th floor restaurant to the 34th floor louge to assist you with a wine selection or after dinner port. I believe Gold and platinum SPG members get a special invitation to the louge for a courtesy wine tasting. I am platinum at SPG and received such an invitation. My wife asked Henry to suggest a nice red wine. Henry had her taste a couple choices - one of which she loved. He happily poured her a nice glass of that wine. Ditto for the port tasting - Henry as as sharp as they come - class personified. At the end of the evening, I thanked Henry and privately handed him a $20 tip for his wonderful service. HE REFUSED TO TAKE MY MONEY, EXPLAINING TO ME THAT HE DOES THIS FOR THE JOY IT GIVES TO HIM. What a refreshing reminder that there are still some wonderful, generous people out there!! The brunch is A-1, the rooms are spotless, there are many great priced restaurants in the hotel (check out Captain's Lee's $7 and $8 entrees) and the staff is superb. Add to that a nice outdoor pool and a great location downtown LA, and you end up with a super stay!! Once again, thanks Marco and Henry - you are 100% class acts!!

Reviews.Title: “the room was better than expected after reading the reviews”
Reviews.Author: tsimmis
Reviews.Content: the room was very nice and clean and renovated. (maybe it helps to be a starwood guest) obviously the rooms are going to be a bit smaller being in a city. we had a fabulous view of downtown looking towards dodger stadium. the rooms also had the great beds and good sheets. the staff was very nice, informative and helpful. the parking was $32/night but you are going to pay at least that anywhere else for an overnight in the city. the lobby is a bit cold and in need of updating.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel needs upgrades... badly”
Reviews.Author: thaJack
Reviews.Content: This place is so dated. It looks like it came out of the 1970s. I think it did, but doesn't seem to have been upgraded since then with the exception of the door locks. Everything was pricey, from a $6 12oz bottle of domestic beer to the $35/night just to park your car. Anyways, picture was awful on the televisions, too. Only good thing is it is close to the Staples Center, Nokia Theater and convention center. Otherwise, in a bad section of town. Oh, and very small rooms... VERY small. It is also very easy to get lost in the lobby areas. For example, if you want to go to the third floor, you will need to go to the second or fourth floor and then take stairs. Certain elevators only go to certain places, too.

Reviews.Title: “Location - wonderful, cleanliness of room - unsatisfactory”
Reviews.Author: tabs4u
Reviews.Content: I am a preferred guest member, which meant we had our own floor (25th floor). We checked in fine, young lady was very nice and provided us with a room far from the elevators (as requested). We took the elevators to our floor (elevators are great, if you dont mind heights), got into our room. Room was fine for now...once we walked into the bathroom, horror struck me! Westin hotels are considered a 5 star hotel, but when you have that in mind, and notice opened and half used bottle of shampoo and conditioner, your expectations drop, FAST! I called front desk and told them about the opened and used (squeezed) bottle of shampoo and conditioner, they sent a new set of them for us, but no apologies of any kind! The floors were sticky, probably hairspray residue from other guests. We ate at the LA Prime, with our letter for 20% off (i have a sister who works for another Westin). Well, the restaurant was clueless as to what the letter was for. We didn't feel like we were appreciated or welcomed. This was our 2nd stay at this hotel, we enjoyed our first stay - which is why we decided to come back - but did not completely enjoy the second time around. The location is perfect if you don't mind not having stores, hand full of restuarants. It is very close to the freeway and hollywood. We enjoyed the location of the hotel and the view we had.

Reviews.Title: “Interesting architecture”
Reviews.Author: TwinComanche
Reviews.Content: The hotel building is a landmark and has been used in numerous movies and TV shows. It is based upon a set of circles and the rooms are therefore wedge-shaped. With that in mind, it's interesting. As a place to stay, well...it's another story. I arrived by taxi at the front entrance in the early evening. There were no staff members in sight to assist with luggage and one must take an escalator down one level to reach the front desk. Although the hotel is noted to have an executive club level, that isn't true. There are floors set aside for Starwood Preferred members, but there is no club with the typical breakfast or evening snacks. I was given one of the Starwood Preferred rooms, which the front desk staff advised me was larger than the typical room, with more amenities. The room had a bathrobe and small refrigerator but I didn't see anything else that stood out as such. The room is somewhat dated, with numerous scrapes on the wallpaper, peeling of the paint on the bathroom door, and the pipe feeding the shower had broken loose from its attachment point. The soundproofing is not up to date and there was much noise from the nearby elevators and the traffic. The TV was an older 4:3 model Magnavox, perhaps 19 or 21" with a fuzzy picture. The beds were comfortable enough and the HVAC unit was modern and worked properly. Internet was available through a provided ethernet cable at a daily charge. I didn't have any luck with the wireless. Getting around the hotel required some education as the elevators don't serve all the lower floors. Getting to the second floor requires going to either 3 or L and then taking the stairs or escalator. Getting to the fourth floor again requires going to 3 on the elevator, then taking the stairs to 4. There are four color-coded sets of elevators and each room is accessible from any of the elevators but it's often unclear as to where you are given the circular nature of the design. There are many restaurants but most of them looked empty or closed (though they were open) due to a lack of occupants even during lunch hour. The walls through the public areas are largely concrete but badly in need of a sandblasting or cleaning. Think of a mid-70s SF movie like Logan's Run and you will understand the overall feel of the public areas. Room Service was on time, friendly, and the food was hot, tasty, and well prepared (though expensive). I paid about $130/night for the room making the overall experience a reasonable value.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Meerkat92101
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for the weekend and was surprised to see the negative reviews on this website! We had enjoyed drinks on the 35th floor of the revolving lounge many times over the years, but this was our first time as guests. From what Im' reading we stayed in a renovated room (no complaints except the configuration of the room is a little strange because it is a half moon) on the 20th floor of the Triangle tower. The shower was great, the bed was one of the best I've slept in - overall the whole room experience was incredible. And you can't beat a 20th floor view in Los Angeles. We had drinks at the lounge- and the girl was so attentive to us - I've not had my drinks served that quickly. I highly recommend this property and it is one of the most unique and centrally located landmarks you can pick. Two warnings: If you like hotels that are close by to food and entertainment /malls, etc - this is not your hotel. It is downtown and pretty much lonely on the weekends - which is fun for walking over all the downtown sky bridges too. Second, parking here (like any downtown) is astronomical at $32 a night. Just be prepared to pay or find some of the parking that can be found within a few blocks if you try hard enough....

Reviews.Title: “Incompetent front desk. Cold and unappealing facility. Stay elsewhere.”
Reviews.Author: dianeNorthCarolina
Reviews.Content: Had a very tight window to check-in and change from a long flight before beginning business in the area. Front desk checked me into my room for my quick change, but neither key opened door. Out of time, I returned to the front desk and asked them to rectify before my return some hours later. A second try with a new set of keys was not successful, either. Finally, a hallway maid called security for me to get my room open, only to find it was already occupied. It took 4 attempts and the front desk was completely hapless and unconcerned. Property is cold, unattractive massive cement structure. Staff is un-attentive at best, inept at worst. Dinner on site in a sushi restaurant was horrid -- since when is a California Roll frozen and only partially thawed before serving? No one else was visible in any of the restaurants. Now I know why. Never again.

Reviews.Title: “Unresponsive and unreliable”
Reviews.Author: travelcomments
Reviews.Content: Past reviews pretty much sum it up. Great location if you need to be downtown. But much of the interior is dated and worn, and some functions of the hotel are run like a second rate dime store. I stayed recently with some colleagues as part of a conference. We tried a full five times to book a function room for a day, including catering (mind you, not a cheap package). The first three times we never got a response (voice mail, e-mails). The fourth and fifth time our office manager spoke with the event department. Promises to send out a booking/contract were never followed up on. After a total of five attempts we gave up and rented a room in another hotel. Not on par with other Westins, not on par with other 4 star hotels, and definitely not worth the money and hassle.

Reviews.Title: “Not Up To Par for Westin Brand, but Okay for Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: GSH81
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for approximately 3 months and have had quite a few ups and downs. One thing to know is that this hotel has a mix of recently renovated and downright junky rooms. I found it really tough to rate this hotel based on how much it can vary depending on the room you stay in. So, I've tried to do with by mixing my experiences. Since this is the largest hotel in Downtown LA with over 400 rooms (unverified) and seem to always have a plethora of business, they seem to be lax on customer service at the front desk. Even if you have Platinum status, they usually don't go out of your way to ensure that you have a renovated room. So, with status or not... remember to ask in advance for a newer room, it will make all of the difference. Standard Renovated Room: On the small side, especially for the price... there really isn't much room to walk around in them due to the unique design of the building (five tube shaped buildings connected by walkways). Each rooms resembles a wedge of the tub and thus you really have most of your SQFT near the outer windows where there isn't much reason to have space. Size aside, the renovated rooms offer light modern but not flashy furniture with decent desk/work space. And of course, the heavenly bed/shower. The bathroom is decent and if you get a chance to stay in the old vs new rooms, you'll notice that they've addressed some of the awkward lighting issues found in the old bathrooms. Standard Non-Renovated: Old dark, smelly carpet and furniture. Less efficient room layout than the renovated rooms with no desk/workspace, rather an old awkwardly placed 3X3' marble table past the foot of the bed as a "desk". You still get the heavenly bed/shower, but overall the rooms stink and your feet stick to the floor. Heavenly Shower: If you've ever stayed at a newer Westin, the heavenly shower is usually an impressive sight. Both of the renovated and non-renovated rooms simple have a dual shower head and bowed out shower curtain which allow it to be called a "heavenly shower". Um... not so much. Pretty standard shower if you ask me. Restaurants: They boast over 40 restaurants/shops in the mall area from lobby to floor 5 atrium, but most of them are empty come dinner time. I never really ate in any of them because there are better options elsewhere downtown, and whenever I passed by there were only a few patrons inside (unless a convention was in town, then they'd be lucky to have a few patrons X3). The breakfast buffet is great, and the wait staff is friendly. Fitness Center: Just barely above average for the class of hotel and competition downtown, but for a “Westin Workout” it is sub-par. Overall this hotel just simply doesn't meet expectations of a Westin. For downtown LA it's not bad, because downtown LA is not known or great hotels, and there really aren't many to begin with but there are at least 5 other hotels that make a better option for the business or even leisure traveler. Even though it’s not a terrible option for downtown it is not a stretch to say that this is one of the worst Westin's in the SPG family I’ve ever stayed in. If it weren’t for the size and location I wouldn’t have stayed here… in fact I ended up ditching the Westin for an alternate hotel after putting up with 3 months of disappointments.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Hotel I've seen in years”
Reviews.Author: slyNewYork
Reviews.Content: Don't even think about making a reservation... Poor service, tiny old rooms, paper cups in your bathroom instead glasses, noicy A/C, empty minibar, antique TV etc. will never ever go back.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: themrs1922
Reviews.Content: I know I am late with this review, but my husband and I stayed at Bonaventure almost a year ago and loved it! The hotel is very nice and has a lot of shops/restaurants inside. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The major downside to this hotel was parking. This was our first time to the West Coast and did not anticipate paying $40 per day for parking. After the first night we quickly walked the block the next day and found a spot for $15 and made sure they knew we'd be overnight. We also visited on a weeknight, so there was not much going on as far as bars etc. I would say this hotel is geared towards business travelers. We are in our mid-twenties and were kind of bored. They do have a really nice gym and the indoor track was nice after flying all day.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed and sure will not be back”
Reviews.Author: Panda97
Reviews.Content: Building apperance looks high class, actually the room are all out of day. For sure the rooms need renovated. I get 2 connecting door in one room... ridiculous . Air grill in bathroom are all block by dust..... , no proper desk chair for the desk . obviously it is not for business traveller and not expect you to work on the desk. They have data port on the desk but funny no power point for the computer use.. I need to put the charger on the left hand side socket on the wall ( so stupid). I just can't believe they didn't change bed sheet for my 5 night stay.... Luggage staff are hopeless and unattentive during morning shift. High speed internet actually are not high speed and they still charge you 12.99/day. Room are small and I think the price for 199.00 + tax is totally unacceptable for this kind of room. But one thing and the only things I really appreciate is the concierge staffs are outstanding. I think this hotel only worth under 100.00/night.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: IrishLad123
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days before flying on to Cancun in Mexico. We hired a car at the airport and drove to the Hotel. Do not use the Hotel car parking, it will cost you $50 a night, instead drive on a block from the Hotel Car park entrance and you will see an entrance to another car park, it will cost you $9 pre night and it is connected to the Hotel. The Hotel itself is nice and architecturally very unusual. There are 4 towers basically that make up the hotel. The lobby is huge with great big fountains. We stayed on the top floor and the views were amazing, although the lifts are not for the faint hearted. The pool unfortunately was out of commission. There is a basic gym and running area on one of the floors. The restaurants in the Hotel are adequate, nothing to write home about. You would definitely need a car staying here. The part of town it is in is the Financial district at that is all that is around. Not the most exciting part of town by a long shot. Staff were not the most helpful people either.

Reviews.Title: “Sub-Standard Westin--a No Go!”
Reviews.Author: msforb
Reviews.Content: This property is inferior to any other Westin I have stayed at. The rooms are dingy and dirty--my room looked like it hadnt been updated in 20 years with stains on the carpet, a clunky old tv, and no lighting. The service was horrible. I cant believe that Westin put their brand on a place like this. For a seasoned business traveler, stay clear. This place is a dump.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 star hotel.”
Reviews.Author: 148jules
Reviews.Content: I got a great rate on hotwire for a 4 star hotel but the Westin Bonaventure is NOT a 4 star hotel ... I was hoping for the Omni or Hilton instead. We needed a downtown location to be close to the Music Center. The hotel is very dated esp the lobby area which is in need of a major renovation but that is not going to happen due to the confusing layout and obvious cost. Room 2580 was not renovated and it showed its age. The only thing that worked was the linen and bed which was in line with other Westins. The bathtub was horrible - I usually like to take baths but this time no way. The double shower head was weird and to me a waste of precious water. Bathroom lighting is poor since sink is in the corner and the lights are along one side of the wall. The worse part of our stay was the Bonaventure Lounge on the 34th floor. The bar food is CRAP and very expensive. The $11 plate of french fries came straight out of the freezer into the deep fryer and not even hand cut. Drinks were pricey too but that's the norm for hotel lounges. The revolving floor stopped moving and our table was stuck under a glaring light bulb! The server was kind enough to notice and moved us. The view is not much to write home about - it is LA after all. Overall the service in the hotel is very good from the front desk, concierge, lounge server to doorman. I would rate this hotel 3 - 3.5 stars only. The Westin brand is not well served by the Bonaventure.

Reviews.Title: “Good overall experience”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed for four nights with my fiancee. Overall a very nice place to stay, the location was just right and although we walked the surroundings of the hotel for just one night, it didn't seem unsafe at all. Bed was great and rooms were good, although sometimes housekeeping service was not perfect. What we didn`t like: Excessive parking fee ($40+ per day), excessive phone fee (over $10 for a 15 second international call), and shops and restaurants closing very early.

Reviews.Title: “Urgh.”
Reviews.Author: Ozwitch
Reviews.Content: Apart from seeing the elevators where Arnie galloped the horse and John Malkovich tried to kill the President, there is nothing to recommend this hotel. Our experience was simply awful. Horrid location. Right in the middle of downtown, nothing around except the library which is where we used to go for lunch as there is nothing else around. Very seedy and quite unsafe after working hours. Hotel service non-existent. Our room hadn't been made up. We rang over the phone but couldn't get anyone to do anything about it. Eventually we had to go down to the lobby and ask for another room as no maid was available to make it up. This after a long transPacific flight. Staff were not only unhelpful, they were uninterested. Room very small. Bathroom quite nice. Bed good. Other than that, unremarkable. Breakfast reasonable for standard buffet. Atrium was very confusing, hard to navigate - we ended up getting lost quite a few times trying to find a particular store on the various levels. A lot of stores seemed closed when they should have been open. Architecture is not something I take much notice of when staying, but this one you can't help. Towering concrete columns and an organic kind of layout which must have looked good on the plans, but made it very difficult to find your way about. The outside elevators are exactly as in the movies. Fun for the first couple of times, then you don't notice. Bottom line: not a pleasant experience. Stay somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Service was horrible”
Reviews.Author: LocoTravelers
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights over New Years. Asked for wine glasses to be sent to the room and never received. Went to bar to ask and was told to call room service. Went back to call room service and we were told there would be a charge to deliver two empty glasses. Finally gave up and drank the wine the next day. I have stayed here a dozen times over the years and the property has slipped to a 3 star at best. Not up to Westin standards. Loved the beds however.

Reviews.Title: “L.A. Icon”
Reviews.Author: KingCol
Reviews.Content: Very cool hotel. I remember it from the various movies filmed there. In walking distance to many of downtown LA's great hot spots & destinations. Very clean and safe environs. Hotel room shaped like a piece of pie. The lobby is expansive... tons of shops and food locations. I believe the lowest floor for guests rooms begins on the 10th. They have a lot of amenities in the room, including a coffee pot with tazo tea and Starbucks coffee! Only shocker was the mandatory valet parking which was $42.00 for overnight guests.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Judge a Hotel by its cover”
Reviews.Author: babypanda209
Reviews.Content: I was excited for my accepted price of $75 dollars on priceline for a four start hotel. When I got there the building from the oustide as well as inside the lobby was gorgeous. Much like a four star quality hotel, but as far as the room goes, some updating could possibly be done here. It was obvious that the room had aged. The walls, the bathtub, closet, the t.v. seem to be the ones that could use some help into modernizing the room up to a four star quality. I expected a nice flat screen t.v for a 4 star hotel. Luckily there was a beautiful view in place. The room is not ugly, nor dirty, it just is not the standards of a 4 star hotel. I thought a 3.5 star at the Hilton was much nicer. Overall, nothing to complain about, the stay was pleasant, but again, the Westin Bonadventure looks only like a four star outside and inside its lobby but inside its hotel room it has yet to reach its 4 star standards.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel for a Westin”
Reviews.Author: zaphodneo
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel in December with the primary aim of watching a game at Staples Centre which is a 10 minute walk from the hotel. Pros: 1) The hotel staff was nice to keep our luggage before we arrived. 2) Great gym 3) Nice breakfast spread but expensive (US$23 per person) 4) Convenience location to explore downtown LA Cons: 1) Really bad cafe- they say they serve Starbucks hot chocolate but the guy just mixed Hershey's liquid chocolate with hot water and served us. 2) Horrible spa: The spa in the hotel is outsourced (like everything else) and is like having a massage in China for 10X the price. 3) Business Centre: Is outsourced again and does not feel like a hotel at all. 4) Hotel is really old and has not undergone maintenance in a long time...the TV in the room is not even a plasma or LCD. On the overall...very average hotel for the Westin chain.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre, dated hotel with sub-par service”
Reviews.Author: kotarok
Reviews.Content: I usually like Westin hotels, because they have a more easy-on-the-eye modern interior instead of the traditional opulent marie-antoinette style. Their heavenly beds and baths usually guarantee a good night's sleep and a refreshing morning. Service usually is also prompt and professional, without being too pushy. As you can tell from my use of the word "usually" - this Westin does not quite live up to this expectation. The good: - Cool elevators appeared in "true lies" - Tacky fountains are a kid's delight - On-street parking available across the entrance. - Public parking lot across the building. - Very lively club downstairs for the active crowd. - Two-head shower is nice. The bad: - Generally old feeling of hotel - in need of an update. - Glass elevators stop right next to rooms. Close your curtains. - Not very friendly/outgoing reception staff. - Fountains in lobby/bar area are noisy. - Rather tired old bathroom. Very cramped entry area. - No free WiFi. Definitely unacceptable in this day and age. The ugly: - Checked us into a trashed-up room that wasn't cleaned. - Found a dead bird floating in the fountain. - $50 for overnight parking? Come on. Summary: Lower your expectations (or find a rate at $100-120) and it may be worth it. If you are a business traveller that just needs a comfortable bed in a central location, it is good. Bewared of the extremely greedy hotel parking prices. For a memorable stay at usual Westin quality, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “FANTASTIC - NO COMPLAINTS!”
Reviews.Author: JEDNewcastle
Reviews.Content: Though we only had 2 nights stay at this hotel at the start of our US holiday, we have nothing but praise for this hotel. Prior to arriving and having read some rather negative reviews we were rather apprehensive but we were not disappointed. Service was excellent, arriving from Australia at 7.30 am, the reception staff could not have been more helpful and accommodating with having a room ready for us as soon as possible as we were well and truly in need of sleep after an 18 hour flight. Our room was excellent and bedding was heavenly. I am amazed at how picky some people can be in reviews we had read. The room was everything we could want, clean, comfortable and excellent service. What more could you want. The location was also a great one for first timers to downtown LA and we found it well within walking distance to all services we needed. We have no hesitation in recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Used to stay here all the time”
Reviews.Author: bdraco
Reviews.Content: I used to stay here all the time, but they recently changed their credit card policy so my company can no longer pay for the rooms with a credit card authorization form. The hotel is nice, but their policies seem to change so often that you never know what you are going to get from one week to the next.

Reviews.Title: “Dated and expensive”
Reviews.Author: syee99
Reviews.Content: Like many of the reviews here say, it's definitely not at the standard I expect from a Westin. Although it looks modern on the outside, the inside looks very dated for a supposed 4 star hotel. The definitely need to do some modernization (or at least a little cleaning and a new coat of paint) to make it look at least presentable. Room I had was very small and right next to the elevators. Essentially, I had elevators whizzing by my window (it's one of the open outdoor view elevators) every few minutes, which wasn't ideal, but since it was the only king bed room they had available, I didn't have a choice. The room had old worn carpet, but was relatively clean. Parking is VERY expensive at $42 a day, and internet isn't much better at $13 a day. Ended up paying about $45 for 10 pieces of sushi at one of the restaurants on the hotel (which isn't necessarily the hotel's fault), so I'd suggest eating elsewhere. To add insult to injury they added a mandatory tip to the bill (I was dining alone - the practice makes sense on a large party, but a single diner?). Not exactly impressed with this hotel - there are definitely better places out there than this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again”
Reviews.Author: artlesers
Reviews.Content: I recently spent four days at this hotel on business. This property should not carry the Westin name. Not up to standard. Rooms very old and dirty - they need a refurbish and they need it soon. Lighting in bathrooms was terrible and the "heavenly bed" was anything but. I couldn't get a smile out of any of the staff nenbers and felt they were as unhappy to be there as I was. I was on the 24th floor of the hotel and at 3:00 am unable to sleep as I could hear the garage buzzer going off very loudly everytime a car exited at ground level. I will not stay at this property in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience, not upto Westin standards”
Reviews.Author: HKjon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days during the summer. Check in was horrible. the staff was rude and slow at processing my reservation. Overnight parking at the hotel is very pricy, and they even crashed my side mirror to the car. Had to go through alot of hassle in order for them to claim the hotel parking. Bedroom had a broken bed and instead of changing our room they decided to take 2 hours to fix the bed in the room without cleaning up afterward. Only 1 word can sum up my experience there. Bad.

Reviews.Title: “Bonaventure Paradox”
Reviews.Author: CO_Flyboy
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Westin Bonaventure for a week while attending a conference in LA. The hotel is a bit of a paradox. It is ranked as a 4 star hotel, and while it has potential, in most aspects seems more like a 2~3 star. I arrived fairly late and check-in went well. Took the well known hotel glass elevators (from movies "True Lies", "In the Line of Fire", etc.) up to my room on the 27th floor. The room and hallway interiors seem a little dated...they could really use a little freshening. The room itself was a little small, especially the bathroom. The only towel bar in the bath is inside the tub/shower...which has never made sense to me. Otherwise the bath was well appointed with granite counter tops, a real hair dryer, and a personal coffee maker and reasonably thick towels. The armoire that holds the TV, refrigerator, and a few drawers was falling apart from failed previous repair attempts. The wallpaper and carpets were clean but could use updating. There is a single table that could theoretically be used as a desk, but no good chair for working and no power nearby (closest required you unplug the alarm clock or lamp). And I don't understand why the alarm clock is across the room from the bed (I'd think there should be a plug behind the bed..but wasn't going to rearrange the furniture to find out). The "Heavenly"(tm) bedding was nice and comfortable, and I like how many hotel chains are moving to a more washable bedding ensemble. The full height windows looked out over the downtown area, and I could see the Hollywood sign from my room. In a day when even the likes of Motel 6 and Super 8 can offer free Internet, a $15/day charge seems a bit excessive. I didn't try it but another guest said it was not working well (limited/no connection much of the time). The hotel is convenient for downtown access. In addition, the first 6 floors of the hotel are essentially a mall...with a number of stores and several restaurants ranging from fast food to full restaurants. The hotel also has a bar, but you'll find better deals and quality of food at the other establishments. Also, there is no complimentary breakfast option at this hotel. I didn't drive, but I heard there is an additional and steep daily charge for the parking garage if you bring a car. Overall it was a comfortable stay and was convenient for my purpose, but it would probably not be my first choice based on value for price paid.

Reviews.Title: “below standard”
Reviews.Author: Frank037
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this Westin for one night for business. Stayed at several other Westin hotels before and was always very happy with the quality offered. I must say this one does not meet the Westin standards. I can imagine it was once state of the art but now the rooms need to be updated. For 230 USD excluding tax it should be better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Downtown Hotel”
Reviews.Author: beachlover325
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Westin Bonaventure while he attended the Microsoft conference from October 26-31st. I stayed at the hotel with him from October 27-30. Our room was decently sized but unfortunately he could not get a room with larger beds. Full size beds for a man who is 6'5" proved pretty uncomfortable but the hotel was sold out so there was nothing we could do. The beds, although too small, had comfortable bedding and the room included a desk, old TV, six drawers for clothing, mini fridge, mirrored closet and bathroom with a small tub but nice amount of counter space by the sink. The hotel was in a great location and just a few blocks away from the Metro line. We also caught the Blue bus one day just outside of the hotel which took us to Santa Monica. The food court had a variety of inexpensive options along with gift shops and a liquor/convenience store. We ate room service three times and it was delivered pretty quickly. The Bonaventure Brewing Co. restaurant at the hotel had good burgers and sandwiches. The gym was well equipped with individual tv's for each of the cardio machines and there was also an indoor track. The concierge was helpful in providing a list of nearby bars and clubs. The internet service was extremely slow but we think this was because the hotel was filled with people attending the Microsoft conference and most were using the internet at some point. Overall we were pleased with the hotel and would recommend it to others for a good downtown option.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK!”
Reviews.Author: cabushka
Reviews.Content: Westin Bonaventure was the headquarters hotel for a conference I attended Oct 18-22. If I'd paid only $75 per night like the previous reviewer, I'd have given this place a much higher rating. But at $240 plus tax, I had higher expectations. The staff was very helpful from Bill the doorman, to Kevin the concierge. A request to the front desk for a corkscrew was answered in record time. The Westin is definitely a throwback to the 70's. A previous reviewer referred to it as the "mother ship" and was right on! This was our nickname for the hotel for our 4 day stay. Definitely reminds me of something out of the Jetsons. The lobby is one of the least relaxing I've encountered. The noise of water echos around the cement interior and is annoying rather than serene. It took me all of 4 days to find my way around the towers even with the color coded elevators, wallpaper and floor covering. The rooms were tiny & cramped for two visitors. Hardly enough room in the closet and drawers for a few days of clothing. There is a small fridge, so you can stock up on your own water & drinks. The beds are small, but "heavenly" and water pressure & shower head were the best! The carpeting needed a good scrubbing. There's a food court on the 4th floor with inexpensive food options, beer & wine. Pool was just outside the food court & was nice, but didn't get much afternoon sun. The lobby restaurant was very expensive, as were drink prices at Suede lounge, but I guess that's to be expected in a downtown hotel in any large city. I might stay here again depending on the circumstances and price, but all things being equal I'd probably try another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Westin was perfect.”
Reviews.Author: SoccerFolks
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned home from a trip where we flew to Los Angeles and drove the Pacific Coast Highway to San Francisco. Our first stop was the Westin Bonaventure Hotel in downtown Los Angeles. We were very pleased with our room. We reserved the room on Priceline and it was $75 plus taxes, so the price was right. The room contained a very comfortable queen size bed, a large desk, desk chair and a very good TV that could be viewed from the bed. The bathroom was high end and very nice. Overall the room was small, but very comfortable and everything appeared to be new. Parking was very expensive at the hotel, but you can park on the street after 6 pm until 8 am and there was a parking garage where you could park all day for $10. This garage was at Sixth and Hope streets. (a very short walk) We took a swim in the hotel pool which was very nice after our long flight. We went to the restaurant at the top of the hotel for a drink and a snack. Its a great view, especially at night, because the restaurant turns and makes a full circle each hour. However, the atmosphere is tacky, music is bad, drinks are OK, food was not good. The highlight of our trip to LA was seeing the Getty Museum - which is closed on Mondays. Do not miss this beautiful museum. We had a fabulous breakfast at the Daily Grill - not far from the hotel. The hotel's breakfast buffet was $25 per person. Too expensive. Overall a great place to stay - very convenient, but park and eat elsewhere! We arrived in LA Sunday around noon and went directly to the Getty Museum in Brentwood and stayed 3-4 hours. The next day (Monday) we only had a few hours, but we squeezed in visits to the Cathedral, the Biltmore Hotel, the Disney Auditorium, the Bradbury Building and the LA Public Library. We skipped all the Hollywood stuff. Mid-afternoon we headed up the coast for our next stop - Santa Barbara.

Reviews.Title: “USC Parent Weekend”
Reviews.Author: MauiFamilyVacation
Reviews.Content: Fortunately I read the previous reviews and had my expectations recalibrated downward. While the bed is still Heavenly and so is the bath, this hotel is not up to Westin standards. Small rooms, older televisions, dirty carpet and no desk area. But for the price...paid a non-refundable rate through the hotel website...it was worth it. The front desk clerk was exceptional at a late night check in. Side note regarding the exorbitant parking costs at the hotel....Since our child is student at USC, we had her drop us off at night and park our car on campus. I paid her the price difference.

Reviews.Title: “Wanted to stay for ever”
Reviews.Author: happimags
Reviews.Content: This was almost the end of our tour. This hotel was so lovely. The outside lifts were fascinating. The sheer enormity of the hotel is amazing I did venture up to the 35th floor. It was fascinating the inner rim of the bar rotates slowly. Who could resist those beds!

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not up to Westin standards”
Reviews.Author: vallelunga
Reviews.Content: I was ambivalent about booking my stay in L.A. at the Westin Bonaventure after reading the mixed reviews here. I went ahead anyway, given that it had the Westin trademark on it. I wish I had trusted my gut and gone elsewhere. This is by far the lowest quality Westin I have ever stayed in. Oh, you *will* see the Heavenly Bed and the famously fabulous double shower head, thank goodness. But that's where the Westin experience stops. I did notice in several places that it said "This hotel is independently owned and operated." HUH? I mean, that explains a lot! But is it a Westin? The condition of the rooms and the common areas were similar to what I would expect at a 2-star hotel. The carpet in my rooms (I had two different ones) was awful. The ceiling needs to be replaced. The walls need to be repainted or re-wallpapered. Thank goodness for that crisp white bed linen or I never would have been able to sleep. (Yes, I'm very particular about my hotel rooms. But I expect to pay for quality. I don't expect to pay this much for a hotel in poor condition.) The design of the hotel is dated but fascinating. That means it's a great place to visit and have a drink in the hotel lobby. But book your stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “BLAH...Bonaventure!”
Reviews.Author: littledumpling
Reviews.Content: $42.00 for parking a day! This hotel was dirty upon arrival! My feet got so black by walking on the carpet I had to wear slippers the whole time I was in my room. We stayed with another couple for 3 days. The rooms were dark and small, the once nice thing was the shower (that was it). The bed was old and it felt really bumpy/dirty. There was NO FLAT SCREEN...just an old square tv. The channels offered were dull...not much variety. The staff was lazy, especially the valet. We even called ahead for our car and it still took like 10 min once we got down there. The valet drivers are crazy and drive the cars like they are drag racers. For $42.00 a day that is a rip off for sure! The eateries in the hotel are drab! The food court establishments have B ratings and they look really dirty and it doesn't seem the food gets turned around too often as it doesn't seem people like to eat there. The lobby appears to look impressive, but it really isn't. This hotel needs a make over from the staff to the rooms. I would not recommend this hotel especially to those traveling with a family. It seems this hotel only caters to business folk and really just ignore most others that are just on a simple vacation. Not worth the price at all!

Reviews.Title: “A Period Piece in Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: smoovy
Reviews.Content: Hollywood loves a good period piece...and Hollywood seems to love the Westin Bonaventure because a ton of films have used the Bonaventure as a backdrop. The Westin is quite proud of their fame. The question for the modern traveler...Does the fame live up to the Westin experience? The first question from many is...WHY would you stay in DOWNTOWN LA?? Downtown LA has a bad rap for being riddled with crime and homeless throngs roaming the streets. I went to school at USC just south of downtown, so I know the old reputation well. I also know that downtown LA has changed. It's the home of significant urban renewal...and renewal can't get more urban than this part of LA. The old garment district warehouses are now semi-luxury lofts. While it's no parade from the nearby Disneyland...Main Street LA is now in the overwhelming shadow of the gorgeous new Disney Music Hall. The theater complex and Museums have really taken root and make the area very enjoyable...and easily walkable which is a real treat in Los Angeles. But...about the hotel...the architecture was tres avant garde back in the day it was built. You're faced with basically 5 giant room-filled columns. From an architectural vantage, that was probably pretty cool. As a guest, it's not an age of architectural glory that you're trying to remmber. Instead, you're faced with sometimes challenging task of remembering which elevator ascends the column that will take you to your room, and if you're wrong, it may be a while before you find your heavenly bed. I read a lot of reviews about the Bonventure being dated, and I have to disagree. Our rooms were very nice. The toiletries in the bathroom were sparse, but I thought that the room was generally very nice. The trademarked Heavenly Bed was heavenly, and the decor wasn't dated at all. An odd function of the cylindrical architecture is that an elevator ran literally within an arm's reach of our windows. Noise was never a problem, but if you're not an exhibitionist, you might request a room away from the view of elevators. We didn't bother changing rooms, so read what you will into that. Finally, there's a rotating lounge and restaurant on the top floor... and it's really a must see. It's pricey, so I wouldn't recommend dinner, but it's certainly worth a drink...sunset if you can!

Reviews.Title: “Prepare for the worst, but go anyway! It's well worth it!”
Reviews.Author: My-View-on-things
Reviews.Content: It is very hard to properly review this hotel. Paradoxally, the hotel is quite bad (certainly unworthy the Westin logo) but still very much worth staying at. It's all about the hotel's potential. Usually, you need a historic building for a hotel to be really special. Contemporary business hotels without cultural references are rarely charming. This one however is. The building is simply fascinating, and one cannot help but wonder how amazing it would be after a good remodelling of the rooms (and restaurants) and the installment of proper hotel management. At the same time, there are no excuses for: - rude and extremely expensive valet parking - terribly dodgy restaurants (i.e. snackbars) - duct tape everywhere to keep carpet in place - plastic disposable cups in room (instead of glasses); this is simply an example that shows the lack of TLC in the rooms - neglected pool area Hopefully this hotel will shake off its somewhat sad look and feel at some point, and fully use its potential. I would suggest hiring Philippe Starck to refurbish the top floor rotating bar, and a top chef to run the place. Actual quality: 1/5 Fun factor:4/5 Potential 5/5 Average score: 2/5

Reviews.Title: “so so”
Reviews.Author: traveling_gal801
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for business. Would never book here for leisure. Never with children. Service was good, but this hotel needs a major upgrade. Definetly not a 5 star hotel. Avoid the restaurants in the hotel. Pricey and not very good. The best is the breakfast buffet, but is expensive at $25 per person. Several "greasy spoon" restaurants located on the 4th level, pizza, sandwiches, chips, chinese,..etc. Restaurants are a few blocks away and mostly pricey also. Traffic is miserable here, and the hotel is noisy. I was on the 23rd floor and could either hear traffic and/ or the elevators going all night long. The parking is a just plain rip off. $42 per night for hotel guests...which is not noted on their website. Shopping in this area is very slim, unless you like garment district type shopping. The Macy's, a few blocks away is the worst I have ever seen. The upside: The beds are comfortable and the linens are wonderful. If you are an architectural type, the structure is actually amazing, when you realize the concrete construction of the building.

Reviews.Title: “We Loved the Bonaventure”
Reviews.Author: rich_frisco
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Bonaventure for one night and were delighted with the hotel. The hotel lobby and multi-story atrium were dated and reminded us of a hospital, but it was still neat to behold. We were able to check-in early at 11:45 a.m. There were quite a few people in line at the front desk, but only one person in the Starwood Preferred Guest line. The front-desk staff were friendly and upbeat. Although our reservation was through Priceline, we were put in a nice room on a Starwood Preferred Guest floor. Our room was tiny, but comfortable. It did smell funny, like someone spilled a bowl of ramen noodles on the floor, but we were able to get past that. The decor was very contemporary and clean, and the bed was truly heavenly. The coffee maker was stocked with Starbucks coffee. The air conditioner worked extremely well, considering the expansive glass exterior. The only complaint we had was the bathrobe (why is there only one??), which was stained and frayed. An LCD TV would have been a nice touch in this class of hotel. The internet was average at $12.95 per 24 hours, but the parking was exorbitant. Even for hotel guests, it was $42 per night, valet required. We will definitely stay here again, but next time we will be smarter about the parking.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT GO IN THERE... PLEASE!!!”
Reviews.Author: bicontinental
