Reviews.Content: I don't know how I did it, but I got this hotel for less than $100, what a bargain! Search those website for great last minute deals! The hotel is a bit 80s cheesy, but in a good way. The room had curved floor to ceiling windows so it was an awkward shape, but again in a good way. The Heavenly bed was, well, heavenly. Plus, we spent the next morning looking out the window at a movie being shot on the closed off street next to the hotel -- we think it was Die Hard 4. All in all, it was a fabulous place to stay. The only negative, the $20 per day parking charge!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great suites”
Reviews.Author: msganc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in the business area and so is very quiet at the weekends - but the rates are good. We booked a Tower Suite which was huge. 2 bathrooms, large bedroom and huge lounge. The heavenly bed and shower were fantastic. The rooms are a little dated but are spotlessly clean. The hotel is absolutely huge with a small shopping centre in it!!! It has featured in many hollywood films but the atrium is a bit impersonal and has a shopping centre feel to it. The gym was excellent and modern. The service was very good and I would certainly recommend drinks in the revolving restaurant at the top of the hotel - great views!!! The restaurant at the top of the hotel is also very good. There isn't much to do locally for tourists as its the business area and so everything is a taxi ride away but this didn't really bother us. Overall, the location isn't great for tourists (but is perfect if you are on business) but the suites are huge and good value and the service is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay in decent hotel”
Reviews.Author: GladeVandrer
Reviews.Content: Stayed there four nights a couple of years ago. Rooms were clean and modern, beds were very comfortable. It's a typical business hotel of quality. The reception-are was so-so, but overall, the Westin Bonaventure was a very comfortable stay in downtown LA. Only real downside: Parking, which was extremely expensive in hotel garage ($30)

Reviews.Title: “Didn't meet my expectations”
Reviews.Author: Greenkitty
Reviews.Content: I was expecting many things from a Westin property.....and although the staff was very friendly and courteous, the beds were anything but heavenly. I just came back from a five day stay at the Westin from Jan 8 thru the 13th on a conference taking place at the LA Covention Center. As soon as we arrived we were informed our room was not ready and we would have to wait. Thankfully, the lady at the front desk did a little magic and we got a room. As soon as we arrived to the room we couldn't believe how small the room turned out to be. There was close to no room for two beds. We had to ask the hotel to remove a lounge chair to make more room. Apparently, since all the rooms are located in the towers which happen to be round then all the rooms are the exact same size. It was tight, and don't even get me started on the bathroom. It was tini and didn't have a fan. Trying to hookup to the internet was like sitting thru a dentist appointment.... painful. After calling the front desk ten times they just gave up and left us on our own with this problem. We went out to dinner that same evening and came back to two additional suitcases in our room. That was very scary as someone gave the front desk our room key to put their suitcases in our room. Needless to say we were appalled that someone other than us entered our room and left the suitcases in there knowing this other person was not staying in our room. After calling the front desk they promptly took the suitcases away and apologized. I wasn't feeling too safe in the room that evening. And then when we finally got a chance to get ready for bed we realized the beds were old and just horrible. If you leaned too much in one direction it felt the entire mattress was about to flip on top of me!!! We asked them to flip the mattress over because it felt like it had seen one too many guests but they declined to do so. So we were esentially stuck with a bed that was anything but heavenly for five days. This hotel is great if you are in LA as a tourist and you are never going to be in your room, to all female business travelers I say, run.

Reviews.Title: “I have slept in shoe boxes that were larger”
Reviews.Author: Grohe
Reviews.Content: This hotel's service is good, I have to point that out. The rooms are SO SMALL! So small. And the beds, they are not heavenly at all. They were way too soft and they were not supportive on their frames. I felt like if I moved to quickly I may flip off the bed. The frames seemed cheap and about to fall apart. The rooms are in round towers which takes the size of them and makes them tiny triangles. The air blowed right over my bed so every morning I woke up with a stiff neck. Everyone who seems like this place got is CHEAP online so sure, for $80 it is fine but not the $299 we paid to be at our conference. It was a tiny fish bowl.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: MiaLimerick
Reviews.Content: Paid about 350euros for 4 nites between 2. Thought the price was very reasonable. On arrival in hotel thought it looked fantastic, receptionist was very friendly. Room was on the blue tower 16 floors up, the vew was fantastic. Not used to heights but the outside lifs were brilliant. The food was very good, no complaints. Only thing that was got caught with was the buffet breakfast, i think it was about 18dollars each, the fry-up wasnt the best and after all there is only so much you can eat! Starbucks located in the bar area is much nicer and cheaper! Beds are just fabulous, pool was very handy as it was hot but the only problem was the sun went behind the building in front of us so we had to wait for about an hour before it came out again. Very weird sunbathing with an office block in front of you!! One tip, the bar near the pool, it only has local beer and not to our taste... on the 2nd night we discovered the off licence, bought bottles of beer for 1 dollar and sat outside in the patio area, everyone else seemed to be doing it as well. Beer much cheaper that the bar prices. Meet lots of flight attendances and pilots, nice to get chatting to them and here of their experiences. Taxis are reasonalbe, went to Universal Studios & Paramont Studios. Walked down Hollwood Blvd and the Walk of Fame. Hollywood was fab! If i was to go there again i would def stay in this hotel, it was a bit far from things but taxis and the underground are easily accessable.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Beds! Ghostown Restaurants/Shops ”
Reviews.Author: FashionGiirl
Reviews.Content: I stay about 4 times a year when I come to La for business. I LOVE THE VIEW AND THE BEDS! It is very peaceful in the room(because you are so high up), the beds are the best things ever(clean and fluffy). Wall to floor windows make the small room spectacular. On the other hand, I was very upset to hear the guy sitting next to me saying he booked the room for $69 when I paid $179 for the same room! Inoticed some people had free breakfast passes when we paid a fortune. It seems like athey play a numbers game and I got the short end of the stick. the concierge is no the most knowlegable, do not call them for information! You can walk all over the hotel only to find most of the restaurants closed and the food cafeteria like. Especially all the lunch places, they all carry the same gyro's, med salads, pizza etc. Find the best rate! VISIT THE REVOLVING BAR! Make sure to save money for the $10-14 drinks and relax. It is a comy, safe hotel!

Reviews.Title: “good value on Priceline”
Reviews.Author: TravelingChumley
Reviews.Content: my third stay here and all via Priceline. The most recent winning bid was $58 per night two nights. Valet parked because it was most convient. No mention of Priceline during checkin and it was rather fast. Assigned a double non smoking, asked for a king non smoking and that's what I got, away from the elevators. No use of the facilities, except valet and they were rather prompted. Still a small problem was the bathroom toilet, the seat did not fit under the counter, making putting up the seat impossible. Last time, it fit under the counter and I felt the counter every time, like a stick up man robbing me. I think I robbed them with the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value on Priceline!”
Reviews.Author: BrassBryan
Reviews.Content: we got this hotel for 70usd a night. Although it was old and had nothing to offer to tourists except quick bites for the nearby office workers,the rooms were in excellent condition. The standard Westin experiences(bed,shower etc) was well served up for $70usd a night.Great value. We rented a car so we got pretty much everywhere we wanted to go.It was appx 15mins from the Universal Studios and not too far from Hollywood Blvd.Of course keep the traffic in mind! Loved this and would stay here again for the value if I came to LA again.

Reviews.Title: “First Impression Of Us Was Great”
Reviews.Author: RiaY
Reviews.Content: We arrived at Westin Bonaventure straight from our 14hour flight from Australia. We found the staff extremely helpful and were very impressed with the rooms. The rate we obtained in Australia was excellent for the facilities offered. We had breakfast on level four at one of the cafes. We found the subway easily accessed. The $3 day pass was excellent value. We were travelling with two teenage children and they also enjoyed the experience offered at Bonaventure.

Reviews.Title: “Bonaventure dazzle”
Reviews.Author: rafael100
Reviews.Content: The Bonaventure is still an exciting place to visit and to stay, in a 1970's sort of way. The rooms, which are gradually being updated, are still comfortable and spacious. The staff is thoroughly competent, and bargain rates are easy to find on the Web. During a recent stay we chose to check out at the same time as a convention did, and we had to wait an hour for our car. But otherwise the Bonaventure has not disapponted us.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: macabee
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff is very helpful and check in was handled very quickly. I stayed in a very large king room with a large bathroom. The bed was very comfortable and the Westin showerheads are incredible. The only downside of the room was that you could hear people talking in the room next door. It takes some time to find your elevator and get oriented as the hotel is circular, but each color section is clearly marked. The conference rooms are very spacious and allowed for good flow during meetings. The hotel is close to all of downtown Los Angeles, the Disney center, the Staples Center and the Convention Center.

Reviews.Title: “Great business stay in LA”
Reviews.Author: taupoali
Reviews.Content: I had a great stay in the Westin. The hotel bar is in a central location right by reception and is easy for meeting collegues. The rooms are standard, and the bed is worthy of praise as it was large and comfy. The shower was 2 headed and really woke me up in the morning! Scenes from "True Lies" and "In the line of fire" were filmed here and the elevators are instantly recognizable for fans of those films. There is a revolving restaurant and cocktail bar on the top floors which is well worth a visit, particularly if you like steak with great city views! If you are in downtown LA for a conference then this hotel is a 5 minute cab ride or 20-25 minute walk from the conference center.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you could ask for but no more”
Reviews.Author: MarkRoddis
Reviews.Content: Staying for 5 nights whilst in LA on business this hotel was chosen for me. First impressions are good and the welcome from the front of house staff is warm. Once you have worked out which elevator you need to take (easier said than done but at least they are colour coded) you are at your room in minutes. The room itself was clean, well laid out (for a round building) and comfortable. Not the biggest room I have stayed in but plenty big enough or me. If did have 2 queen beds in though. Over the week the bar was a focal point and the bar staff soon got to remember your drink. Breakfast was good and there are actually a number of shops and fast food outlets inside the hotel itself. Location wise, it is as good as anywhere else in downtown LA. If you stay, you must however check out the rotating bar on the 34th floor. After a few drinks it really messes up your head. So clean, comfortable with welcoming staff. I have stayed better but for the money you can't go wrong and the 4 star rating is about right. I would be quite happy to stay their on my next visit

Reviews.Title: “Met our needs”
Reviews.Author: UKtog
Reviews.Content: Stayed 26-28 Oct precruise. We are SPG members but had booked through expedia however on check in they moved us to the SPG tower. Room was lovely - direct view over the Hollywood Hills, though we did find it a bit noisy at night, but we live in the countryside so are not used to noise. Felt breaksfast buffet was too expensive, but there was a nice takeaway coffee shop opposite reception where we bought pastries and took them back to the room and made coffee using their filter and the sachets supplied which appeared to be free of charge Night one we had intended to eat in the Bonaventure Brewing Company but it was booked to a private function. Actually we were only looking for a snack anyway. We dismissed all the places on Floors 3-6 foodcourts - they all looked awful and decided just to treat ourselves to a drink in the revolving bar on Floor 34. Great place to see the city at night, lovely service and we had a wonderful appetizer to share platter for $20 which had lots on it and fitted the bill perfectly. We got the concierge to set us up with Guideline Tours around LA next day - this is whom the hotel work through and we did not have time to work anything else out. In the event we found them to be very good,nice small vans and good service. Contrast with the concierge who was disinterested and pretty rude when we asked some basic questions (OK we are from the UK we do not understand everything and how things work first time!) Second evening ate in LA Prime on Floor 35. Beautiful steak meal but a tad expensive and the wine was overpriced. We were still getting over jet lag so only had an entre and a dessert to share and we got the feeling the server was hoping for a bigger order from our table so we rarely saw him! Husband rated the gym as one of the best he had stayed in, once I got over the relatively dark interior of the central atrium I enjoyed this hotel I would certainly stay here again at the price we paid and if it was a pre cruise stop as this was, but bear in mind there is not a lot to do downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Downtown,LA !”
Reviews.Author: Jan_Korta
Reviews.Content: I have recently stayed at Westin for 4 nights and there is nothing negative to say ! This place is just perfect for business travellers. Book through priceline - you always get a good rate. Service and staff (concierge) is really the best I have ever seen. For dinner choose LA Prime - best view in the city. I will really recommend this hotel to my friends and would love to have a chance to come back again. Well done, Westin Bonaventure !

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: DragonJack
Reviews.Content: Big, nice hotel. Stayed for 3 nights in early October with two kids. Room was a standard size-quite good enough with nice bathroom and excellent double shower-head. Very comfortable beds and pillows. We bought take-away breakfast from shops on 4th floor and ate in the room-very convenient. Buffet cost $20 each-too much for a family of four. We liked the downtown location, you can walk to subway to Hollywood and Universal Studios. Not many restaurants open at night but we loved California Pizza Kitchen a few blocks away. Nice staff, would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Splurge for the parking!”
Reviews.Author: kdporter
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Bonaventure on our honeymoon. We live in Georgia and had never been to Los Angeles as adults. Overall the trip was wonderful! There is so much to do in LA it is hard to decide, but the concierge at the hotel was wonderful- Make sure you use them! I read all of the trip advisor reviews before we went and I was a little hesitant about the valet parking cost- but go ahead and splurge, it is worth it! They have your car waiting for you when you need it- and they even clean it up! So, don't waste your time looking for cheaper parking! The hotel was kind of dated- but that really didn't bother us too much. We had lots of privacy on our floor- it was never noisy. It is kind of like a cruise ship- they have lots of stores and restaurants. We ate lunch and/or dinner almost every day in the Bonaventure Brewing Co.- It was fabulous!! My husband loved the home brews- and I loved the food! Overall, we had a wonderful trip and the Bonaventure was a big part of it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay here!”
Reviews.Author: sbseamus
Reviews.Content: The standard king rooms in this hotel are incredibly small. Definetly not a four star hotel. The wallpaper was coming off the walls. There were stains all over the ceiling in the bathroom. The nightstand light was missing a lightbulb. When we called the front desk to ask for one they dropped off one that did not fit. The two side chairs that barely fit in the room were worn and long past their prime. The valet car service takes forever to get your car. Stay at another hotel if you want to enjoy your stay.

Reviews.Title: “very comfy,building needs updating”
Reviews.Author: SBR
Reviews.Content: This hotel is vey comfortable with lovely beds & an amazing shower! the only fault I had with the hotel is that it does need a refurbishment in the communal areas. The location is downtown but getting around on the underground is easy & costs $3 for the day! we went from here to universal & hollywood no problem as we had no car.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel Downtown”
Reviews.Author: WashDC1
Reviews.Content: A massive hotel - really a shopping center within a hotel. Interesting design that has been filmed in a number of movies. Glass cylinder towers with elevators that run on the outside. On the lower levels are take out places as well as some sit down restaurants. The pub with outdoor patio was fabled for having one of the best burgers in downtown LA - and the burger was very good. There are also other shops. The hotel itself has a few restaurants and a bar at the lobby level. There is a Starbucks across the ramp from the pool. The outdoor pool is pleasant - a massive office building overlooks it which can be a pleasant irony. My room was small but comfortable - very clean and fairly well appointed - although a bit dated. Bed was very nice. Due to the cylndrical nature of the hotel the windows on the room curve around. The hotel is downtown and as such street parking is virtually nonexistent. Hotel parking is $25 per day. Expensive but they were fairly efficient and pleasant. There is another lot across the street from the hotel parking entrance but I don't know the cost. I'd probably stay here again if I wanted to be in dowtown LA.

Reviews.Title: “Don't Stay Here. Seriously.”
Reviews.Author: Michael_SD
Reviews.Content: I reserved a one night stay at the Westin Bonaventure - I lasted there a mere 2 hours. The arrival is that of your typical large, downtown hotel. Check-in was quick and was with a friendly European gentleman. He made small talk and kindly placed me on a high floor. The trip to the rooms is via great glass elevators that give expansive views of downtown and the outlying areas. But once I arrived on my floor, all of that changed. The hallways are creepy - dark, dingy, grimy and circular. And the smell of old shoes is prevalent. I walked into my room and felt sheer disappointment. The pink pin-striped wallpaper and green carpet were highlights of the filfty room. The furniture was worn and dented, there was a huge leak spot on the ceiling and ketchup (at least I hope it was ketchup) was spattered on the wall. Oddly enough, in the midst of the dirty, archaic room was a brand new Westin "Heavenly" Bed. Too strange! I was so disgusted by my room that I decided I wouldn't stay. I live in San Diego, so I figured I would just drive back home and after taking care of my business in LA. I took a quick shower (after laying out towels on the floor so my bare feet would not touch the carpet or tile) and left. Awful experience! This is not to say the hotel's bad....my room was, though. If I had complained and asked to be moved, I am sure they could have provided a better room. But I'm not a complainer. I do have to say that I was SHOCKED this was a Westin property. Gross!

Reviews.Title: “Bonaventure great appearance, bad service”
Reviews.Author: fenwitch
Reviews.Content: The Bonaventure is a lovely hotel for those of you who are not using a car during your stay. Otherwise the parking is much too expensive. While the upstairs dining is quite nice,(but about $25 a person) the food court serves food that is inedible and overpriced. My chinese food I had to throw away, I really couldn't eat it. They also only take cash at the foot court kiosks, and all three of the "resteraunts" downstairs were closed during my stay. One isn't open on weekends, on closes at 2pm and one was booked for a wedding. The bell staff let me struggle with very heavy bags on my own, trying to open doors with my hands obviously full. I hurt my arm trying to do this alone. The room is neat, but it is small. Not a good place for someone with children.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Great Price”
Reviews.Author: litza2005
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Westin Bonaventure for 4 nights from August 14-18, 2006. The hotel exceeded our expectations. The staff were friendly and helpful, especially the concierge who answered all our questions and explained the transit system for us. We loved the fitness centre. It was always open and each piece of cardio equipment had its own t.v. that you could plug your headphones into. The hotel itself is huge and several levels of the hotel have small restaurants and cafes that are not owned or operated by the hotel, but are great for grabbing a small or quick breakfast. The hotel has a breakfast buffet that is good but at $18.95 a person we didn't want to eat there each day. The room was small and a strange shape as mentioned by previous reviews but the king sized bed was very comfortable and I loved the pillows. We ate dinner at the Bonaventure Brewing Company in the hotel and it was very tasty. The hotel is about 2 blocks from the metro and made taking transit very easy to use. Would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay if you don't use valet!”
Reviews.Author: Bianca_b
Reviews.Content: We got a GREAT rate at the Westin Bonaventure via Priceline and honestly we have nothing but positive comments. We enjoyed our stay, staff was friendly, great rooms, great bed, great views. The hotel decor (outside of the rooms, lobby, hallways) is a bit dated, but we really enjoyed the architecture, the Andy Warhol paintings outside our door, the glass elevators - it was great fun! My only complaint is that the hotel ONLY offers valet parking at $20.00 or $25.00 a night (I can't remember). More often than not, when we would try and leave, there was a crowd of people doing the same thing. Long lines to turn in your ticket, long lines while we waited for the valet to retrieve our car. One morning, we left our hotel room at 8:00 am, went straight to the valet, stood at the end of a long line, and we were in our car by 8:42. The Westin Bonaventure could certainly use a better parking system.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience at the Bonaventure”
Reviews.Author: passwordb
Reviews.Content: I agonized over where to stay when taking my son to USC, but shouldn't have worried about this hotel. It is just a few minutes and a straight shot from campus. Although huge, the service was very good - the concierge(s) knew every answer and a request for toothpaste only took 10 minutes. The room was beautifully appointed - yes, it was an odd shape because of the shape of the building - and had an oversized workdesk and black-tiled marble bathroom with a great shower. There are several shops and restaurants on various levels, including a very large fitness center, and a wine and cheese shop that also sold fresh muffins and fruit. The food and service in the casual restaurant on the top floor was mediocre - much better in the lobby bar/restaurant. There are also several good restaurants within walking distance. Valet parking is required unless you want to walk a long distance. The price isn't too bad if you plan to go in and out several times during the day.

Reviews.Title: “Having a great time!”
Reviews.Author: Grandmastertraveller
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel through Priceline but I've still been treated royally. I was able to check-in to one my rooms 4 hours early. The views from the room are beautiful, I can see the mountains in the background. I am writing this from my room and I am here another two nights. The staff has been pleasent and the manager Mr. Huizar is really nice and helpful. The internet in the room is 12.95 through Wayport, so depending on how long you'll be here (or using other Wayport connections) it may pay to either get the monthly pass or the prepaid cards (good for 6 moths). The only other downside is that parking is $25 a day. There's some street parking but it's hard to find (only 4 meters on a street) and the other garages are more expensive (unless you enter after 5 P.M. and leave b/f 3 A.M.). Anyway, go and enjoy the Heavenly bed and shower.

Reviews.Title: “ok as convention hotel”
Reviews.Author: hcarch
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the omni for the AIA convention. since it was my first time in la this was a good place, especially with all the movie scene locations in the hotel. By modern standards the room was small but again a neccessary experience for the curved glass wall and the views. It's time for some remodelling. Good bargains for inexpensive food on lobby balcony levels.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Maryalamb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel Aug2-6 on a priceline bid of $55/night. Rooms were very small but comfortable. Only noise we heard was from neighbors, we had an adjoining room with only a thin door between us. I asked to be far from the elevators and ice machine. Pool was nice. Only complaint was the food court area. The employees were not friendly and the food looked bad. We ate pizza one night and the cheese was not completely melted. Every time we'd go into one of the restaurants, the employees would continue talking and would not wait on us. Then on one occasion was going to ask one of the employees (who was wearing a Westin shirt) directions, and I asked "do you work here"? he said "no"..ha....didn't let those irritations bother me. Overall was happy with the stay. Parking was $25 a night and the hotel was right next to the interstate with easy access. Would not hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience”
Reviews.Author: Jodylyn60
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews for this hotel, I didn't quite know what to expect. Here's what we found the case to be. We stayed in a standard room with 2 full beds not 1 queen as some reviews read. The room was small but the bed was comfortable and the room clean and quiet(we did not hear an elevator). The staff was pleasant and helpful. The room had a small refrigerator and a safe. Parking was $25 which is expensive but hey it's the big city. We did not feel unsafe, there are some homeless as there are in every large city, we used the valet parking all the time so we were never outside downtown after dark. There is a hotel food court, basically you can get subway, chinese and some convenience store type stuff. If you''re looking for breakfast, there is a little restaurant called the pantry not far from the hotel, it's not fancy but the food is good, portions are large and its inexpensive. The location was away from some tourist attractions, it is hard to stay anywhere really convenient the city is pretty spread out. The freeway is right by the hotel so it took less than an hour to get to the places we needed to go. All in all, we got a great price on this hotel and it worked for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Priceline Stay”
Reviews.Author: Velvalee
Reviews.Content: I had my doubts about this hotel due to all of the negative reviews, but I have about decided that the majority of people who post to tripadvisor.com are either perpetual pessimists or people who are used to exemplary accomodations wherever they go. I have stayed at a number of hotels that have been poorly reviewed on this site and never had a bad experience at any of the ones I've ended up staying at. As for the Westin Bonaventure, for $60-$70 per night, this place is awesome. Yes, the parking is high, but with a priceline rate, you're still staying in downtown LA for under $100/night. That's pretty good. One warning--be careful if you check in late. The Westin garage is full every night and if you are not a hotel guest who has managed to get in earlier in the day, they will send you across the street to park, which is $50/night. Try to get there early or pick your rental car up when you can park it early in the day. Once you get your car registered with them, you can get in even if the sign says the garage is full. Yes, the rooms are a bit on the small side, but for a couple, this poses no issues--at least not for us. The rooms are well appointed, and the bath was bigger than the larger Westin room we stayed in out at the airport before we left. We had a room on the 30th floor with fabulous views, great air conditioning and a heavenly bed! Housekeeping was great, and everyone we dealt with was courteous. The location is totally convenient--a good section of downtown with super-easy freeway access. Room service was surprisingly good, the brew pub had decent food, though service was a bit slow, and there are a ton of food options to choose from in the area, so you aren't stuck with hotel priced meals. It's a walkable area, at least during the day and early evening. The pool is fine, with big fluffy Westin towels, but keep in mind it is a "rooftop" pool and a bit on the small side. Also, wear your flip-flops--the concrete gets hot and is pretty sooty from being 5 stories above downtown and near a freeway. Not a luxurious pool by any means, but kind of cool to lay out and look up at the surrounding skyscrapers. We had quick and easy check-in and out, and while our experience with the concierge wasn't the warmest, he was efficient and courteous. This hotel is enormous and busy--I'm sure they do their best. Bottom line, the hotel is convenient, more than comfortable, and if you get a decent rate, you should have no cause for complaint. in addition, this hotel has been in a ton of movies, so you'll probably recognize it. It's a very LA experience!

Reviews.Title: “good experience”
Reviews.Author: toffeegirl27
Reviews.Content: I was surprised to see quite so many negative reviews of this hotel. My friend and I stayed here on the 12th of July for 3 nights. We had just arrived from Dublin and were very tired so we were pleased that check in was quick and they were very polite and helpful. There was a subway in the hotel so we could just grab a quick bite before going to bed and we could see in the distance the hollywood sign from our room. The concierge wasn't overly nice but we spoke to a couple and they weren't all like that. Our room was big and well air-conditioned and the beds were great. The bathroom too was big and very clean. The fountains in the lobby were great, parking the car was fine but expensive so we were pleased we only had it for one night while there. Overall a very pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Accommodations OK; Service Poor”
Reviews.Author: joe_sparty
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Westin July 17-21 for a conference. Here's a quick rundown: GOOD: --It's in a safe, clean part of downtown. If you must stay downtown, the location can't be beat. There are, however, other hotels nearby. --The bed was comfortable, although I'm not sure what's so "heavenly" about it. --Good views from most rooms, mine included. BAD: --The place is huge, and it can be tricky to figure out how to get from one part of the hotel to another. --The staff was indifferent or downright cold every time I interacted with someone. --They "did not have sufficient rooms" when I checked in, so I spent the first night of my stay on a sofa bed. Apparently, based on other posts, this happens frequently. --My room was very small--one of the smallest hotel rooms I've ever seen. Maybe I got unlucky. OVERALL: If I got a good rate again (paid around $100 a night) and absolutely HAD to stay downtown, I might consider it. But there must be other places in LA nearer some nightlife or the beach that are better.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but very nice”
Reviews.Author: schubert_lieder
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights in July 2006. Overall our experience was very positive! There was some delay at the check-in and a lot of people were waiting for rooms. However, the friendly hotel staff made the wait bearable. They served coffee, cookies and lemonade while people waited. Other than this one problem, the rest of our stay was fantastic. The view from our 27th floor room was fantastic. The room was a bit small but very well appointed. The pool was nice, the fitness center was great. We ate one day at the revolving restaurant at the top and the food and service was great. The views were fantastic (especially at sundown). If you want to stay in downtown LA, the location is very convinient as well (easy on / off the freeways). This is a very large hotel so finding things can be a bit difficult.

Reviews.Title: “stay as far away as you can from this over priced mess!”
Reviews.Author: gecko47
Reviews.Content: Well lets start with the 30 minute check in, were after this amount of time the lady at the front told us that we had no room reservation and that we would need to take a different room due to the fact that they gave our reservation away and did not know how to fix the problem so me and my girlfriend had to take a double twin room over a king bed, and this is just the start of a great weekend vacation. We then get to the room they gave us and the floor is soaking wet from a leak in the bathroom. We call down to the front desk and let them know about the problem and they send someone to look at the wall and floor and they end up needing to move us to another room, that is ok not a problem but when they go to move us they call up to our room and tell us a manager is on the way with new keys to take us to our room, a bell boy shows up 45 minutes later and requests the old keys then gives me the new ones and walks away. I ask were is the new room located and what is the new room number and he replies i dont know call the front desk. as he walks on to the elevator. We then decide that this hotel is not going to ruin our vacation so we go up to there fine dining L.A steakhouse on the 35th floor and have a meal were the server knew very little about the menu and even littler about how to clear a table. We had our appatizer and our empty bottles of watter and wine left on our table the entire dinner, they even went as far as to empty our wine into the water glass and not even notice they had mixed the water and wine together. The next day we get woke up at 7 am to the punding sound of hammers and drill guns, they are replacing all the air conditioning units on our floor and our new room is leeking like the 1st one was. I then call down to the front desk again and the gal tells me there is no one working on my floor and that she has not heard of a problem with leaks. I blow it off and take a breath and go to the concierge and ask for some help locating some tickets for a concert at the staples center and he responds to me "if I were you I would try to find them else were because my services are out of your league and you could not afford them or this hotel and you do not have the kind of money it would take to purchase them". Basically he was an [--------] and does not realize that I have plenty of money and that just because someone looks like they might not be from money or have it don't mean they don't, I work hard for my family and took that comment very very personal. I hope that this will help someone else choose a hotel other than this one due to so many people having similar experiences here.

Reviews.Title: “Lobby needs updating but rooms are nice”
Reviews.Author: fred117
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bonaventure for a convention (why else would you stay in downtown?) and were very satisfied by the Westin. The rooms were up to date and the service was what we expected from the Westin. The Heavenly beds are top quality as are most beds in hotels of this caliber. The gym was nicely equiped but are a little exposed right off the lobby. The rooftop pool is fine but with all the buildings around it isn’t the ideal California beach locale. Parking is pricy at $25/night but with in/out privileges and attentive staff it's worth it. My only complaint is the lobby and street loading which is confusing. Checking in it wasn't clear where to unload the car and find bell staff and if more than a few cars are already there, forget it. We wound up driving into the garage and carrying our own bags up two floors to the lobby. The layout of the lobby is very spread out and because the atrium is symmetrical, finding the front desk and the elevator to your tower can be challenging.

Reviews.Title: “Third Time Around”
Reviews.Author: emtee
Reviews.Content: When reading the other reviews, I can't imagine they are talking about the same hotel. My fiance and I have visited LA 4x and stayed at the Westin Bonaventure the last 3x. We can't get enough of the gorgeous views from the large bedrooms. The beds are the best sleep we ever get. The rooms are not small at all, I mean how big do you expect them to be? And the service is better than good, it's excellent. The same guy that works there remembers us each time. The only drawback is that the shops to close too early.

Reviews.Title: “Something you should be aware of this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dave92123
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Bonaventure this past weekend, and it's a return visit. The hotel is clean and professionally operated (with the exception of when we opened our night stand drawer and found a wrapped condom there, obviously the previous inhabitant of that room had stashed it there and housekeeping failed to open and check the drawer). The rooms are small by Westin standards, the unique design of a rounded building actually takes away square footage from the room layout, so it's a bit cramped for more than one person in a standard room, and if you have three (like we did with my teenage daughter) it gets downright packed! Like all big city hotels, the Bonaventure offers an overpriced restaurant and cocktail lounge. However, they also have a "food court" level (level 4 of the complex) with some small "mom & pop" type sandwich shops and a couple of restaurants not operated by the Westin. This is where the trouble comes in. One of the restaurants is called the "Bonaventure Brewing Co.". This place is simply AWFUL and you should avoid it at all costs. Just by their name, you would possibly assume they are indeed part of the hotel's management, but they're not. I entertained a party of 6 last weekend. They sat us in an area where the overhead fan wasn't working, and offered to "open a window". What was ironic, the room was practically empty (perhaps that should have given us our first clue), and they could have set up a table under a fan that did work, but this didn't occur to them. We ordered, and after about 10 minutes, our server returned to inform two of my guests that the kitchen didn't have what they ordered and they'll have to order something else. No apology, just a flat statement of tell me what you want instead. The food was not bad, but certainly nothing to rave about. It was like pulling teeth to get our server to return to the table to re-fill water glasses, etc. The final insult was when the check arrived, they INCLUDED a 18% tip. I've heard of places stating how they do this to parties of 10 or more, I've even heard it for parties of 8 or more, but NEVER to parties of 6. I think the server may have heard some early complaining from our table over the broken fan business and thought his tip was in jeapordy (which, given the lack of service we got, it certainly WAS). Anyway, stay away from this place!

Reviews.Title: “Don't judge this book by its cover!”
Reviews.Author: eeeeestar
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bonaventure for the first time this past weekend. When I’m in downtown LA, I prefer to stay at the Omni because it’s a classy yet affordable hotel with great perks for its preferred guests. But I thought I’d give the Bonaventure a try, given its illustrious history and solid reputation. From the outside, the Westin is quite impressive. The architecture is still futuristic to this day and I can see why many movies have been filmed there. The lobby area is like a cross between an airport terminal, mall and Vegas hotel lobby. It’s large and bustling like an airport terminal, has several food courts and shops like a shopping mall, and features ponds and fountains that resemble a half-hearted version of the Bellagio’s atrium. Check-in was a breeze and valet parking was prompt as well. The $25-plus-tip-cost for valet is typical of most downtown LA hotels. The famous Bonaventure elevators are definitely the best feature of this hotel. The elevators are speedy and offer great views of downtown LA. Depending on which elevator you take, you’ll get a unique but equally breathtaking vista. The rooms, however, are a different story. Despite the modern outside appearance of the hotel, the drab interiors show its age. Each room’s spectacular views make up for the tight space, but the bigger problems are the peeling wallpaper, crumbling ceiling corners and worn furniture. The air vents were quite noisy, as were the neighbor’s water pipes, which we heard at all hours of the night. The bathroom was also a major problem – when we first turned on the sink tap, BROWN WATER came out of the faucet! The bathtub didn’t drain properly and we were ankle-deep during showers. The water temperature was very volatile, constantly changing back and forth from very hot to very cold, and the towels were stained. A fine layer of dust covered the counters and coffee maker. Keep in mind that this room was on the Preferred Guest floor, but it looked no different from the 21st floor room that we had originally been given. Although the hotels boast many stores and restaurants, I found that most of them had closed permanently or by 8 p.m., which was when we wanted to eat. The stores also seemed a bit cramped and like they carried old merchandise – think Chinatown. The gym was all right. If you’re brave, you can exercise using the machines right outside the elevator that are actually in the “hallway” and overlook the lobby atrium. There is also a workout facility in an enclosed room on the 3rd floor, with individual screens for each cardio machine, towels and water. The pool is small and at an odd location on the fourth floor. All in all, the Westin Bonaventure is very much like LA itself – glamorous and exciting at first, but seedy once you’ve been inside it. But that’s LA for you!

Reviews.Title: “It Was... Okay”
Reviews.Author: eddiemsmith
Reviews.Content: After years of passing by the hotel, I finally had the opportunity to be a guest at the Bonaventure last summer. It was during the NEA national convention. I wouldn't go as far as to say that I was disappointed, but I was surprised at how small I found the rooms to be. Due to the shape of the building structures, in general, I found the rooms to have an awkward shape. I was very disappointed that I wasn't able to get a courtesy frig for the entire seven days that I was there. Parking was also rather limited, being that a number of local residents were staying at the hotel. Getting around the color coded structures would be awkward, so one definitely needs a good sense of direction. There were a number dining establishments, but a number of them didn't accept credit cards, which I found to be an absolute no no for such a hotel. All and all, I didn't have a bad stay, but it wasn't what I had expected.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Service”
Reviews.Author: jyl246
Reviews.Content: Seems like all the reviews are the same so I'll try to write about different aspects. First, the service is great. I'm in the medical field so I don't get perks like business people. So, try to get a good deal on priceline. Shoot for $65-ish for weekdays. Little touches like the Hotel Operator greeting you by your name on the phone was very nice. The hotel has a lot of choices on food. Most open until 8pm-ish but I can tell that they make most of their business during lunchtime with all the LA downtown business workers strolling in. I ate most of my lunches in the hotel and only 1 dinner on the top floor Japanese restaurant. The japanese restaurant was overpriced and didn't have much of a selection...but the service was excellent. Gym: Those little 'pods' off of the track displayed on Expedia/Orbitz, etc aren't the only machines. There's a separate room with more machines and free weights. The running machines had TVs. Towels and disposable headphones are supplied. Free weights are good but only went up to 50lbs. No bench press. Internet: High speed is offered for $12.95/day. Easy to use. Parking: $25/day. The parking staff is probably the nicest on the property. The first night, I tried to look for a cheaper alternative, but most places within a 2 block radius had similar prices. There is a place called Pershing Square Parking that charged $14 overnight...but no in/out and it was 4-5 blocks away. I decided to pay for the convenience and parked at the hotel parking. Safety: I have to say, I lived in NYC for 4 years and I'm from Chicago....LA downtown is DEAD. It is perfectly safe during the day but the streets clear out at night. I felt safe on the big streets but I noticed a lot of homeless people on the sidestreets. It's ok if you're a guy but just be careful if you're a girl walking alone. Pool: Layed out twice. The pool is privately gated, but anyone can use it if they stick their hand through the gate and open it from the inside. Perfectly safe though...I'm sure 100% of the people at the pool were hotel guests. The poolside chairs/beds were very comfortable. Not your ordinary cheap poolside chairs. Other: One day the bathroom light bulbs went out. Got too lazy to tell them and decided to just use the alternate light source in the shower as the bathroom light....When I got home that night, room service had fixed the problem w/o me reporting it. Everybody greets you warmly. Just a really good experience. Yes, the beds are nice but aren't you sick of reading about this on this site? Location: about 45 minutes to Santa Monica Beach. 15 minutes to Glendale Mall. 3 minutes to Little Tokyo. 10-15 minutes to LAX. Have fun!

Reviews.Title: “Dogz love it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This is a great Hotel for Pets, they allow Pets almost anywhere, in the bars, resteraunts, and outdoor property. The Westin has many ammentites for Pets too, such as Dog beds, doog food, Dog toys, treats, and some have onsite doggy day care so you can leave your room. The Westin is probably one of the best properties for pets to com have fun..

Reviews.Title: “It's dated, but the rooms and location is ok!”
Reviews.Author: MouMou
Reviews.Content: LOCATION. The hotel is two blocks away from the Metro station. As a tourist, I would not relish battling with the LA traffic and exhorbitant parking fees. My husband and I were happily zipping around in the Metro train+bus (and the bus drivers are v helpful in guiding you where to transfer)...this hotel is well located ! HOTEL DECOR. Very dated. City within City. But hey, you get access to a 24-hr gym without charge, and there´s a lot of choices where food in concerned. This means you don´t have to be stuck with hotel food. The restaurants in the hotel offers alot more options. ROOMS. A little small but sufficient, with proper writing desk and broadband connection. You have the Heavenly Beds and Toiletries. For travellers, having a good bed to sleep in is paramount. GOOD VALUE FOR MONEY. I think this hotel is good value for money for a LAX hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good quality hotel - cool rooms”
Reviews.Author: fs1
Reviews.Content: Got this a hotel as a Priceline deal for $67 over two weeknights. It was a treat to stay at. While the downtown area around the hotel is basically dead, it's safe, and really you'll be spending most of your time in LA driving anyway. The rooms are interesting. Because of the shape of the hotel they all have curved windows - with floor to ceiling rooms. We had room 1451 - try and get a higher floor for some breathtaking views of LA. The rooms are small but beautifully renovated - Westin really has it going with the Heavenly Beds and Baths - really, really appreciated after a long day of touring the LA area. The beds were a little on the short side, I think, due to the shape of the room, but really didn't bother me at all. All those pillows made up for it! Didn't use much of the facilities but the hotel has a very cool lobby area - even about 30 (?) years after it was built, it still feels cool and futuristic. It's a great spot for the kids - I think they'd have lots of fun here. One final note about parking: Valet parking is the only option in the hotel and is $25 with in/out. I found it a bit of a pain - I really hate the whole concept on valet parking, however the system was relatively painless. It is LA, after all.... even McDonalds has valet parking... :) Enjoy your stay at the Westin - it's the most common downtown Priceline hotel, so try and get yourself a deal.

Reviews.Title: “A place that aims to delight you”
Reviews.Author: Celina
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bonaventure this week during my trip to the E3 Convention. I cannot say enough great things about the management of this hotel. I put a breakfast order on my doorknob the first night and the next morning, when time came for delivery, it didn't arrive. I called Room Service and they didn't have the order, although it wasn't on my door anymore. They apologized profusely and ten minutes later I had a hot, delicious and comped breakfast in my room. The next afternoon I came back to my room to find a fresh fruit basket and two bottles of Fiji water with a handwritten note of apology. And I never complained! I just asked nicely if the breakfast was coming. My room was not huge, but it was wonderful. An incredibly comfortable, king bed with soft luxurious linens, reading lights, a huge dresser with TV and floor to ceiling windows with a great city view. A nice sized bathroom and shower with a great double shower head. All around, very clean and very comfortable. Yes, this hotel is older, but it's still a cool place. I love all the water features in the lobby and every elevator ride is a little thrill as you rise surrounded by glass, outside the building. In short, this is a place where they truly want to delight you in ways large and small (for example, a huge bottle of free water in the room every day). I loved it there.

Reviews.Title: “Above average Westin - good for business travelers”
Reviews.Author: vandalby
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the Westin Bonaventure and had a very nice experience. I've rated it above average here and I think it's pretty close to excellent. I checked in on a Sunday night and was quickly helped by the Starwood Preferred Guest check-in agent. She didn't have any upgrades available for me, but suggested I check back the next morning. I was given a code for free internet access and a small can of jelly beans, which was a nice touch. The lobby does have a bit of a Disney / Vegas touch to it. Very 80's classy with lots of pools and fountains, including several that shoot water over the walkways (for a peak of this take a look two reviews down where the guy got several shots of the fountains, along with his hootchie - who I would rate as neutral / average). Anyway, you immediately get that large / convention hotel feel from the lobby and it rings true as this is quite a large facility. The elevator ride to the room is very enjoyable as you're transported to the exterior of the building after the 5th floor and get to enjoy some amazing, glassed-in views. My first room was a bit on the small side, although well appointed. Some of this is the result of the building being cylindrical, which causes all of the rooms to be slightly pie shaped. There are just a few hints of dating, most notably the wallpaper and carpet. The furnishings appeared to have been updated though. The Heavenly bed was great with new linens and a duvet - made for a good night's sleep. I was pleased to find a bathrobe and slippers laid out and waiting on the bed. This was a nice touch that you rarely see in hotels below the luxury level. The bathroom was clean and well appointed. The one drawback is that the countertops are built over the toilet in such a way that the seat can't remain up. The showers included a standard tub with the Westin Heavenly Shower double shower head. The following morning I checked with the front desk and was given an upgraded room to a suite. This two room, 1 and 1/2 bath had a lot of space. Again, some signs of dating in the carpet and wallpaper, but otherwise the furniture was fairly updated. The living room has the desk, TV couch and coffee table and a wet bar. The 1/2 bath is located off of this room as well. Both rooms had nice large floor to ceiling windows and great views. The bedroom was about the size of the 1st room that I had been assigned so combined with the living room I had plenty of room to move around. I ordered room service on several occasions and found that they were reliable, quick and of good quality so there were no complaints there. The menu was very standard for this type of hotel. If you've seen one Westin room service menu, you've pretty much seen them all. Overall, I had a very favorable experience at the Westin. If you're in town for business or a convention, this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great and Interesting Hotel”
Reviews.Author: rwoody
Reviews.Content: Stayed here in mid-April, and found most of the negative reviews here to be without merit. Had a very pleasant stayy. The hotel is what you would expect from a Westin. Good and prompt service. Well-appointed rooms and bathrooms. Staff were quite pleasant and helpful without being obtrusive. I agree that the cost of parking is steep ($25) but it's in line with other garages in the area. Contrary to some refviews, the buffet breakfast is $17 -- not $25 -- again not cheap, but in line with what you would find in most any similar hotel. The only legitimate complaint is the hideously overpriced restaurant (LA Prime) so have a drink in the bar -- for the view -- and then dine elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Miami Vice in downtown L.A.”
Reviews.Author: Dwarftosser1
Reviews.Content: Got this hotel on Priceline for an incredible deal, so went in with a jaded expectation -- something had to be wrong with the place. But it was a fine, fine stay. The hotel is huge and has a look and feel that is very early 80's -- concrete & steel, dark tiled floors, dated fonts. Think "The Mirage" in Vegas or a Benihana restaurant. Glass elevators featured in many movies makes for an interesting ride up. Revolving lounge on top floor harkens back to an earlier decade. To me, it all elicited a cool retro vibe that seemed to fit with L.A. Service was good, especially for a large hotel. Valet parking, while $25, was efficient and easy -- never a problem to get my car regardless of time of day. Bed and shower were top drawer. Starbucks coffee in room was complimentary. High-speed internet access cost $12.95 per day, but included unlimited domestic and local calls. Front desk even printed out my boarding pass to save me a few minutes at the airport. The Downtown area, while still devoid of the late night scene, is emerging as a dining destination and has become a lot safer in recent years. If attending a sporting event, both Dodger Stadium and the Staples Center were very short drives from the hotel (which, given the traffic, is a Godsend). While likely not the place for the family vacation, I found the hotel served my needs perfectly, and I was absolutely thrilled given the price I paid.

Reviews.Title: “Big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: 1bookworm
Reviews.Content: My best friend and I stayed here for 2 nights only because we prepaid and would have lost our money if we left early. From the reviews, pics and price we expected a first class hotel. We found the hotel to be dark and depressing. It was a weekend and the hotel was dead. Dealing with the valet parking every time you wanted to go in and out was a real pain. Our room was a 2 by 4. It literally had 2 beds both up against opposite walls with a tiny space between them to get in and out. We were there during a cold spell and the heating unit was right above my head and spewed out stale dry air--I was so congested we had to turn the heat off. On the upside, the beds were comfortable, we liked the dual heads on the shower, and the gym was decent. We will not stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “A nice business hotel in the heart of LA”
Reviews.Author: MTCSS
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Boneventure last weekend. It was very crowded for a weekend due to the LA Marathon. This was my first time here and found the room to be spacious and clean. Loved the Heavenly showerheads (2 nozzles) and Heavenly beds, Very comfortable. Starbuck's coffee comes with the room coffee maker. The place has many places to eat with a wide range of ethnic foods.

Reviews.Title: “Large and likeable”
Reviews.Author: TripAdvizahr
Reviews.Content: I stayed here while working a show at the Convention Center. I have to admit I've got a thing for hotels with glass elevators that run along the outside of the building, and the Bonaventure is one of those places. This was a really convenient location and the staff was extremely polite and helpful. The valets in the lot were fast, it was easy to hail a taxi, the breakfast buffet was surprisingly fresh and good, and the place was easy for an out-of-towner like myself to find. The rooms are standard Westin, with their really comfortable Heavenly bed and their odd double-headed Heavenly shower. The rooms had floor to ceiling windows with great city views. The hotel itself has that late 70's-early 80's futuristic style going for it - which you will either love or hate. What surprised me though were the large number of vacant stores and restaurants within their indoor shopping center. It kinda gave me a weird feeling that you could hide out in one of the many hidden areas of their shopping center and not be found by anyone. Anyway, I liked the Bonaventure and wouldn't hesitate to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “A Mega Convention Hotel”
Reviews.Author: G702TT
Reviews.Content: This is one of the largest hotels I have stayed in. Their customer base is definitely coming from conventions. Immediatly upon entering I noticed the 80's concrete look that others have mentioned. Much of the signage also had fonts that were 80's style too. This wasn't a problem for me as I loved this decade. It kind of felt like going back in time 20 years. Check-in was very efficient and it was not hard at all to find the right bank of elevators as they are all labeled by color. There are some of the complaints I have read on the shape and size of the room. They weren't that much smaller than the average Westin. And if the shape of the room is a factor that will make or break your stay, I have the following advice: Try to see that it is not possible to have square rooms in cylindrical towers. Now, that you realize this, don't reserve the hotel and go somewhere else! What mattered to me was the room was quiet, clean, well furnished and to the standards of a Westin hotel. I always love their signature heavenly bed. One negative comment: If a gift shop or business center is in a hotel, they should accept room charges. Neither of them would let me charge a purchase to my room because they claimed they were not part of the hotel. Funny, they were both right near the lobby so that would qualify as "part of the hotel" to me!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: nicholasdamian
Reviews.Content: Stayed in Bonaventure from 22nd-26th December 2005, nice suite with a separate restroom for guests. Since I stayed during Christmas time so the cleaning service people forgot to clean my room. This is an old hotel but nicely renovated. The drawback is the location which is in downtown so not much to see but very close to Chinatown and Little Tokyo if you like Asian food. Not far from Universal Studios and about 20 miles from Disneyland so not too bad. Parking has to be valet (can't self park) US25 plus tax, so please do remember when accumulating the hotel cost. But overall I enjoy my stay and I would definitely be back if I happen to be in Los Angeles again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed the bed and double head shower....loved the starbucks coffee....I did not like that the heat control was the generic hi-lo model...no specific temp controls......

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The suites are lovely and spacious and clean. Ample large towels, ample pillows, plump and comfortable comforters on a fantastic bed. VERY nice sleeping. Loved the double shower head, too, true luxury. When we had a problem in the room, the staff was very quick to help and to fix whatever the problem was. We liked having the restaurants and shops close at hand. Rooms service dessert was *great*. The hotel is very large but I don't understand why people were getting lost in it, we found it easy to navigate. Very nice lobby. Parking was expensive, but other garages in the immediate area were the same price, and the valet service was fast and good. The only negatives were: the pool was a little shabby and the windows weren't clean, but I guess that's going to be a problem in LA!

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: bounta
Reviews.Content: Just got back from l.a and stayed at the westin it was great.The service was great was upgraded to suite on arrivial dont know if that is because iam a gold starwood member.Only problem was that the restaraunts close early from mon/wed great gym and great beds

Reviews.Title: “Not bad a place to sleep”
Reviews.Author: s_panara
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveled to LA with our 13 year old daughter the week of August 28th. I got a package deal on Expedia with air for this hotel. The hotel is downtown with easy access to highways and to the more popular areas of LA like Santa Monica, Hollywood, and other beach cities. You can take public transit but we had a car. We had a standard non smoking room on the 14 floor in the red tower with 2 double beds. What to expect Hotel -the hotel is huge with 4 towers accessed by 4 elevators to each tower although you can take any elevator to gain access to your floor/room as they are all connected though the center -lower floors of the hotel have a food court although when we were there most of them were closed. There are also stores but as another reviewer pointed out, it does give the impression of a lower end mall. -the gym is nice. There is an indoor running track and a well appointed fitness room that was in use constantly. -there is an Enterprise Car Rental Agency desk on-site in the lobby of the hotel. We rented from the airport. -the pool is outdoors on the 4th floor and is just that, a pool. It was heated though. We didn't spend too much time at the pool but when on the elevator during the day, it seemed like the building shaded over it. -the lobby is a little on the dark side as there is very little natural light that comes through the concrete building. There is a glass roof in the center but it really doesn't allow for much natural light. -buffet breakfast is $17.95+ tax which is a deal when you look at their a la carte menu for breakfast in comparison. The buffet offered a wide selection and variety such as coffee, tea, orange juice, pancakes, waffles, omlets, french toast, sausages, smoked salmon, cheeses, toast, cereals, eggs benedict, The fresh fruit offered included blueberries, blackberries, raspberries, pineapple, watermelon, canteloupe and honeydew melon. We would have a big breakfast each morning that would hold us over until dinner each day. -food portions are HUGE so be warned when ordering. We had a ceasar salad with grilled chicken one night at the hotel in the cafe by the bar and asked to share it and there was enough there to feed 3 of us! -parking is valet only and costs $25 per night for hotel guests which includes tax. This is outrageous and quite frankly a money grab by the hotel. A lot across the street charged $8 per day although I am not sure if they allowed overnight parking. -rooms are relatively clean and spacious. The bathrooms are nice with granite counters and floors -towels for the most part were thick and absorbent but during our stay we had a few that although clean had awful stains on them ICK! -a robe is provided in each room but they didn't replace ours when it was thrown in with the towels after the 3 day. -the maid wasn't always consistent - sometimes the number of towels she left were more and other times less. Also it was a crap shoot when she'd put a new liner in the trash cans in both the bathroom and in the room -there is no bar fridge in the room but there is a safe -lighting is very dim, especially in the closet area where the full mirrors are located. We had dim lighting in the bathroom the first 2 days but they changed the bulbs without asking Downtown -a few Starbucks located within walking distance but only open during business hours. -restaurants within walking distance Cafe Pinot and Stef and Nick's Steakhouse which we went to - both very nice -there is not much to do or see downtown - we knew that going there but we decided to take a walk there during the day and we were not impressed at all. The downtown core is pretty run down and rough looking in comparison to other downtowns we've seen like Chicago or New York. In addition, we went for a walk downtown the first night we arrived and cut it really short as we didn't feel safe. There are ALOT of street people roaming the streets and hanging out in Perishing Square. We didn't feel as unsafe in the daytime but if I was traveling alone as a woman, I wouldn't feel safe. Getting Around -highway access is right there. You can get to anywhere if you have a car and a map. We did day trips on our own to Sequoia National Park and to San Simeon to the Hearst Castle with relative ease. Locally we visited the Queen Mary which was a waste of time, Santa Monica Pier, Hollywood (we were there for the World Music Awards 2005 and got to see a few stars walk the red carpet and be up close, Universal City Walk (for dinner), 3rd Street Promenade in Santa Monica and of course Venice Beach. -Wilshire Blvd which is a few blocks over from the hotel takes you to Rodeo Dr, Hollywood, Century City, Venice Beach, Santa Monica (about 15-20 minutes with traffic) - ask for a local map at reception or you can get one at a car rental agency. We also had our own Road Atlas which was helpful when we did the longer day trips outside of the Los Angeles area.

Reviews.Title: “had it's plusses and minuses”
Reviews.Author: Jerri_Blank
Reviews.Content: - This hotel is downtown, so there's not a lot going on nearby other than lawyer/financial offices. - It's a very large hotel. I'm Starwood gold, so I was expecting an upgrade since I was a Sun-Wed stay....but I was stuck with a standard room. - The room was in disrepair. Someone burned iron-shapes into the carpeting which was amusing. The walls had large scrapes. The tub laminate was coming off - see picture. No minibar. towels had stains. The lighting was awful and depressing. - The heavenly bed was very comfortable - but it seemed less heavenly than other Westins. Still much better than most hotels though! - The showerhead was fantsastic. Double-head with high-flow - very nice. The drain almost couldn't keep up with the water volume! - Room service was Prompt and surprisingly good. I had it several times and was never disappointed. - Isn't $25 a bit obscene for parking? - And isn't $13 for internet access a little steep? It's not even wireless! I can get free wireless access at a ghetto Extended Stay. - Closet is very small and dark. - The give you actually fairly decent coffee to make in-room. - The standard room is small. The hotel is very similar to the Westin in Atlanta. It's a round hotel. Since it's round I was unable to see any other rooms of the hotel which was nice. I loved my view of downtown, and I bet some of the other rooms had even better views. - My favorite feature was the gym. They have one part where there's a running track with little balconies with weight equipment in the open atrium, and then they had a separate newer "Reebok" workout room with really nice new equipment. The cardio equipment had personal TVs and they give you headphones with replaceable earpiece covers. The whole setup was slick, and even though it's a large hotel, it was never too full. There's also an outdoor pool, but I never used it. - There's also lots of little shops and take out restaurants in the atrium area, but it all seemed like a low-end mall. So I avoided it. I'd be willing to stay here again but I wouldn't do it on purpose unless I was guaranteed a suite. I think you can find newer/nicer facilities for the same price or less in more interesting parts of LA. It is definitely okay, but $200 is crazy high for what you get. I've stayed in Beverly Hills and West Hollywood for much less at better places. Check out the Ambrose, the Standard, or the Orlando instead.

Reviews.Title: “1961 may have been a great year...”
Reviews.Author: Lumiere
Reviews.Content: But it wasn't their best room. Granted we got a cheap rate through priceline (with tax for a Saturday night was right under $100) and that's about the most I would have paid. Parking is 25 per night and includes in/out privliges. The lobby is nice, but very lacking in ameneties for travelers. The lobby bar serves Starbucks, but the menu is very limited, there are six levels of shopping, but there were no brand name or recognizeable stores...mostly six levels of gift shops, or luggage stores. One level is fast food type shops, look to be all locally run (no franchises). The new workout room is nice and spacious. The room that we were in was directly next to the elevator in the blue tower, so when we had the lights on, you could see directly in. It was very quiet however, considering we were literally right next to it. Room was very small, with double beds (not exactly comfortable for three people who are all almost 6 feet tall. I did try to use my Starwood Preferred Guest card at check in for a room on the 26th level but was declined. The tip I had read on here may only work on a weekday or during a slow season. We made one visit to the Bonaventure Lounge on the 35th floor. It is a revolving lounge, it is very slow moving and subtle, but offers some beautiful downtown views. It is a large convention hotel, however outside of larger lines for food/beverages, it didn't feel as crowded as I'm sure it was. Valet parking was prompt and friendly. I would go back for the central location and proximity to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite place in downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: funnygal
Reviews.Content: I stay here every time I travel to LA. The rooms all have great views, with floor-to-ceiling windows. The suites are fabulous. They're actually the size of two rooms side-by-side. You enter into the living area side, which has its own, very large, marbled powder room. The living area has a desk, wet bar and fridge, sofa, chair, coffee table, and entertainment center with TV. The bedroom side is separated by heavy, sliding louvered doors. In the King suite, the bed faces the floor-to-ceiling windows. The bedroom side also has its own entertainment center with TV and a nice table and chairs. There is a hallway behind the sleeping area that leads to a large, marbled bath. Of course, the bed is heavenly. Yes, parking is $25 per night, but it is convenient. Valet service is extremely fast. The valet attendants and front desk staff are always friendly. I'd highly recommend this hotel to any business or leisure traveler.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! It was the best we visited so far”
Reviews.Author: andru_nl
Reviews.Content: Stayed in June on the 22nd floor. The room had a froor to ceiling windows with THE view and heavenly bed. We've been on the trip to US and stayed in NY, LA and SF. This was teh best hotel. We were so sorry to leave so we changed our plans and stayed for 1 more day there. The hotel itself is a giant architechtural landmark that could take you half a day to explore, with beautiful lobby/hall which is like 6 floors high. Breakfast is not included but for the 17$ we had the best buffet from all the US and their surroundings. The only minus is that hotel is in downtown so there is pretty much no shops open durinng weekend. As for the entertainment there are lots of restaurants as in the hotel (it's huge) so around it. Walking is pretty safe in the evening contrary to what we heard. Anyway when we seen what Hollywood and Sunset boulevards are (pretty much dirty mexican streets with stars on the pavement) we were so happy to stay in the downtown. Parking is expensive, but there is a 5$/night parking just in 1 block from there.

Reviews.Title: “tattered and worn”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The price was right, free parking, great bed. However, the carpet was stained, the wallpaper was stained, the room was very small and the closet was miniscule. Other than that... Would I stay there again, probably not. I would stay at the Marriott across the street. I mainly chose this hotel because of free parking and the Westin reputation. However, this hotel was originally not a Westin, but the Bonaventure, and that may be the difference. This is the first time I have been disappointed in a Westin property.

Reviews.Title: “A feast for the eyes--Travelling girl”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: It's true what the other reviewers say--book with a online discount agent. The hotel was situated right off the 110. Exit off Whilshire and make a left at the first light, a right at 4th St, then a right at Flower St to get to the hotel parking. Hotel parking was $25 with unlimited entry but it's valet parking so you may have to tip. Toting your bags from this area may also be cumbersome so you may require a bellman--that translates to more tipping. After going up a set of escalators you will arrive on the main floor of the hotel. The main floor contains a vast assortment of water features. Each elevator is designated by colour and shape. If you are afraid of heights this is not the hotel for you as the glass elevators provide a great view of the skyline as you head to your room. I stayed on the 30th floor in the Red Tower. The room was satisfactory. The hotel has turn down service so don't be afraid to use it. The only downfall of the room was that they did not provide a minibar (even though there was a locked fridge). When I called downstairs for a refrigerator they said that there weren't any available. Why didn't they just unlock the fridge that was already in the room? Nevertheless, the robes and beds added a nice touch. FYI: The pool is outdoors and is opened by hotel room key--although you can just stick your hand through the gate and open it from the other side! This isn't too comforting as the pool is easily accessible to the public from the street. The hotel should know that signs that mention it is only for the use of hotel guests don't always work The Starbucks in the hotel lobby doesn't contain all of your favorites so you may have to go across the street to get your usual fix.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, paid too much for parking!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The room itself was very nice. We had to wait approx. 1/2 hr because hotels didn't put in our reservation by the time we arrived. Luckily I printed the confirmation via email. The girl at the front desk gave us a "really nice room" for our wait. Parking on the other hand was unbearable and $25 per night. You cannot go to your car easily if you need to retrieve something. It was quite ridiculous! Restaurants also closed very early for a Friday night. Again, room was grea t, parking bad. Good chance we won't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a business hotel”
Reviews.Author: mlasser
Reviews.Content: First off, I'm not someone's wife reviewing hotels while my husband is off working. I'm a working stiff road warrior like many of you. I'm so sick of these wives writing nice reviews of crappy properties. THe Bonaventure is a mess. Stained carpets. Clueless valets. Small cramped rooms (They mirror one wall so it will feel bigger. Newsflash, if you need to mirror a wall your hotel has very small room or charges by the hour.). No desk, just a very shaky table. No desk chair. THe loungers feel like you'll fall right through them. Crappy restaurants in what they call the Galleria. No mugs for coffee. The in room set up has paper cups just like Best Western. Valet parking is $25/day. THe uber hip Standard hotel a block away is $8/day. Nothing much going for it. THe Standard is a cooler choice. The Marriott is a more professional choice.

Reviews.Title: “A Nice Stay, A Bad Location”
Reviews.Author: ktbear7476
Reviews.Content: I'll start with the good. The AC unit in our room was making a weird noise so I called the front desk. They sent maintenance (rather quickly) to come check it out. We were told by maintenance that it would take about 2 hours to fix and would it be ok if they moved us to another room. I said that would be fine. I was a bit worried that the AC issue was going to be a big problem because we booked through Priceline and a lot of times hotels treat you like a second class citizen because you did not book with them. I was really happy that this was not the case. We really liked the decor of the rooms, the beds were quite comfy and there was a fridge in the room! A welcome change from all of the other 4* hotels that only provide you with a minibar. My only issue is the location. On our last adventure to LA we stayed in Santa Monica and I think that is a much better location for a tourist, that being said, I really enjoyed our stay at the Bonaventure.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: pashber
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a stay at the Bonaventure. We got a great rate through Travelzoo for $99, which included the free valet parking (normally $25).
